Reviews.Title: “Let me start by saying I am an owner.”
Reviews.Author: kingmatyas
Reviews.Content: I just wrapped up my most recent stay to the resort nestled up next to Southpoint. The most recent, previous stay was in the Primrose building three years ago, and we had a great time then. All pools were open, resort was meticulous, was told in the "owners update" meeting that unless we switched to points we wouldn't get to stay in the new buildings. Fast forward to April 20th. Late check-in, after a 5.5 hour drive. Staff was ready and happy to greet us when we showed up. I asked if we would be staying in the same room as before, but they said I hadn't yet been assigned. I asked if I could stay in one of the new buildings close to a pool and they put me in just that! I declined owners updates as I like to play as much poker as possible while in Vegas, and last time I lost half of my chips while trying to finish up... Room was immaculate. No wear and tear at all. We had a view of the western skyline (some unforgettable sunsets during a storm), as well as the new building that is currently having its first floor layed out. Found out the main pool was closed for resurfacing. No big deal, there are three others on the property. We love this place. For a week stay in Vegas, you cannot beat it. We would hit the strip whenever we wanted and be low-key the other times. Southpoint is a great casino for those not interested in the hustle and bustle of those on the strip. The "free" shuttle we were used to is now an $8 per person all day shuttle. Where before we would only be able to meet up with it at Excalibur, now they added Southpoint, Aria, and TI. $8 is still a great deal for all day transportation to and from the strip. Cab fare to the strip via the freeway is right around $20. The on-site coffee/convenient store was the same. Lacking luster as far as breakfast is concerned. I have yet to try lunch or dinner. I couldn't seem to get a grill to light up so was forced to use one that was never scrubbed down. My suggestion to the resort would be for them to install wire brushes on each grill that are anchored down. That way I don't have to scrape the previous travelers meal off with the other end of my grilling tools before I get started. That was a very unfortunate thing, I like a clean grill. Overall a great trip. Construction was a bit annoying, especially the blow horns, but it was impressive how quickly they laid the concrete for the new building, maybe in three years I'll stay in that one.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Timeshare Property”
Reviews.Author: alykay19
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Rosemary Building on the 18th floor and it was very quiet. We had the A/B suites and they were very nicely appointed. This hotel is down near the SouthPoint so it is well off the "strip", which we liked. We had a rental car so we could get to anywhere on the strip, but we enjoy staying a bit off the strip crazy path. The Silverado casino is alos near there....so if you want to gamble you can hit the SouthPoint or the Silverado...both family-friendly places. Southpoint has a bowling alley and movie theatre. Notes of caution: The pool does lose the sun to shade fairly early in the day, and the main pool was closed for repairs. Rosemary bldg is pretty far from the check in bldg which has the computer lounge and staff help. But, overall, this was a place we did like and would go to again.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!...”
Reviews.Author: commanderkls
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Grandview for a week in April. Absolutely fabulous beds, we slept great. Facilities were outstanding. Even the parking lots were clean. We simply declined the initial request to attend the 90 min. timeshare presentation and never heard another word about it. I was a bit surprised at the charge for wireless service, but we opted to pull into a McD when convenient, or use the internet lounge in the main building. At Grandview you're about 7 miles south of the strip, but you're also out of the traffic and crazy. We had a rental car for the week so this was a great location. We ordered pizza one night from Scotty Beans (on-site eatery). They were quick to deliver, but the pizza seemed like a good frozen variety, nothing special.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: EH369
Reviews.Content: Front desk needs to be more friendly, Cleaning staff were friendly, They closed main pool(school vacation week) and other pools were very crowded, Great location next to South Point.

Reviews.Title: “Valentine's Day in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: five2nine
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay at the Grandview Hotel and Timeshare in Las Vegas. We booked a double condo room for us and my sister and her husband for a week. We were more than delighted when we saw the rooms. We had one main door off the hall that opened into a foyer with suites A and B. We each had rooms that were mirror images of each other with full kitchen, spa tubs, a huge bathroom with a shower, large closet, large TV screen with seating for six, and a dining table for four, plus a washer and dryer! We could open our suite doors and just walk in between our rooms without going through the hallway. It was fun having two kitchens to "prep" food in, saving us money to spend on other fun things. We did not have a balcony which would have been nice, but we enjoyed what we did have. We were close to the Las Vegas Outlets and really enjoyed shopping there, plus we were right beside The South Point Casino and got to see movies for just $4 for seniors and enjoy a great buffet. It was quite windy so we didn't use the pool but our overall experience was awesome. We got a great deal on the room through Vacation Voyages, so for the price, we are sure to come again!

Reviews.Title: “waste of money”
Reviews.Author: naomi s
Reviews.Content: We checked in with another couple in the 2 bedroom suite. Neither one of the jacuzzi's were clean, called housekeeping twice. They could not get them to stop blowing black things out of the jets. The stove in one of the rooms did not work. toilet ran constant, a piece of plastic came flying out of the garbage disposal when it was turned on. They finally moved us to another room, after our frineds left and went some where else. And the jucuzzi did the same thing. The stove would not work, the a/c would not turn on, and the toilet ran in it too. Let's just say for the money we spent we should have not had to go through this. I will NOT recommend this place to any one!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Family Trip to Vegas not on the strip!”
Reviews.Author: LJRII
Reviews.Content: The Grandview is a great place to stay with family without the hoopla of the strip. We stayed in the newest building on a high floor at the back of the property. It's a vacation rental spot, so you don't need to call room service. There are plenty of places that will deliver if needed. Rooms are spacious w/ nice size bathrooms, clean, w/ full kitchen. Just head to the nearby grocery store(away from the strip). The pools are OK and the exercise rooms are nice. (weight/machine room & cardio room) The game room needs some imagination and updating. The staff is extremely nice and responsive. I would stay here with family again. There are plenty of promotions to stay here or nights on the strip. Check them out. A great place to stay with family. An easy drive to Hoover Dam, Valley of Fire, Red Rock Canyon, and even closer to the Las Vegas strip.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of the weather during visits in April to Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: VacationersLA
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival, I can't say enough about how wonderful it was to be immediately checked into our room even though we had arrived early. It was a really nice welcome to a new vacation spot. There was an issue with the room only that it wasn't the location that the desk clerk and I thought that it was, so we asked to be moved and the hotel was quick to accomodate. The staff was polite and things moved smoothly after that point. Now, this part is just a warning and has nothing to do with this resort, as even they can't control nature! lol As the week progressed, we were expecting the weather to be in the 80's and here is where my warning about Las Vegas weather comes in... be ware that it isn't always the case there, especially when you factor in HIGH winds. There were days where the pool had to be shut down for safety reasons, because the pool side furniture blew into the pool over and over again. Also, rather than the 80 degrees that we were expecting, we got 50's and 60's most of the days and 70-80 only one or two of the 8 days and 7 nights that we were there. NOT ideal, but again this had nothing to do with the hotel. If you are allergy prone, one thing that may help you to enjoy your visit better is to bring your allergy medicine with you. One of our children and I lived off of allergy medicine the whole trip. The wind kicked up spores among other things and it really cause a painful, swelling, type of reaction each day. This could be something that only caused an issue for our family, but just in case it is always good to prepare ahead of time. The issues that we had pertaining to the resort, were mainly due to the pool temperature. We called prior to booking our trip to investigate if the pools were heated; would the heat be turned on in the pools while we were there and how many pools were there? The answers that we received were: The pools are kept at 83 degrees; YES the heat would be on in the pool while we were there and there are 5 pools plus other hot tubs there. We were thrilled to hear this and booked our vacation. While at the resort, the pools that we located were ice cold for the first three days. We finally made it to the one pool which was heated on the fourth day. Then, because out of all the pools there having a temp no where near 80 degrees and closer to Freezing, (we later found out through other guests that ALL but this pool were cold), it appeared that every pool seeking guest was packed into the warm pool. When you consider the sun block, oils and skin of everyone melding together into a single soup, that is the cloudy look that the water had. We didn't even want to get into it at all. Now, the upset that we had is that while at the resort we contacted the staff multiple times without any pool temperature change, before the manager got involved and checked the pools. Once this happened we were at the end of our trip and had literally about an hour of laying out by the warm pool which was so packed and gross that we didn't get to go in and a couple of us ended up with colds trying to make do with the Freezing pools. Because the pool had be closed a day and then the other pools were cold, we didn't get any fun pool time. When I brought this to the manager's attention, they did their best to help fix the issue for us and also helped to end our vacation on a better note. For that, we were thankful. As well traveled individuals who frequently vacation and expect our accomodations to be as promised by staff and reviews, we were happy to receive what we consider to be proper customer care by the higher ups. This DID benefit them for the future as we intend to remain customers of their resort and visit them again this summer and potentially bring more family with us. Because this next visit will be at a different time of year, we expect there to be no pool issues and we can only hope that Mother Nature cooperates this time around! :) Some good things: VERY close to a Walmart for less costly food purchase 10 minutes from the strip which is close enough, yet far away for quiet and relaxation 20 minutes from Nellis AFB (If you are military) The commissary is there and you can food shop there and get tickets to places The resort sells discounted tickets as well, however you must pay in cash only and there is an 18% tax charge The Casino next door is South Point and it's convenient and not bad to try a few hands of BJ or play the slots. Also has places to eat, but it's really costly; a bowling ally and a movie theater are also inside. Thinngs to consider with kids: Something that I wasn't expecting is that children seem to be allowed in the casinos. I don't really like to bring them in though because there is SMOKING in every one. It's NOT what you would want your kids around while on a family trip if you aren't a smoker or have a child that is asthmatic. Example: Getting to Circus circus' Adventure dome. Another thing to keep in mind is that most of the shows or kid's entertainment or dinner shows causes you to walk through the casinos that are smoke filled and also have scantily dressed female card dealers or table top dancers all over the place. I mean practically naked in many cases. Example: Getting to the Excalibur dinner show. A place that takes a lot of walking, but NOT through casinos and is child friendly and fun would be to go to the Mandalay Bay Aquarium. Long line, but still Fun! Also, probably for older children the Wax museum was a stand alone place to visit and had plenty of celebs to take pics with. Hope that some of this is helpful. :)

Reviews.Title: “Still nice, but getting tired...”
Reviews.Author: Jane9383
Reviews.Content: We have been visiting the Grandview since it opened. It is always clean and the beds/linens comfortable and of high quality. However, there are things the resort is letting get very rundown. The pullout sofa in our unit was so uncomfortable that our adult daughters couldn't sleep. The fitness center is crowded with very old machines that have been clearly repaired over and over and do not work well. The weight room is in a separate area from the cardio equipment which is very inconvenient. The weight equipment is so bad that my husband wouldn't even touch it. We also had problems with housekeeping. They woke us up cleaning the room next door during the midweek cleaning. On checkout day they pounded on the door at 8 am. It is nice that this resort does not hassle you with a sales pitch if you say no. The location away from the strip is quiet, but it is so easy to get to the strip quickly!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: MDSRegina
Reviews.Content: We have stayed twice at Grandview now and enjoy being away from the hustle and bustle of the strip resorts. The condo is well equipped and the pool areas are nice. We are owners at another resort and have traded twice for this property and were not disappointed, we were not harassed by the timeshare sales in the least, said no at check in and that was the end of it.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay with the family!”
Reviews.Author: GuinnessGus
Reviews.Content: We stayed here recently with our boys, and it was a new experience coming to Vegas, staying outside of the action on the strip, and actually having a rental car. The property was very well maintained, clean, and the staff was very professional, friendly, and attentive. It is located right across the street from the South Point Casino on the southern part of Las Vegas Blvd if you need a gambling fix, to place a bet in the sports book, or to grab a late night burger/shake. The resort has multiple pools throughout the complex to include a kids pool. We stayed in the Sage building which is very close to the front of the complex, and I would definitely not recommend this building, as the foot traffic and tours of the timeshares sales people are constantly rolling through this building all morning/afternoon. Annoying. There was a cardio room and weight room by the main pool behind the Sage pool that was pretty outdated and quite packed in the morning if you were trying to get a workout in unfortunately. I would definitely stay here again, but would be more selective and ask to not be put in the Sage building.

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Resort”
Reviews.Author: PSS_10
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a week at the Grandview. We are timeshare owners and traded to this location.We had a one bedroom unit. After reading previous Trip Advisor reviews, we asked about being in the Daisy or Rosemary newer units when called about the reservation and again at check in. Luckily, we were able to get on the 16th floor of the Rosemary. There is an outer door from the hallway. Then, there are two separate units within. The unit had two flat screen televisions (one in living room area and one in the bedroom), granite counters in the kitchen, a nice big shower with clear doors, a seating area between the bathroom's double sinks, a washer/dryer in the unit, and a sleeper sofa. There was a jacuzzi between the bedroom and bathroom. The decor was modern and tastefully done. There was a DVD player, which we didn't use. The unit has a safe, which you will be asked if desired to be used at check in for $10. We called twice during the visit for maintenance issues, and within 15 minutes, the item was corrected. Carlos worked on our first item and was very determined to fix our issue. The next one was a light out in the hallway, which was quietly fixed within the hour. There are 21 floors according to the elevator but no floor 13. LIght housekeeping was done on Tuesday of our stay, the place was tidied and fresh towels were given. The entire week was very quiet, although we knew the building was packed by the parking areas. The nice thing is that there is a two floor parking garage at the end of the building, so we may have had to use a side door and walk a little further but it was well lit and always had space. My husband used the Fitness Center and said it had a variety of equipment. There is a deli/gift shop across from it. I used the Business Center in the main building to check the Internet and print items. There are about 6 or 7 computers in there. The resort is right next to the South Point Casino. Our first night, we just walked over to Steak and Shake. Check out is at 10 a.m. It really is no fuss to check out. You just take out the trash, which has a room with a trash shute down the hall, put linen in the tub, load the dishwasher, and leave keys on the counter. You then call the main number for check out. Some timeshares really make you work to check out! There is security who are regularly seen around the resort. We were called about the timeshare presentation but declined and were not called again. The resort is about 20 minutes from the strip. We rented a car to help get around during the week. The resort's weekly bulletin of activities was posted in all elevators. The three elevators are very quick and quiet. There's wasn't one jam or crowded time the entire week. One thing about the television, in the newer buildings, there is HBO on channels 95-97. In the other buildings, you can order first run movies. By the map the resort provided, we found shopping facilities close by on Silverado Ranch Boulevard. There's a Target, Walmart, banks, Dollar Tree, Marshalls, and other stores as well as fast food restaurants. Most of our week was very windy but did see a few people in the outdoor pool. This is the largest resort we've stayed and were very impressed. I cannot say enough good things about it!

Reviews.Title: “Great family resort!!”
Reviews.Author: Kyser5
Reviews.Content: We had two rooms which were adjoined by a foyer. We are owners so we stayed in the daisy building floor 18 and it was amazing! One of the pools was not heated but the others were which was very nice for late night swims! I would recommend this resort if you have a car and small children it's easy to get to the strip. It's only 25 minutes to red rock canyon which is a must if you're going to Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “Spacious suites with full kitchen”
Reviews.Author: Kzw2
Reviews.Content: We were in Vegas for our kid's soccer tournament and the Grandview met all of our expectations. The full kitchen was nicely equipped and we stocked up at the Fresh n Easy grocery store nearby. There were plenty of pools which the kids enjoyed exploring and the game room was a hit as well.  The suite was very clean. The location is right off the 15 which allowed for quick commutes to the other side of town and it is far enough from the strip that you can bypass that area altogether if desired. We loved that the two bedroom suites were actually two separate 1br suites which allowed us to share costs with another family and yet have complete privacy.  Overall a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great place but they always want more money”
Reviews.Author: MontrealErt
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay because fairly new, units are very clean, furniture and furnishing are nice, grounds impeccable. Ample parking. A bit off the strip, at the South part, will need a car. What is bad is that they charge for in-room safe (10$$$) and worse they charge for internet usage, wireless in-room. 50$$$$$$$ for the week. In 2012, I can't believe they charge us for that! The speed was also very very very slow.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Browning2000
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at The Granview for three years in a row. We love the area (although you need to rent a car) as it is away from everything but close enough to enjoy everything. The stores are fairly close and the strip is 6.2 miles. We make out Walmart runs to get water, snacks etc. The check in was smooth and the staff was friendly. They will ask if you would like to tour the timeshare but they were not pushy. I see people complain about the tour and it was their choice to take it. They do give free things away for the people interested in the tour but it is still a choice. All in all we live staying st the Grandview and three years in a row we have never had a problem.

Reviews.Title: “Grand View”
Reviews.Author: GraceDCanada
Reviews.Content: The hotel was great. A booklet full of discounts and freebies. Free internet. Quite a distant from the main strip but good bus service. Get a 5 day pass for the bus. People were very helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great off the strip hotel”
Reviews.Author: mcjardine
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful 7 day stay . Immaculate suite! fully equipped kitchen, full sized washer and dryer , huge bathroom , separate jacuzzi , seperate bedroom , huge living room all in over 800 sq ft. Located directly next to the South Point Casino. We had a rental car so the downtown area was readily accessed . This property has 5 separate swimming areas including hot tubs , we only used 3 areas , Word of caution!!1 ,, if you use the hot tubs rinse off immedaitely or have a swim afterwards as we all got hot tub itch {Pseudomonus bacteria} . Staff are all very pleasant ,security staff very present at all times .

Reviews.Title: “OUR EXPERIENCE OF GRANDVIEW AT LAS VEGAS”
Reviews.Author: MIKE F
Reviews.Content: Resort good. Staff very helpful. Rosemary block apts very comfortable, just abide the instructions not to use the jet bath after 10.00 pm. not nice for your neighbour if you forget! We were on the receiving end of the problem twice! South Point fine, some O.K restaurants but were not happy with Silverado, over priced and overrated, in fact very poor in our opinion, would not try again. Very disappointed. Primarily Prime Rib, Don Vito's and Big Sur great. Enjoy your time.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay off the Strip”
Reviews.Author: wepaktogo
Reviews.Content: This was our third stay at The Grandview and will definitely go back. Comfortable, clean and quiet. Well kept grounds and the pools are clean. Having a washer/dryer in the unit is a huge bonus. Check in was very quick and front desk staff are professional and friendly. Across the road from South Point Hotel and Casino which is a great hotel with 9 restaurants and good entertainment in the evenings. Another great place to eat is The Boulevard, on opposite side of the road to Grandview. Great menu; but definitely try the pizza. Grandview is approximately 15 minutes from The Strip by car. Very convenient location. Suggestions for management to consider: - Please buy new pillows. Our unit had horrible pillows; hard blocks of solid rubber or pillow cases filled with foam chips. Very uncomfortable and hot. We ended up buying two pillows from Walmart. - Please consider a definitive policy regarding guest late night checkout. Our flight wasn't until 11.30 p.m. and we wanted to stay until at least 7 p.m. before checking out. However, although very pleasant the front desk staff could not give us a day rate and we were told to contact the Manager on Saturday afternoon (we were checking out on Sunday) as he was the only person with the authority. We did not want to wait that long for an answer so went across the road to South Point and got an excellent day rate. A standard policy on such matters would really help guests with late night flights.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay - just a few minor criticisms”
Reviews.Author: HubbysNumpty
Reviews.Content: We bought a timeshare here as more of an investment rather than to stay in it but we stayed for one week and had a very nice time. Check-in was friendly and efficient and we were given free vouchers to use at the South Point casino next door. Apartment was nicely decorated and clean. We're tidy people anyway so the house-keeper didn't have much to do but the bed was made and and no criticisms there. Nice jacuzzi-tub, basically nice to have all the mod-cons. The only surprise was that there was no electric kettle, just one that needed to go on the electric cooker. The local on-site deli had the basics and did nice snack foods/drinks etc. There are bigger stores nearby (with a car) like Food For Less. The pool by the deli was a bit small, kids seemed to love it despite it looking like it needed a bit of a clean - lots of floaty bits. Towels and sun-loungers provided. There is a gym and BBQ areas but we didn't use. In a room near reception there is free website access with free tea and coffee (I think from 7am-11am). It's about 10-15mins to the Strip but all the casinos had free parking so not really a hassle. Minor criticisms:- 1. Not enough parking spaces immediately by the block we were in but a undercover garage nearby. 2. Wifi in room $9 a day. 3. Walls a bit thin, the snorer next door was a nightmare for a couple of nights - can offenders please use snoring strips! Other than that we had a good stay and we weren't in the apartment for much of the time anyway but if you stay on site then there's pretty much everything you need on-site and in the casino next door. If you can't utilise a time-share to its absolute fullest to make it financially worthwhile then don't buy one. They are pushy but that's their job so think very carefully before you do. Also note that to trade in your weeks for the free holidays (if they still offer that) - they don't come out and say it straight but you can only book the resort of your choice 45 days before departure which is a hassle for booking cheaper flights.

Reviews.Title: “Pushy Sales / paper thin walls”
Reviews.Author: 222JC_222
Reviews.Content: - Walls between units are paper thin and you could literally hear full conversations next door. - Window in one unit wouldn't close and had been stuffed with paper towel and taped with masking tape to stop the howling of the wind....needs to be fixed. - "tidy" that was done half way through the week was poor. Counters in bathroom and table were not wiped although the card said there was a counter wipe done. - Wireless Internet is WAY too expensive. $50 for one week, per computer, is insane! - VERY pushy timeshare pitch - don't do sign up for it! They will run way over the time they say and you feel like you are never going to escape. The first sales person was friendly, however, the second actually one got angry when we said we weren't interested, but it didn't end there. We still had one more salesperson take a run at us and then finally we were passed off to two more who finally let us out of the building. A very painful experience. - Service of the tour booking area was very poor. If you aren't looking to buy something, then they aren't interested in helping you at all.

Reviews.Title: “Grandview - Gets better with age”
Reviews.Author: team2win
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Grandview on several occassions. Most notable when they 1st opened. Now with new buildings stayed in 1br/1ba unit for a week. The unit looks very nice and clean. There's a jacuzzi tub, full kitchen with all the utensils you need, living/dining room with flat screen tv, sofa sleeper, washer/dryer in unit, plenty of towels. bedroom also has flat screen tv, closet, safe, the jacuzzi tub,plenty of space in the dresser for your clothes. Housekeeping stops bye once during the week we stayed(timeshare use). They still charge for wifi use for your laptop, but you can use their computers with 15 minute time allocations for free. There's also a game room above the checkin center.. Plenty of pools on the property and outside jacuzzis. There's even a kids pool/family pool and adult pool on site. Parking is free. Around the pools, there are gas grills and tables for your outdoor bbq. The resort has security on staff and I've never, ever have seen a problem at this place. The front desk is open 24/7. The resort is next to the South Pointe Casino, which is a huge casino now. Theatres, buffet, dinner/lunch, gaming, poker room, shows, etc are all at South Pointe Casino. The location is far down South Las Vegas Blvd, I'd say about 5 - 6 miles south of Mandalay Bay, but an onramp to I-15 is right here less than 1/2 mile away, so getting to the strip is simple/easy. I love this location because its not near the strip, cause the strip is not car friendly any longer... you can sit in traffic for 20-30 minutes just to go down a mile or two where all the casinos are... The checkin was easy, everyone was nice and friendly. There wasn't a resort fee either for our stay. The cons: paying for wifi service, albeit was about $39.95 for a week. Plus they no longer have the free wifi ethernet hookup for laptops in the computer room..

Reviews.Title: “Great Accomodations about 15 minutes from the strip!”
Reviews.Author: md_ocr
Reviews.Content: I booked a 2 bedroom suite (A&B) in the Rosemary building for myself, husband, and parents. We were excited to be in the newest building, but were a bit disappointed to walk in and see a dark, depressing room (although it was nicely decorated). Since I love sun and natural light, I immediately called down to the lobby to see about getting our room switched. Over the phone, they told us that nothing was available and to wait 2 hours until people check out to see if something would pop up. After the 2 hours, we decided to call back, and they said that we couldn't change because we "used" the room. I spoke with a manager and explained that we just sat on the sofa and watched TV until the 2 hours were up because that's what we were instructed to do. We didn't even use the bathroom. Nonetheless, I drove to the lobby to get this sorted out. Once I got to the lobby, I spoke with the supervisor in person, and they did give us a new, brighter room in the Sage Building, which was just as nice. From that point on, everything was great! Wonderful accommodations, big comfy bed, with great pillows, a full kitchen, a jacuzzi and full bath too. We did have to call down to the lobby a few times because the walls are VERY thin and are neighbors decided to have a jacuzzi party at 4am for 3 nights in a row. Other than that, everything was great. They used to offer a free shuttle to take you to the grocery store, etc...but they were no longer providing that service when we went in December 2011. Lastly, there is a big casino next door (Southcoast), which is pretty convenient.

Reviews.Title: “kkdm”
Reviews.Author: kkdm
Reviews.Content: We Just returned from a 5 day stay at the Grandview, and we thoroughtly enjoyed our stay. The staff were very helpful and respectful.The location is very Quiet and easy to get to. The in Suite washer and dryer was very nice to have. I agree with 1 other review that the lack of reliable wifi is a bit of an inconvenience, but overall our stay was very enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Escape from Sin City”
Reviews.Author: slbutler81
Reviews.Content: I love Grandview and all of the amenities that it has to offer. My family and I actually booked a stay at another timeshare and also booked a room at this location for some family members that wanted to join our Thanksgiving in Vegas trip. Since my husband and I are the RCI owners, we decided to take the tour and stay one night at Grandview. I have to say that I loved the casino next door. I had more fun being away from the strip at this property versus staying on the strip the rest of the trip. The rooms were comfortable and really big. The staff was really helpful and for once in my life, when I thought I had an issue after leaving Vegas, someone actually returned my phone call GASP. That says a lot to me, because most timeshare places rarely have the same people call you back months later. As for the casino next door...I enjoyed playing all of the games, went to the movie theater inside and also participated at the bowling lanes. It was a great experience. We have decided that if we do make it back to Vegas, we will not split time, we will spend our entire week at the Grandview.

Reviews.Title: “Good and Bad”
Reviews.Author: jwh2008
Reviews.Content: Have stay here numerous times and always been most happy. This trip we stayed in Iris building and had numerous issues include noise. Overall this was something of a big let down from previous stays.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely”
Reviews.Author: JannyKevin
Reviews.Content: We spent our family vacation here Feb 17-24th. The resort and our 1 bedroom unit was clean, spacious, well stocked, and had a great location. Close enough and far enough away! We would definitely recommend. The only draw back was the lack of free wifi...that should really be a given this day & age! That is really all that is missing to make this a 5-star!

Reviews.Title: “Escape to "Sin City"”
Reviews.Author: WealthProsperity
Reviews.Content: We just spend one week at the Grandview in Vegas. It was interesting, knowing that this resort is located away from the "Strip". It was quiet. Rooms are comfortable and nicely decorated. We did not realized that it was so far to the Grand Canyon (5hours one way). We decided to go there next time from different location. If you go to Vegas you must see the Hoover Dam, make sure that you go for the whole tour of the dam - its well worth it. Also weather permitting see the Vally of Fire - wonderful scenery.

Reviews.Title: “It works”
Reviews.Author: islandrockin
Reviews.Content: After reading a lot of reviews before arriving I was well aware of what type of accommodation this property is.Having said that we liked the place we stayed in the Primrose building and it was slightly tired but it was adequate.The room itself was very large with a complete kitchen,washer dryer etc.A living and dining room area that were spacious.Our view of the pool was nice.The bathroom was large and had a very big shower and double sinks.There is a large tub in the bedroom.We had a one bedroom unit.It was clean overall.The king bed was very comfortable and made for a good nights sleep.The carpets in the hallway are showing their age.This is not a full service resort but good accommodation.The South Point Casino being right next door makes this place much more attractive than if it wasn't there.Lots of restaurants at South Point we ate there a couple of times and it was good. The pool area was good for hanging out on a sunny day.Nice gym.The little deli was also handy.It has everything you need just not on a grand scale or high end but good enough We rented a car which I think is a must for this location and traveled to the strip a few times and went to Hoover Dam etc.Grocery stores and malls are all within a few minutes drive as was the strip maybe 10-15 min depending on traffic we found driving on Hwy 15 probably the easiest and quickest Obviously this is a different experience than the strip and one that we enjoyed

Reviews.Title: “Great Place!”
Reviews.Author: Molly M
Reviews.Content: We are owners and have stayed at the Grandview three times. We love it there since it is not in the busy part of Las Vegas. We always rent a car so transportation is not an issue. It is pretty easy to get around in Vegas and most of the parking garages on the strip and downtown validate so there is no problem parking. The staff at the Grandview is extremely courteous and helpful. The rooms are very nice with full kitchens, washer/dryer, and jacuzzi tub. It is the cleanest property we have stayed at also. Another perk is the South Point casino right across the street which has an amazing breakfast buffet and has a nice casino also. Our daughters are going to stay at the Grandview with their friends this week for spring break and can' wait!

Reviews.Title: “Not my favorite....”
Reviews.Author: Jilie D
Reviews.Content: The location of this property leaves a lot to be desired if you desire a true Las Vegas experience. A cab to the strip will run you $35 plus tip. Do not depend on the shuttle service, it is a concession to the property, they dont run it themselves, iit is unreliable, it is for a fee (not mentioned in their literature) and dont expect the management at the Grandview to help you out if they dont show up on schedule. If you are a family looking for a place in the sun this is probably a good property for you. You will be far, far away from the glitz and glamour of the Vegas Strip. If on the other hand you are looking for fun under the neon, skip this one. The room that we stayed in was in one of the new buildings and it was very nice. Ask for the Daisy or Rosemary buildings. The staff was in general accomodating. Security was very evident on the property. Internet is expensive if you need it for a week it's $50 (a nice profit center for them.) A pretty good property except for the LOCATION!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay in the Rosemary”
Reviews.Author: badney
Reviews.Content: We booked our three-night stay in a two-bedroom unit through RCI about a month ahead of time for a girls getaway (myself, my 7 year-old daughter and my mother). We arrived on a Wednesday afternoon and catching a cab from the airport was a breeze. It was approx. $35 for the ride and it took less than 15 minutes. Checking in mid-week was simple. We were given a two-bedroom unit on the 18th floor in the Rosemary building, which is one of the newest buildings. We hitched a ride on a golf cart with all of our luggage, which was nice. The rooms are very nicely appointed, modern and clean. We had a view of the Jasmine building's rooftop, the kiddie pool and the city/mountains to the east - made for beautiful sunrises each morning. The rooms, while good sized, would be a little tight for a family of four if you had just one room. The one bathroom was large, long vanity with double sinks on either end and it was lowered in the middle so you could sit on the available bench and apply your makeup! The shower was nicely sized and hot water was almost instantaneous throughout the unit. My daughter took a bath in the jacuzzi tub one night and loved it. (Note, the tubs, even when filling up are very noisy for your neighbors, be courteous and not run them after 10pm! Our neighbor one night drew a bath at midnight and woke us up out of dead sleep. Sounded like the radio alarm came on, very loudly, on a station with just static!) The first two nights (Wed & Thu) were very quiet, but Fri night was louder as I believe the hotel was close to capacity. Since we had a two-bedroom, we had two kitchens, which we only used to brew tea/coffee each morning! If we were staying a full week, it definitely would have been used more. We did make a trip to Scotty's (the onsite cafe/deli and little store) and bought a carton of milk and waters. Having the South Pointe Casino next door is a plus. My mom and I signed up for their club card on their website prior to arrival and picked up the card at the casino. This card gave us a discount on the buffet, which was decent. We ate the buffet for our first dinner and then ate at the Steak N Shake the next two nights. We used the shuttle service (Ritz Transportation) for our trips to and from the strip. It picks up at the Grandview at the top of the hour and you can get off at the Excalibur, Aria or Treasure Island. It picks up in those same locations (top of the hour at TI, 20 after at Aria and 40 after at Excalibur). It was $8pp for the whole day, they give you a business card with the date and how much you paid on the back as your 'ticket to ride.' We were very confused though when it came to paying for my 7 year-old. The first morning I paid for her, but the night driver who drove us home that evening said I shouldn't have paid for her, that children under 12 are free. Ok. The next morning we got on board and I told the driver (different than the morning before) that I was told by the night driver I shouldn't have paid for my daughter and I asked for credit. He wouldn't give it to me, but said I just needed to pay for myself. On our way home that evening the driver (again, a different man) got upset and said I most definitely needed to pay for my daughter because she takes up a seat and I basically ripped off the company. He went on about this for a good two minutes, making me feel quite angry. Perhaps a written policy displayed in the bus is in order?! Overall, I would stay here again for sure. It is nice to be off-strip at night, as it is much quieter. The rooms in the Rosemary are very nice and plenty big for two people. If more than two, and you have the opportunity/$$ to get a two-bedroom, book it!

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT AWAY FROM THE BUSY STRIP”
Reviews.Author: dipex
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 7 nights in a one-bedroom apartment. It had just about everything, with a fully equipped kitchen, large bathroom with walk-in shower and a separate spa bathtub, a living area and a dining area. There are two flat screen TVs and all utensils for eating in. The Grandview is a time-share but I didn't find the promotion intrusive. Next door is the South Pointe Hotel and Casino with a choice of 7 restaurants. There is the ubiquitous buffet with an enormous selection of dishes (I ate only one breakfast there). I found the Big Sur Oyster Bar first class (oysters feature in only one dish and it is basically a seafood restaurant). All the restaurants are reasonable in price - being away from the expensive Strip hotels. The Grandview has two heated pools and jacuzzis and was not crowded - but it was February with some cold winds! There is a charge for internet but my receptionist, Lolita, let me have one week complimentary. Not sure why but I couldn't decide on the package - cheaper each day the longer one buys. This is definitely a place worth recommending. It is quiet and away from all the noise and bustle of tourist traffic on the Strip. One gets housekeeping once for a week's visit - on the 4th day. I didn't mind as I travelled alone and liked the idea of no maid wanting to clean the room at inconvenient times. Excellent in every way.

Reviews.Title: “Not wheelchair or scooter friendly”
Reviews.Author: conniecross79
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Grandview's Daisy tower over the weekend of 2/10-13. Although the room and grounds were very nice, the property is not wheelchair/scooter friendly. There are only 4 handicapped parking spaces per tower, and none have extra space set aside for chair lifts. In addition, several ramps from sidewalk to street are blocked by cement planters. Small pool areas will definitely not accomodate all guests in the hot weather,

Reviews.Title: “Grandview at Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: KGutzke
Reviews.Content: The rooms are about 800 square feet and are equipped with stove, refrigerator, dish washer washer, jacuzzi so if you are in town for a four to seven day convention or trade show, you are in a much better facility than a normal hotel room.

Reviews.Title: “Spent a nice week there”
Reviews.Author: AZGirl43
Reviews.Content: We traded through RCI for a week at the Grandview in January 2012. We had a two bedroom unit in the Iris building. Checkin was quick, and of course they sent us on over to the adjacent desk for our parking pass, which is another way of trying to sign you up for the timeshare presentation. We did go for the presentation, and trust me, I would NEVER recommend that to anyone. The "90 minute" presentation turned into more than three hours and the salesperson got a bit snarky when he finally realized that we weren't going to buy. We did get our gifts however, which were pretty nice, and almost worth the time spent (almost). The unit was on the third floor on the back side of the building. Our view was of a wall across from the walkway. Every night at midnight they rolled a huge dumpster down the walkway apparently to empty it and then they rolled it back again! Very noisy and woke us up every night. Since the Grandview seemed nowhere near full, I would have thought they could have put us in a quieter location with a better view. Our apartment was evidently not one of the renovated ones,..laminate counters, older furniture and appliances... but still very clean and comfortable. King bed was fine, Kitchen very well equipped, nice bathroom with double sinks and jacuzzi, washer and dryer in a small closet. We had friends join us for part of the week. The second one bedroom unit was a mirror image of the side we were staying in...almost identically equipped, and our friends were very happy with it. South Point Casino is literally next door with lots of restaurant choices, a bowling ally, and movie theater. We enjoyed the senior rates at the movie matinees. All in all it was a fine week and we would be happy to stay at the Grandview again, though I would definitely request a unit on a hgiher floor.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed a week, never thought we would”
Reviews.Author: lanzie99
Reviews.Content: Usually going to Vegas is a weekend thing, our condo was so comfortable and lovely that we lasted the whole week. It was nice to be away from all the hustle and bustle of the strip. Located close to airport and freeway system it was easy to get around. Our condo was 1600 sq feet and very clean. Furniture was very modern and colors were "interesting" but the condo had everything we needed. We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Grandview Rosemary Building”
Reviews.Author: Magster123
Reviews.Content: We just came back from a stay at the Grandview through an RCI week exchange and enjoyed it immensely. We stayed in the new Rosemary building, the farthest from the reception building. Parking was easier in that location. We had a one-bedroom on the 19th floor and the view of the city at night was spectacular. Also enjoyed being next door to the South Point Casino. We went to 3 movies there during the week, something we rarely get do at home. We would return again. A note about timeshare sales -- we are Wyndham owners and we enjoy being owners. But when we check in I politely say that we have been to many timeshare presentations and plan on skipping this one. Timeshare salespeople may not like hearing this but it works for us every time. We are not interesting in spending more time on this just to get a freebie. We are already owners and vacation time is more important. Other than that I agree with the comments about free internet service.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious but tired mood, a bit far away from action”
Reviews.Author: worldVIAJERO3000
Reviews.Content: I gotta say, great value for the suite we got. Here is the "BUT".... but room was too far away from reception, parking wasnt easy, and it was a bit of a drive from all of the action (main strip). The suite was what we expected, spacious, all the amenities plus jacuzzi (which we didn't use). The only complain I had was how most of the furniture was outdated and felt old. Bed was comfortable. Overall for the price we got it and the space (compared to all other strip hotels) this was a great bargain especially if you plan to stay all night out and only plan to sleep in your room, I highly recommend to stay here. Major complaints for me was reception service. We arrive late so there wasn't anybody in reception. We felt the reception team was bored, and seem uninterested at our arrival, I didnt expect the red carpet, but a little joy wouldnt hurt, it goes a long way. Secondly, I asked if we could be placed on the newer buildings and the response was blatant NO and if we wanted there was going to be an extra charge.... really? just to stay at the same room, but in a newerr building? I didnt understand this concept. Would I stay here again...? Maybe not... maybe yes... depends on the type of trip I would take to Vegas... If its luxury, action, great service... maybe consider spending a couple hundred more dollars... If its value, spacious suite, you dont mind driving to action, and just a nice place to sleep in, then I recommend Grandview.

Reviews.Title: “Great except for Internet”
Reviews.Author: Stracks
Reviews.Content: The 2 bedroom suite is two one bedroom self contained suiites connected by a small entrance lobby off the hallway (see plan on web site). This provides complete privacy for each one bedroom suite (great for two couples) or can be a family plan by leaving the one bedroom suite doors open but not the lobby door to the hallway. The individual one bedrooms are clean, roomy and well furnished and stocked. The resort contains good pools, spas, exercise facilities (both cardio and weight), BBQ's although in some may be in adjacent buildings (9 in total). Security seemed good with personnel evident. Location is good being only a few minutes from the strip and downtown with the South Point Casino adjacent to the resort. I would have given the resort a 5 (excellent) except for Internet availability which is poor. Based on previous negative reviews (which was further confirmed by guests using the common facility) I did not pay $50 for in-room service. However the common facility tended to be very slow and only allowed 15 minutes before you had to reboot which could take up to 3 minutes of the 15. I ended up using the WIFI through out the adjacent South Point Casino although that naturally did not provide a print facility. In summary I was impressed with the Grandview and am trying to book it again despite the Internet which I use a lot. (Note: booked as a RCI Last Call vacation)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, rooms and cleanliness”
Reviews.Author: IsmaelT
Reviews.Content: Great facility with lots of ammenities and nice location. Not too close and not too far away from the strip. Just 10-15 minutes by car from it. Very clean and organized. You have a huge casino just crossing the street with nice buffet as well.

Reviews.Title: “Southpoint a block away!”
Reviews.Author: Melanie-Paul L
Reviews.Content: Stayed at thissVacation Village resort last month. The rooms were new as they are building one after another high rise buildings. Parking on site was plentiful.. The staff was great as far as ease of checking in and out. The unit was stocked well, e.g:the kitchen accessories. The best part of Grandview is that right next to it stands the SOUTHPOINT Hotel and Casino. That is very nice and a well kept (off the strip) experience. A bowling alley, movie theater, and several restaurants with every kind of food you could look for.

Reviews.Title: “Too far from the Strip”
Reviews.Author: Travel_Queen_Boulder
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a huge hi-rise about 5 miles from the Strip. We stayed in one of the newer buildings - I think there are around 10 buildings. It was furnished very nicely, very clean, and almost everything was new. However, it lacked any warmth - very plain building, no paintings on the walls, drab colors, drab tile floors, dark elevators - not very welcoming. They gave us clean towels once during the week. Did not give us clean sheets, or empty the trash either. YOU have to do everything yourself. The unit did have a washer and dryer which was helpful. There is no free wi-fi either. You have to pay $10 per day or $25 for 3 days. There is no restaurant onsite except for a deli where you can buy a very limited amount of food or sundries. It is located next door to the South Point Hotel and Casino which is a huge hotel right in the middle of nowhere. Nothing else there except for the South Point and Grandview. The sales pitch for the 90-minute presentation was pretty strong. We've gone through these before and just let it be known we weren't interested, but they kept us the full 90 minutes. We just kept saying "no" and the price kept dropping. Amazing! We left with our $100, but it wasn't worth going through the pain. If you like Las Vegas, the Grandview is OK, but not really convenient to where the action is. We will probably not return there.

Reviews.Title: “excellent appartment but about 5 miles from strip”
Reviews.Author: tracey01752
Reviews.Content: appartment lovely had everything you need. We had a 1 bedroomed appartment. Full kitchen large frontroom, bedroom great size lots of cupboards to put your belonging in, lovely large jacuzzi in bedroom and large bathroom. Everything was in very good condition we were in daisy block which i understand has been up-dated, so I would recommend you ask for that block. 2 nice pools on site. Small gym but enough for a decent workout. Check in was quick and easy and all staff around resort cleaners and gardeners were very friendly and polite. However we found some staff at the reception if you asked a question or some information to be a little abrupt and seemed like it was all to much, which was a shame. You have to pay for wifi and it was expensive. However if you went to reception there is a room with about 10 computers you can use for free. You are about 5 miles away from strip but there is a bus one an hour for 8 dollars for a day ticket which takes you to a choice of 3 drop off points on strip . A car is usefull to explore the area fully. Red rock canyon only about half hour drive and is well worth a visit. Next door to South Ponit Casino which was great, lots of places to eat there and you get a coupon book for discount which was good. A lot cheaper to eat and drink there than on the strip. If you want somewhere a little quieter away from husle and bussle of the strip than Grand View is a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Was not disappointed at all!!”
Reviews.Author: Mary M
Reviews.Content: Just got home last night. When I made our reservation with RCI and they told me the only thing they had open was the Grandview, not on the strip, I was disappointed but was willing to give it a try. When we arrived at the resort, the staff was more than accomodating to make sure we had a room in the tower I requested (Daisy, per reviews I read). The rooms were fantastic. The bed was so comfortable that I did not want to ever get up! The only downfall was the jacuzzi tub...not ours...but the one at 3:30 a.m. from a neighbor upstairs! The small sign that they place next to the tub informing people to be courteous (??) and use it only 8 a.m. - 10 p.m. was ignored. At least the noise only lasted while they were filling the tub, not the water jets afterward. A small annoyance that I am sure the hotel cannot control unless they have a timer on each tub that shuts off at 10:00 :) Anyway, it was a totally good experience that will have myself and the couple traveling with us, choose the Grandview for all our future trips to Las Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: grammywren
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the GrandView the week after Thanksgiving. We usually stay here when in Vegas. We had asked to be put in the Primrose building but because of some visitors who messed up the area we wanted, we were put in Iris. It was as central to everything on property as Pimrose. It was right at pool side, which would have been great in warmer weather. Iris is one of the older buildings evidently. It was nice but could use some upgrades in furnishings. We had a lovely time. The South Point Casino is located right next door. You do have to have a car if you plan to do any sightseeing on the strip or elsewhere since it is located about five miles south of the airport on Las Vegas Blvd. We would recommend this venue to anyone with a timeshare and time to spend in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Great location south of the Strip!”
Reviews.Author: pugpenthouse
Reviews.Content: Overall, a very pleasant stay. Rooms were a little underwhelming decor-wise, but apparently we were in the tower that had yet to be updated. Full kitchen was well appointed. Staff were excellent, rooms were spacious. Good heated pools and the largest hot-tub I've seen in ages. Close to a Casino (next door) but none of the noise associated with Casino Hotel accomodations. Families with kids seemed quite happy. One MAJOR DOWNFALL - internet access is ~$50 PER DEVICE for 7 days. I still can not understand why hotels/resorts do not realize how non-customer friendly this is for travellers. Frankly, I would even absorb a slightly higher daily rental rate (or RCI trade value) for free internet, since we had searched for a place with internet access as being one of the MUST haves. I plan much of my vacation online while there, so my netbook/tablet/smartphone are critical to my enjoyment of my vacation as a whole. Many of us, in the hot tub, were complaining/commenting about the same thing. We did fill out the resort suggestion cards with this feedback - but the desk staff said that they hear this constantly and management does not appear to take it seriously. So - the place is quite fine, about 7 miles south of the Strip. Rooms good, casino right next door, internet access is apparently not considered as part of the resort package.

Reviews.Title: “Great week stay in Las Vegas south of the strip--no free wifi unless an owner”
Reviews.Author: Pnemiller
Reviews.Content: We exchanged our time share to stay at this very large complex 6 or 7 miles south of the strip. There are about 6 high rise buildings. We were on the 8th floor in an excellent unit--full kitchen, washer/dryer in unit, large bathroom with whirlpool, 2 TVs, DVD player, king size bed with many pillows. There are two pools, hot tubs and an exercise room. Grandview's location is not a problem because it is just east of the Interstate, less than a mile from the exit. If takes only about 15 minutes to drive to the strip on the Interstate. You are away from the traffic jams and noise of the strip, but can get there easily. There are many dining options in the area and a Walmart Neighborhood Store about 1 mile away. Next door is the South Pointe Casino which also has dining, entertainment and 64 bowling alleys. Our only complaint about this place and it is true of other Vacation Village properties is the fact that unless you are an owner, the wifi for computer use in your unit, is not free. Non owners have to pay a daily rate of about $10, which is less per day if you pay for a longer period. Most other hotels, shopping centers, etc. in the area have free wifi. There are a number of Starbucks, McDonald's, etc. within one mile of the complex where you can get unlimited free wifi. Grandview's charge for this is, in my opinion, a rip off!! They do have about 10 computers to use for free in the activity center--there is a 15 minute limit, but you can use the printer if necessary, especially good for airport check in and printing boarding passes. Overall, this is a great time share complex and we hope to return sometime. We had a wonderful time there and in Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “The way to stay in vegas”
Reviews.Author: Geri4jesus
Reviews.Content: Love this place! This was our second stay at this resort and we were happy both times. We had a room in the new building daisy, Definetly request the new building as the furnishings are more up to date than the older buildings. The door handles broke off in our bathroom but were fixed immediatly. We loved the location off the strip , everything you need is only a short drive away. We got into town and went grocery shopping for the week the full kitchen spoiled us especially with two kids under 4 we were able to keep breakfast and lunch simple like at home and spend the money on nice dinners out. The "90" minute time share presentation turned into 3 hours but we did get our gifts as promised. The south point is next door and we were pleasantly surprised with its amenities. They have a bowling alley and movie theatre as well as several restaurants . There's a deli that's amazing . Sells the biggest pieces of cake you've ever seen and for $5 couldn't beat it! We stayed during jan1-8 so Vegas was pretty empty which we liked, I would reccomend this resort and would stay here again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Vegas Vacation”
Reviews.Author: tcomer
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a week in Vegas. I knew when I booked the Grandview that it was not on the strip, but that didn't bother me because I thought that I probably would not want to be right on the strip all of the time. That said, you really do need a car if you stay at the Grandview. There is a shuttle but you are charged a daily fee and you are at their mercy as to time to travel and where you go. You do not want to pay for taxi service to and from the Grandview. We decided after we arrived to go ahead and rent a car which we were able to do right there at the resort and the car rental company came to pick us up to take us get our car. We returned it to the airport when we left. The drive in to the strip did not bother us at all and parking is free at most all the casinos in the self park areas. The temps were too cool for us to enjoy any of the pools but they looked wonderful and were kept very clean. Our condo and the grounds were also beautiful and clean. The photos that you see on line provided by the Grandview of the resort and grounds are truely typical of what you see when you get there. No surprises. We have been to hotels that had beautiful hotel photos and when we got there it was not at all the same as the photos we saw on line. The furniture all needs to be upgraded including the mattresses. It was OK, and we were able to get a decent night's sleep, but compared to other places that we have stayed, the beds and the living room furniture need to be renewed because they were really starting to show their age. Sounds from next door neighbor were almost like they were in our condo at times, but we were not bothered with noise at night. We may have just been lucky on that because we didn't have a neighbor there that stayed the entire week. Everything else was great. The condo itself was beautiful and freshly painted. We had a one bedroom and the bedroom had a jacuzzi tub between the bed and bathroom. The bath had a double vanity all very nice. People were very attentive and helpful. The South Point Casino is literaly next door. We had fun playing there and they even have free craps lessons a couple of days each week. Their tables had a lower minimum than those on the strip which was good for us since we are not big game players but wanted to play just for fun and entertainment. You can play longer for less money. There are also several different resturants at the casino if you want to eat there. We ate there a couple of times during the week but ate either in our condo or on the strip most of the time. Overall, I give the Grandview a B+. New furniture and noise reduction would be my only recommendation. Location was not all that bad. I knew up front we were just a few miles south of the strip. If you want to be right on the strip, the Grandview is not for you. It was fine for us.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay, Love it - Definitely returning.”
Reviews.Author: Lisa L
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at other timeshares, Summerbay in Las Vegas was nice also but I liked Grandview a lot more. The convenince of having South Pointe next door was great. Cheap gambling, great food, reasonably priced. My husband and I ate at the Steak-N-Shake at Southpoint and our bill was $15.00 for both (we ate burgers with shakes to drink). Our room at the Grandview was excellent, plenty of room, nice TV's, nice clean furniture. Although the pull-out sofa beds are NOT comfortable, recommend bringing a blow-up mattress instead if your planning to sleep on it more than one night. All the rooms had plenty of space for our needs. The pool areas were clean and nice, the work out room a ways from our building but still not that bad of a walk. Every person we dealt with from the front desk, shuttle request, and maid service were excellent, and polite courteous. The only thing I could possibly complain about is when we arrived our room wasn't quite ready so we left our luggage and headed to the strip to go eat while we waited for our room. The front desk was suppose to call us to let us know our room was ready but we never got the call and it was after 7pm when I called so by the time we got checked in our room it was after 8pm which was a little frustrating but not the end of the world. There are a lot of chain restaurants close to the Grandview as well. They also have really cheap breakfast at the South Pointe Coronado Cafe for $1.99 but it is only during certain hours so be sure to check the time. Another nice place to eat thats a little pricier but worth it is the Veloce at the M Casino just down the street from Grandview. It's at the very top so you overlook the entire city while you're eating. We spent about $50.00 for two people but that included our dinner, drinks (one alcoholic and 2 non-alcoholic beverages) and dessert.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent accomodations far south on the Strip”
Reviews.Author: AirArmy
Reviews.Content: We are not timeshare owners but were able to book this accomodation as we are retired military members. I would consider this a 5 star accomodation. The pools in Vegas are only outdoor pools, so if you go in Dec, you will not be swimming outside. You definitely need to rent a car, although there is a shuttle service for $8 one way and a cab will cost you $25 to the center of the strip. It is located right beside the South Point Casino, which is a very nice casino. The staff were absolutely delightful and at your beckon call. I will stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: speters1930
Reviews.Content: Myself and two family members stayed for 4 days during the Christmas holiday. We had a 2 bedroom which is basically two 1 bedrooms (fully furnished with full size kitchens and washer/dryers) in the a suites separated by front entrance doors, but inside one main door. If you have small children this set up will not work, but will work well for teenagers and adults. We kept the interior doors open when we wanted to socialize. The suites are clean, modern and have everything you need. I slept on the sofabed in the living room one night and it wasn't bad. The bedroom king bed is very comfortable. We stayed in the Daisy building. They are also still building so there will be even newer buildings. One negative was there was another visitor in another suite using the jacuzzi in 2 am. The noise came through the walls. My mother called the front desk and let them know. She didn't have any problems the remaining days. The rooms have sign stating Jacuzzi should not be used after 10 pm. I could not hear anything on my side of the suite though. (suite A, my mother was in suite b). The site is down the road from the strip, but I like not being on the strip with the traffic and people. The site has two pools, fitness rooms (one with cardio machine and other with weight machines), game room (which we didn't use). We had a car but they do have shuttle service further down the strip available (for a fee). You can't walk to the strip from the site. All the customer service reps I encountered were very nice and pleasant. They don't pressure you with the timeshare sale. I did attend one and received $100 cash + my $20 deposit I had to put down. The timeshare sale includes a full buffet breakfast at the casino next door (which is nice, it has a movie theater, bowling alley and spa). I already own a timeshare in Sedona so I am not interested in purchasing anymore, but I will continue to use my RCI points to visit this site when I travel to Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Management are Excellent”
Reviews.Author: cloughterm
Reviews.Content: We (a family of five) stayed here for two weeks over the Holiday period. We had a few minor issues, but the manager (Taira) was very professional and capable; she managed to resolve all of our issues. I will say that one of the frontdesk ladies (Nelly) is rude and is to be avoided at all costs. She even had the audacity to ask me why I needed to call my husband when I was standing at the frontdesk and asked her if there was a phone I could use to call him! In the end, another member of staff let me use her phone. All the other staff were great - security guys, housekeepers, check-in, lady at the trips desk etc. I cannot understand how some of the negative reviews are accurate in regard to the hard-selling and the cooking smells. If the smells are that bad, buy an air-freshner! We said that we did not want to go on the timeshare presentation breakfast and were not hassled at all. If you have a problem, take it to the management, like we did, and they will deal with it. I would recommend this hotel. It is pleasant to get away from all the hubbub of The Strip each night.

Reviews.Title: “Two-bedroom units are amazing!”
Reviews.Author: Spaek68
Reviews.Content: This was our first time to the Grandview, and we loved our stay. We had a two-bedroom unit, which is really two full one bedroom units connected by a small, common foyer to the hall. Two of everything! Kitchens, living rooms, jetted tubs, washer/dryers! We were just a family of four, so the units were very spacious. One thing we especially noticed was how solid the floors/ceilings were. Our young boys were able to run around the room without the typical thump-thump you normally hear in other condo hotels. The only noise heard from the other units were the jetted tubs being run, and that was not bad at all. All of the positive things in the other recent reviews are true: nice pools, easy drive to the Strip, proximity to the South Point Casino is great, and markets and convenient chain restaurants are very close. We took a quick drive to the M Resort for breakfast at Hash House a Go Go (HIGHLY RECOMMEND!) then drove to Hoover Dam, which was only 30 minutes away. The reason for not giving 5 stars: $10 one-time charge to use the in-room safe, wifi Internet fee was per device (we have iPads, iPhones, Kindles, and laptops), cable tv channels were a mess with standard def and high def redundancies that were annoying after a day, and lastly, it was obvious that some of the room details were done a little cheaply (excusable in this economic climate). By this I mean the sink basins in the bathrooms were tiny, the shower floors were fiberglass instead of tile, and the DVD players were horribly low tech. Overall, we really enjoyed our 8 days at the Grandview and plan to return. The 1-star deduction may seem petty to some of you, but it's good to strive for better. Don't you think?

Reviews.Title: “Owning these units”
Reviews.Author: bestway36
Reviews.Content: Our stays at Grandview have been good. there is no issue with the resort. Would recommend that people be very wary about getting sucked into buying one though. Appears that their computer system cannot identify two accounts even if you do have the same name. then when you ask for an account it still does not get sent to you. In hindsight would not have got involved.

Reviews.Title: “Our best stay so far! What a great resort!”
Reviews.Author: Margariet
Reviews.Content: This was our third stay in the Grandview and by far our best. We could grab a bonus week from RCI. We stayed in a room on one of the highest floors of the Daisy building with a lovely view of Vegas by night! The room was very new and modern, one of the best we have seen in ages, and we visit so many timeshare resorts and hotels! The interior design is beautiful. The television screens are huge and flat. The bed was great to sleep on. The kitchen was well equipped. The bathroom is modern and spacious with two sinks. South Point next door is still a huge extra. The restaurants are good value. There was no more invitation to attend the timeshare presentation. I guess after a few stays they leave you alone! But we had a wonderful time. The weather was great. We drove by car often to the Strip, to shopping centers, to the Town Square and to the Grand Canyon and the Lake Mead area. There was so much to do. I am sure we will come back to the Grandview because it is an excellent resort.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Dan D
Reviews.Content: My wife and I along with our best friends stayed in a double suite lock out for 1 week and it was terrific. It was a bit hectic checking in but there were a ton of people there at the same time. We foung the dining at the South Point Casino very good (expensive) but when celebrating the girls birthdays we didn`t mind. The resort ammenities are very good, we enjoyed the pools and the bar b que. The resort is very well positioned to major freeways and we did several car tours in the area. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great get away on the very south end of the strip.”
Reviews.Author: Hans B
Reviews.Content: Nice resort setting. We stayed in the Rosemary building in a one bed room unit. Unit was newly appointed and we were very pleased with it. Loved the layout. Nice and quiet away from the hussle of the strip. Front counter staff were very friendly and efficient during check-in. We didn't have time to use the pool but it looked inviting. Parking was never a problem and security was always visible. A car is recomened for this resort which we had. South Point was right across the street great casino on the south end of the strip with lots to do in and eat.They still charge for internet at the resort which they really should waive as many of the other resorts like Hilton Gand Vacation Club and Peace Cliff Canyon offer free service. I have to add that I asked for complimentry access and was given a card for the week. Thank-you. Will be back in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “Good Enough”
Reviews.Author: Julia M
Reviews.Content: There seems to always be availability here. We enjoyed the 2 bedroom suite that was a lock-out; it had everything comfortably updated. The pool area is nice and there's a litte grill on the property that hits the spot for a good price. This complex is easy to find off the freeway and is next door to the SouthPoint Casino which has LOADS of activities for all ages. If you want to go the Strip, you'll have to go by car. Worst part-the desk help basically acted like they didn't care about their clients.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay away from the chaos of The Strip.”
Reviews.Author: Travelchick1983
Reviews.Content: These condo units are at the far south end of "The Strip" so you really need a car to get around, but it is nice and quiet and well looked after. There is really no place to eat on site but South Point Casino and Resort are right across the street with lots of venues to eat at and all we tried were very good. The units themselves were well equipped and well maintained and clean. My only complaint is that there were deep grooves in the mattress where people had slept and the pillows were in poor condition. Both badly needed to be replaced, as well as the carpet in the bedroom, as it was badly worn and had some stains that had not come out in the cleaning. All staff were friendly and helpful and security was always visible. Is close to Prime Outlets for some great shopping as well.

Reviews.Title: “Great Centrally Located Resort!”
Reviews.Author: taffykids
Reviews.Content: We spent Thanksgiving week at The Grandview as an exchange through RCI and had a great time. This resort is located about six miles south of the "Welcome to Las Vegas" sign at the south end of the strip. The property is in nice shape and the staff are very attentive. I would compare each unit to the master and living area of the Desert Springs Villas II in space, decoration and newness. Please know that you are not in a golf community however, this resort is built on a very small foot-print and a lot of it is parking lot. This is not a "sit on your balcony with a beverage and look at the view" type of place but it is fantastic for Vegas. You will want a car, $8.00 per person per day is a bit much for getting around town (we drove from CA). As for internet, it is expensive, however my husband was able to use the business center and that was sufficient for his daily quick check (I had my phone which worked fine). We were asked upon check in about attending the 90 minute presentation and said "no thank you". We did receive a few calls to attend the welcome "breakfast", also said "no thank you" and were not bothered again for the week. We were in the Daisy tower, I think the second newest, and many of the things prior visitors complained about have been corrected in the new buildings. For example, the windows all have black out drapes over the wood blinds and the kitchen is done in newer finishes. The only thing we felt we would have brought with us from home was a cookie sheet. They had provided a turkey pan (we didn't cook a turkey) so we used that all week to cook and reheat things. We took prior advise and brought an Aero bed for one of our sons and were thankful that we did. We were only able to book a one bedroom unit for this holiday week and the pull out couch would have been tight for both of them. The mid-week tidy service was a nice touch. The facilities are nice as well, they keep one pool and the hot tub heated in the winter and the weather was nice enough to swim. The gym is in two separate rooms with cardio machines in one and weight machines in another. They offer the typical work out equipment, ellipticals, treadmills and bikes. The convenience store is right near the gym, we used it to buy syrup only, they do offer to-go food items and coffee service. Our main goals for the week were to visit some of the places off the strip since we were traveling with our two boys 10 &13. We hiked Red Rock Canyon, did the Dam tour at Hoover Dam, enjoyed a day at the Springs Preserve and Nevada State Museum. As previously mentioned, the South Point casino is a good distraction with many things for the kids to do. They have an arcade, bowling alley, movie theater with all new movies and a few good restaurants all within walking distance. We would stay here again if we visit Vegas, we probably won't since we enjoy traveling to a different place each time. On another note, our other option for the week was The Cliffs at Peace Canyon, which we drove by on the way to Red Rock. In our opinion, it is too far away from everything to consider. The Grandview is much more centrally located!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: JamesAllen
Reviews.Content: Last week my friend and I stayed at the Grandview for a week. The suites were clean & spacious. Staff members were kind, cordial, and professional. We certainly enjoyed South Point Casino being next doors. I would highly recommend the Grandview

Reviews.Title: “Timeshare Nightmare”
Reviews.Author: Julie T
Reviews.Content: I have been to Vegas many times and this is one resort I will never visit again.
