We were assured that since we were coming in late that their would be someone 24 hours at the front desk. There appeared to be a night clerk, however, she should have been home in bed...the service the whole time at the front desk was terrible. Once we tried to mail some things home, the concierge finally found the right boxes and then left for the day while we tried to figure out what to do next...the front desk clerks were rude when we had the nerve to ask where she went? The tour/tickets lady was ready a book and wouldn't even look up from her desk and the whole lobby was full. We already have a timeshare with RCI and they offered us some possible help if we took the 90 minute timeshare tour. They bombarded us with not one, but 4 people trying to get us to buy at the Grandview. They were mean...I can't believe how we were treated. The carpets and rooms were in poor shape..ie...toilet paper holder broken, stains on the furniture..maid service who didn't even sweep the floor..(left raisins and nuts under table!) Our heat was stuck on 76 degrees the whole time. Oh yeah...this was so much fun. Never again....

Reviews.Title: “Plenty of space for the family”
Reviews.Author: bus7mom
Reviews.Content: I just returned from my Thanksgiving visit to Las Vegas with my Mom, and sister. Our suite at the Grandview had everything we needed for our week stay. It was clean, with a at home feeling. We cooked breakfast every day (food stores not far away), and had dinner at the strip hotels. I do agree with everyone that said to get a car. We did, and it helped. It is easy to drive up and down the strip and park at any hotel for the price of a tip. The staff at the Grandview greeted us upon arrival, and treated us to a very speedy checkout. Other than that, we never saw or needed them. We did everything at the large hotels on the strip. That is where the action is...that is where your vacation really is. The Grandview had a few daily options however, we never used anything. If you stay at the Grandview, plan on driving, and pick someone who is willing not to drink. The Southpoint Casino next door was ok for a night or two, but it did not have the Vegas magic.

Reviews.Title: “Great suites!!”
Reviews.Author: Visionof
Reviews.Content: I truly enjoy staying at the Grandview when I go to Vegas. It's a little removed from the strip but right next door to SouthPoit and down the street from the M resort which are great pluses. The resort is truly great and they are always improving. Waterfall heated pools and jacuzzi bathtubs are true bonuses. Just need to come down on the price on the shuttle to the strip and airport.

Reviews.Title: “Its a timeshare watch out for 'freebies'”
Reviews.Author: Steversjunk
Reviews.Content: We spent a week at the Grandview using a bonus week from our BlueGreen timeshare. Upon our check-in, we were asked if we'd like to get some show tickets to enjoy during our stay. We'd only need to sit thru the '90 minute' presentation. We were assured that they don't have 'high pressure back-up guys'... Yes they do! We had a nice breakfast at the South Point buffet, hosted by our 'non'-pressure guide. He ate quickly which gave him time to milk us with questions while we ate. It was then time to see the new building at the Grandview. After which the pressure started. We were basically told that our current timeshare is worthless and that their's is the best system (Surprise!). Once he was done, the back-up associate arrived with a 'better' (cheaper) plan. After saying no, we were sent to get our prizes and tickets. However they had one more deal for us there (So much for no pressure or back-ups!). We finally escaped with the stuff and managed to enjoy our stay. The accommodations were okay. My wife said that the furniture was old and needed to be replaced. We did have a damaged coffee table and I had a sharp screw break thru the bottom of my heel from the footstool in the bedroom (they replaced both pieces). When I called about my heel, they quickly sent security up to take a report. The security guys also went for a First Aid kit to help clean the wound. I was told that someone would be contacting me about my heel, but that never happened. The best I can say about the place is that its clean (they did a minor room clean-up on Wednesday morning); extra towels were a phone call away; each room has a kitchen, a fridge, stove, dishes, dishwasher, plus a washer & dryer, and 2 TV's. There are several pools, a snack bar/deli store, a 15 minute time limit on their computers (which allows for quickly checking for important emails), (I think they have wi-fi), its located next to South Point, and in close proximity to the freeway, about 7 miles south of the Strip. That was okay though. You either drive north up Las Vegas Blvd or go north on the freeway to get to the Strip. I'd say its a decent place to stay and made access to Red Rock Canyon (to the northwest) fairly easy. In addition to visiting the casinos, we did go to Red Rock Canyon and to the Valley of Fire (which is located to the east, north of Lake Mead). Both are well worth the trip and incredibly beautiful as the sun changes location in the sky (It gets absolutely beautiful near dusk!). I hope that helps...

Reviews.Title: “Good in parts”
Reviews.Author: HertfordshirePandora
Reviews.Content: This resort is well placed for the good facilities at South Pointe Casino. We booked a two-bedroom apartment as a timeshare exchange. We received two self-contained one-bedroom apartments which would not have been suitable if we had been with young children. We were in 'Sage' block and were relieved that we were not overlooking the noisy, smelly barbeque area at the rear. The apartments were well equipped and well decorated but had very dirty tiled floors in the kitchen, dining and bathroom areas. We were told we would have a mini-clean half-way through our week's stay. This should have been described as a towel exchange. The towels were hastily changed but no cleaning of any kind took place. There was a very visible 'timeshare sales programme' going on all the time but we got the impression that there was not much after sales care. You do not even receive a satisfaction questionnaire from the resort before you leave, so you can't leave feedback very easily. We raised concerns at the reception that 3 male members of staff had entered our apartment to replace fire extinguishers when the 'privacy please' sign was on the door. And that was at a time when a lady was in the apartment on her own! The reception staff offered to send us an email response to this complaint. A month later we have received neither an explanation nor an apology.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice; new tower is great”
Reviews.Author: Tamaria
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 5 nights for a Vegas birthday celebration and won an ebay auction and the price could not be beat anywhere. The new Rosemary tower is great though a little walk to get to the main lobby but a nice walk if the weather is good. We had to pick the week it was colder than on the east coast. They are next to South Point Casino/Hotel which we frequented often. I wasn't asked to do a timeshare presentation, as this is a timeshare resort, until I was on the strip. I would have purchased but due to the fact that the shuttle is not free ($8.00) charge round trip to the strip; charge for visits to outlets and many of the trips they offered two years ago are now non existent or they charge for them. We arrived late to check in and there was no one there to take our bags to our room/tower which again, was a ways from the office and it was very chilly the night we arrived. The resort has great pools, mini store/cafe on site which came in handy because that's the only place I was able to find a Coke and was having withdrawal, lol. I would definitely recommend staying here and if you have a car that's great to do other excursions but definitely not to drive to the strip.

Reviews.Title: “The Grandview always delivers”
Reviews.Author: LadyBlues H
Reviews.Content: This year was the second time in two years we had the pleasure to stay in the Grandview, and we will book there again whenever we come back to Las Vegas. It has everything you will need, great apartments with full kitchen, an amazing bathroom, and even your own private jacuzzi in your bedroom! Plus a helpful and friendly staff, it made it for us every time. The only inconvenience, relatively speaking, is that you aren't exactly located "in the middle of the action", but 10-15 minutes drive (depending on the traffic) south on the Strip. For us, this is more like another advantage, as we were just an step away from all the casinos, clubs and nightlife, but we could enjoy a quiet environment when we got back to the apartment. Of course, I would recomend a car to move around, but in case you don't want to bother driving (remember: never ever drink and drive) or you prefer to save the money for other things, they offer a regular shuttle service that runs until night (don't remember exactly the time table, but they were pretty comprehensive). What I did missed was a wireless internet conexion, although you have a business room by the reception, with a few computers, printers, etc... and free coffe and juice! You just have to love them. All in all, I'll recomend this for every kind of traveller, unless you really really want to be in the action day and night. In this case you better check for something norther (but you may regret it, specially if you plan a long stay). Have a good one!

Reviews.Title: “Burned by in room hair dryer”
Reviews.Author: Robyn D
Reviews.Content: The actual property was a nice place but their customer relations has been terrible. While staying at the Grandview I was burned by one of their hairdryers that caught fire inside and blew burning hot coils through my shirt, and down my back. A report was filed with a written statement and pictures before I left the property. The head of security contacted me and I was told they would replace my swimsuit due to the coils burning a big hole in it. I live several hours from Vegas, so any contact has been made through texting. They have yet to repsond regarding the burns and I have not received any reimbursement for my swimsuit. I was in Vegas with friends to relax and have a good time and I went home with three burns on my back and no swimsuit. I have been disappointed that they have not made more of an effort to make things right.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing and Quiet”
Reviews.Author: Mountain_Family10
Reviews.Content: We stayed with 3 couples here; it was great to stay off the strip in a quiet place away from the noise and lights. After a full day around the strip it was great to relax in the hot tub and enjoy the quiet. There were no smoky casinos or bars on site that we had to navigate through to get to our rooms. Although when we wanted to go to a casino off the strip, the SouthPoint resort is right next door. Having a kitchenette was great too; we enjoyed relaxing breakfasts before heading out for the day. It helped keep costs down. We will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Well Worth it!”
Reviews.Author: BudEMarE
Reviews.Content: 1st time here. Had a 1 bedroom very spacious & clean. Bed was comfortable & kitchen had all amenities. Free Maid service midweek. Clean Pools & hottubs, adequate workout rooms; was quiet in midSept. Has small coffee/sandwich/gift shop on site. Owners lounge had several free computers w/internet & printer, but usage is timed. This is a timeshare property, so get ready for a tour-compensated with tickets for dinner or shows. We had a car so we drove to the outlying areas & visited other casinos off the Strip. Pretty easy to navigate around LV. Hotel is South of Strip-5-7 minutes from Luxor. Grandview has a shuttle to strip $8. Need a car to enjoy area; No car-can be very relaxing. South Point casino next door. Nice buffet.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Find”
Reviews.Author: glasgow18_11
Reviews.Content: Wanted to visit Las vegas but also Grand canyon and other parts of Nevada. I am a member of RCI Points and swapped into this Hotel. Technically speaking this is in fact a Timeshare Complex although Trip Adviso describes it as an hotel. We stayed in a brand new block Rosemary only opened up for rental a few weeks before our visit. The accomodation was ideal.All mod cons clean spacious and comfortable. The onsite facilities were excellent. The staff helpful and welcoming .Cannot recommend this place highly enough. It is in an ideal situauation for touring although a car is definitely advisable. Situated between the Airport and the Strip with an outlet,Casinos ,Restaurants near by we were extremely happy with our choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: Bob_CBoston
Reviews.Content: This was the first time we stayed at this hotel /timeshare (Nov 2011). The staff was friendly and helpful. I was asked to "tour the property" to recieve show tickets (timeshare sales) , but I declined and was not bothered again about it. We had a double unit, two one bedrooms conected by a common hall. The unit was in the Rosemary Building #6 which is the newest building and is all nonsmoking,.It was very nice,very clean, comfortable beds and just about everything you might need. Grandview @ Las Vegas is about 6 miles from the major resorts on the strip, so you would need a car or arrange transportation with the frontdesk (I think it was $8 each way although we did not use it). South Point Casino is right next door. The frontdesk staff even printed our airline boarding passes for our flight home. That was a nice perk.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome--Again!”
Reviews.Author: SRJDS
Reviews.Content: This is the second time we have stayed here, and we truly love this place! The unit was modern, clean, big, quiet and comfortable. The bed was very comfortable. The big in-room jacuzzi and walk-in shower are extra wonderful features. We also enjoyed the huge hot tub right outside our building by one of the 5 pools. The South Point Casino is right across the street and a lot of fun. Since it is off the strip, the multiple restaurants are cheaper, but just as good, and it was a lot easier to get a drink on the casino floor. The only downsides are having to pay for in-room internet and the lack of transportation to the strip compared to what is advertised. There is a free computer/internet room in the registration building.

Reviews.Title: “South of The Strip....Very nice.”
Reviews.Author: Virginia3bears
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at Grandview at Las Vegas three times in the last 12 months. The resort is about 6 miles south of the southern end of The Strip. The plus is that sometimes it's nice to get away from the hustle and bustle of Las Vegas Blvd. If you have a rental car it's a relatively easy drive back and forth. There is also a shuttle bus at the resort. SouthPoint Casino is right next door. The atmosphere here warm and fun....including slots, gaming and sportsbooks. The resort is nicely furnished, clean and quiet. Check-in was easy and professional. Our separate visits were my husband and I, who were then joined by friends from Wisconsin who flew in for a portion of the stay. A few months later, I returned with my sister. We both enjoyed a relaxing time and very much liked having the choice of a quick walk over to the casino next door. Note: The restaurants at the Southpoint are very good and less expensive than many on the strip. We were never approached to do a timeshare presentation at any time during any of our stays. We are owners in Florida...and did use this as an exchange. Lastly, I will note the cleaning and maintenance staff are outstanding. After three visits, I realized that each time I have been greeted in the halls with smiles, "hello's" and helpful service. Any item needed was quickly brought to the room. On the visit with my sister, we had booked 3 days through points exchange, thinking that we could easily stay at another hotel on the strip for the last 2 days. As it turned out there were three conventions that weekend and we were having a hard time finding a reasonable rate. I checked at the desk and a lovely lady was able to make accommodations for us for two more nights in the same room. All in all, we would highly recommend the Grandview.

Reviews.Title: “Away from the euphoria”
Reviews.Author: steph68
Reviews.Content: Clean place Comfortable, large one bedroom suite You need a car to fully appreciate it. The service was efficient, we had a deffective hair drier and they replaced it quickly. The front desk people were helpfull in responding to our question. A good stay and no reason not to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful accomodations! Quiet and clean”
Reviews.Author: sls1958
Reviews.Content: A group of 6, we shared two one-bed units. Units were tastefully decorated and fully outfitted with kitchens. Very clean and quiet. We rented a car so transportation wasn't a problem. I had read that there were once bed bug problems, but didn't find that to be the case with us. Right across the street from Southpoint Resort and Casino, which was convienent. We found the deli in Southpoint has excellent food, and serves breakfast. They have a pastry chef on staff and the pastries and desserts were huge, as well as fabulous! We didn't attend any timeshare sales events, so didn't feel pressured to buy. Grocery stores and a Walmart are close by.

Reviews.Title: “Nice timeshare and straight down from the Strip.”
Reviews.Author: jv50
Reviews.Content: I was invited on an all women trip for a week. As these are mainly 1 bedroom units, I took the hide a bed. That was the worst part of the entire trip.! The mattress was so thin and I could feel every spring. The next day they brought a rollaway and a mattress topper and I was able to sleep with the aid of sleeping pills. There was also just 1 bath whereas most timeshares have a separate bath with the bedroom and a general bath. There is also no free wifi in the suites. You have to pay per day, 3 days or 7 days for internet access or go to the main building and you are kicked off after 15 minutes. Otherwise, it was a nice timeshare to stay at with friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great accommodations for two couples.”
Reviews.Author: JayDorval
Reviews.Content: Nicely equipped units, good location not too far from the strip. Would love to go back. We had no problem avoiding the timeshare arm twisting and that was much appreciated.

Reviews.Title: “Grand place to stay”
Reviews.Author: cindyanne2010
Reviews.Content: Nice accomodations. Plenty of room for 4 adults. Includes all your dishes, towels, toaster, microwave, coffee pot, washer, dryer, iron etc. Very clean rooms, beds soft top but firm mattress...comfy. Nice fluffy pillows. The location is good. About 6 miles off the strip, but there is a good restaurant next door. Grocery and liquor store the next block up. So convient, but not too busy. The staff is great. Very helpful, informative and friendly. The only drawback is that the walls are thin and you can hear people showering, etc. in the next room. I recommend getting an end room and that helps tremendously. No neighbors to interrupt your sleep. Other than that it's a great place to stay and I'd recommend it with 5 stars.

Reviews.Title: “Grandview loved it!!”
Reviews.Author: brian m
Reviews.Content: The Grandview is our home resort, but it's the first time we had stayed there, It was great! the staff extremely friendly and not pushy on the sales side. We were there Sept 10- thru to the 17th so the weather was warm and we enjoyed the pool area almost everyday. It was our first time staying basically off strip, so we were a little unsure.The rooms are basically a suite that has all the amenities of home but with the excitment of Vegas.They offer a shuttle down to 3 locations on the strip for $8.00 a person a day,they also take you for groceries. plus RTC transit buses are in front of South Point. Which brings us to South Point, great casino with many dining options, one of our favorite casinos now. Also close to M resort (taxi). Will definately stay again and again

Reviews.Title: “Love it every time!”
Reviews.Author: chaparrin9
Reviews.Content: This place is great!! The staff is friendly & even though I'm not a timeshare member (never been bothered or "harassed"-as some ppl put it- with it either) they always accommodate my needs. I always request a pool view & they always manage to find one for me. Even in the busy summer! We've staid here 3 summers in a row and always enjoy our stay. Ironically, it's like home away from home. U have a full kitchen w/all the appliances and cooking and eating utensils & if it's not in your room call the front desk & they'll bring it right up. I asked for a cookie sheet & they gave me a brand new one. You also have a washer & dryer, works out great for us because we always stay a week & we can go back home with clean clothes!...the grounds are nice, although, I wish they had more &/or bigger pools. They have some tough competition on that w/ Tahiti Village & their lazy river and also w/Cancun & their water slides. I always stay here because the rooms trump the pools for me. Plus the South Point is next door, that's a big win for them ;-) (Our friends staid @ Tahiti but spent a lot of time @ SP, she said she will be staying here next time because not only did she love their attractions but she liked our room much better). We love having the SP next door! Our 9 year old has so much to do here. They have an arcade, bowling, and a movie theater. They have restaurants too, not the best, but good enough if u don't want to drive or cook. (The buffet is expensive though & if u do try it I recomend u sign up for a players card, @ least that way you get a discount! =) )... There are a few grocery stores near by and a Target & Walmart as well as a few pharmacys. In fact, u can find so much within a 5 mile radius (explore!). The strip is about a 3-5 min drive on the fw, or 5-10 on the street.. I highly recomend this place if u have kids. I can't wait to go back next year, and I know my son can't either.

Reviews.Title: “Overall, very good”
Reviews.Author: cmburns47
Reviews.Content: Greatly enjoyed the stay at Grandview. The unit was perfect for two people and was very well equiped with basic kitchen goods. Our first time to Las Vegas and really liked being close but not too close to the Strip. Good location for seeing other sights (Hoover Dam, Red Rock Canyon and Grand Canyon, etc). South Point Casino next door was fun. Only negative, DO NOT use house phone for long distance calls. Made three calls of less than 1 minute and was charged by CTI to credit card almost $ 50 for three calls. I think that resort should have told quests about long distance charges. Other than phone rip off, I would stay again at Grandview Resort.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Stay”
Reviews.Author: Mark S
Reviews.Content: We brought some friends for their first trip to Vegas and they were thouroughly impressed with the Grandview. We had a 2 bedroom which is actually two one bedrooms connected which was great when we wanted some privacy but then worked when we shared some meals in. The pools are great, especially the main pool and the kids activity pool. The staff were very attentive to all our needs. We used the computer room rather then in-suite internet. The location is great and the extras were appreciated. We especially liked the craps lessons at the Southpoint casino right next door. there were other coupons etc that looked good but we didn't use them.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and Relaxing”
Reviews.Author: firemancal
Reviews.Content: Very nice, everything you need, Pool area Beeeaaautifull! very relaxing, don't know how many times I heard from people staying there how relaxing the main pool area was. No need to leave resort area, we didn't. OK I know, we visited Vegas and didn't go to the strip, So What. South point casino across the street, Restaraunts there, Steak and Shake, Deli sandwiches, Buffet, and more. Bowling, Movie, Spa, beauty shop, barbershop and more. Of course, Gambling Nice little, I mean little, Grill and basic store on site, Made a good Pizza. We had a smoking room, 1 bdrm, no patios here, the wood furniture was scuffed, furniture, adequate and comfortable, didn't think much of it until I saw one of the show rooms they use to sell timeshares, (1st floor, Iris building, Grandview floor mats in front of door, doors unlocked, during day,go take a look, you'll see what I mean) Sure they doll them up to show, but that was nicer than what I was staying in. Go look, you'll see. Don't get me wrong, Definitely 5 stars by me, nothing wrong with my digs at all, very nice, full kitchen, everything we needed, bed comfortable, very very clean, plenty of room, bathrooms large, plenty of supplies, all around excellent. Ground maintenance exceptional, More pool towels than you will ever use. These folks are on it. shuttle to grocery store(free) shuttle to strip(small all day fee) shuttle to airport ($22 R/T). If you get a chance to stay her, Do it.

Reviews.Title: “wow Viva Grandview”
Reviews.Author: diana j
Reviews.Content: I love this place. We have now been here twice now and will be back. The first time was a two bedroom unit and we came with friends, and stayed a week in May 2011. we rented a car and explored out of Las Vegas during the day time and at night hit the strip or South Point. The rooms were large and clean. we were told up front that the cleaning was done once mid week so there were no suprises. We could have had them come in daily for a small fee, but didn't need it. I don't mind throwing the cover on the bed... The second time was oct 2nd to 9th and it was just the two of us... and still couldn't fit everything into a week... we stayed in a one bedroom and the other side was occupied and were quiet. we could here them a little through the common entry but not anywhere near the noise level at the Luxor (oct 2010) we just loved out stay thanks Grandview

Reviews.Title: “WONDERFUL”
Reviews.Author: Carolyn L
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the grandview last November and loved it so we just came back a few days ago and cant stop talking about our week at the Grandview this October....

Reviews.Title: “("WOW")-WHAT A GOOD SURPRISE!”
Reviews.Author: tirvia4
Reviews.Content: Didn't except what we got. Got both units, very comfortable and clean. Bathroom: two sinks, shower also had a spa tub. The bedroom had a king size bed very comfortable lots of pillows they did smell. It's own flat screen t.v plus a spa tub. The living room has a sofa bed flat screen t.v. and dining area. Full kitchen including microware, dishwasher. Our place was brand new so it still looked it. I found out about new buildings from reading reviews. So I REQUESTED IT when I did my reservations. We were located in the building with the children pool. We went down to it and it was quiet, but it was September. We also went to one of the other pools more adults. We have been to Vegas many times and made sure we always stayed on the strip. This time we rented a car and we went where ever and when ever we wanted. We only went to the strip three times and parked for free at the Flamigo also went to the Rio. The rest of the time we used the casinos and restaurants next door or nearby. We did everything we wanted and saw new things. Frontdesk and Housekeeping was very useful. They have things going on for kids and adults everyday. If we ever go back this is the place. One thing that I didn't know and was informed by the maid was that the day they do the cleaning you must tell them you want changing of sheets and so forth. We got basic they picked up towels and vacuumed. I washed my own sheets. We had the vacation we wanted plus more.....

Reviews.Title: “Hooked on condo vacations.”
Reviews.Author: MichiganMomofteens
Reviews.Content: The Grandview was a perfect base for our first trip to the Las Vegas area. The rooms were spacious, spotless and attractive. We made use of the fully equipped kitchen every day, and saved our dining out budget for really special restaurants. Being ten minutes off the strip was just fine, and made for a more relaxing stay. The whirlpool tub in the unit was wonderful for soaking aching feet after a hike/scramble through desert canyons in the Valley of Fire. Another bonus was the equestrian center at the South Point Casino across the street. We walked in and caught the finals in a cutting horse championship. Amazing horsemanship and entirely free of charge.

Reviews.Title: “Great time-share hotel”
Reviews.Author: ieduffy1
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for the third time through an RCI sale offering. Had two one-bedroom units connected by a foyer. Both units had full kitchens, good size comfortable beds, baths with double sinks with immediate hot water in sinks & showers, nice size living rooms and dining area. Located south of the strip, but nearness to 215 freeway and on the 15 allows quick access to strip, Henderson, and western areas such as Red Rock & Summerlin. Will defintely be staying here again. No pressure to take sales presentation as stated by some reviews. All I had to do was say "No."

Reviews.Title: “Many great reasons to stay here!”
Reviews.Author: CanadianTravellerX2
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at the Grandview this year, and we enjoyed it even more because this time we had a rental car which made it a breeze to get to the Strip, about 15 mins drive depending on traffic. We stayed in one bedroom in buliding 1, not newly renovated like some of the other buildings but clean and very nice. Location of this building was fantastic and I would choose this building again for proximity to the pool, the store and the computer lounge. If you have two families traveling together, the two bedroom set up is the best I have seen, you get two one bedrooms with an adjoining foyer, which means each unit has it's own kitchen, bathroom, living/dining rooms. With the queen size pull out sofa in the room, plus king bed you can comfortably sleep 4 in one unit. There is a washer and dryer, they provide one mini box of laundry soap, so if you are planning more than one load bring your own soap. Well appointed kitchen had everything we needed, place settings for 6. The bed was new in our unit, very comfortable compared to our last stay. There is lots of closet space, even in the living room for anyone using the pull out. Check to see if shows are happening at the South Point, we saw a great comic for $15 in the Showroom, seating is lounge style and booths or tables at the back have the best view. Parking on the Strip is a breeze, all the hotels offer free valet service and tipping a few bucks makes for cheap parking. There are also self park lots, can be a hassle to find a stop though. We never waited more than 5 mins for our car from the valet. Parking at the Grandview is free and they had security guards patrol 24 hours a day. Just say no to the presentation (they will tell you it's an information session and offer you show tickets) we saw so many people wasting 1/2 their day to get a voucher, or come to find tickets to the show they want to see aren't available so they settled for something else. Say no, we were never bothered again. Pool area at the resort is excellent. Towels provided, two pools, waterfall, two hot tubs. Lounge chairs need to be upgraded, but they were okay. Fully recommend staying here, you will enjoy it!

Reviews.Title: “2nd time at Grandview”
Reviews.Author: Gizzie
Reviews.Content: This was our second trip to the Grandview, first being October of last year. We love the Grandview, as we prefer to stay off strip, and love its proximity to South Point, a great casino with really good restaurants and a nice atmosphere. We requested the Sage building again, we like its location to the main pool and South Point. I know it's not one of the newer buildings, but as long as it's clean, we don't really care about granite counter tops, etc. The room, however, was a little disappointing this time. Firstly the shower had some sort of stain in it, looked like someone spit some chew or something in it? My husband reported it, but no one ever came to clean it. When housekeeping called to check if the mid week tidy up was ok, I reported the stain again and they offered to come clean it, but we only had 2 days left, so just left it. We only used the huge tub anyhow, but that wasn't really the point. The other disappointment was with the hide a bed. Not only was it quite uncomfortable (but most hide a beds are), but it was broken, and the TV in the living room didn't work. As we got in quite late the first night, we waited until our second day there to have it fixed. the maintenance men came right away and fixed both and were really good about it, checking everything else in the suite to make sure it worked. Aside from that, everything else about our stay was really good. Lots of room, the bed is really comfortable, nice pools and hot tubs and we never had a problem finding a place to park. they called once about the special time share breakfast, but I said no, and that was the end of it. Would be nice if they put black out curtains in the bedrooms though!

Reviews.Title: “Great Timeshare, Misleading Information”
Reviews.Author: Jeannemacl
Reviews.Content: The Grandview Timeshare facility has great to superior rooms and nice facilities but it is a timeshare and even owners of other timeshares are subject to a 90 minute sales pitch. Our fault; we did not read the fine print! But, we were also "mislead" by the front desk agent. We were given the opportunity to purchase show tickets for $50 - cash only - but to get our tickets (called "free gifts") had to take a tour and listen to a hard-sell pitch. The location of the Grandview is very good - off the Strip - but adjacent to a really good local casino, South Point. We will go again, but will avoid taking any of the "free" gifts!

Reviews.Title: “Fab apartment!”
Reviews.Author: Rustiesoo
Reviews.Content: Fab apartment with superb facilities - we went with family and had a double apartment - both huge with fully equipped kitchen, lovely bedroom, big lounge and everything you could want for relaxing stay... Only slight minus was the pool...could have been better! Otherwise lovely resort and stay - would love to go back someday...

Reviews.Title: “Good place for families off main strip!”
Reviews.Author: neelleyfam
Reviews.Content: My kids and I stayed here for a three night stay while we were in town for a convention. The rooms were nice and roomy. The kitchen is fully equipped which made it nice to be able to eat in since food in Vegas is very pricey. The washer and dryer are an added bonus with kids in tow. The rooms need to get black out curtains. Most of us want to sleep in on vacation--not here! Sun comes pouring in via the windows. The pool area was nice and calm. Not a typical "Vegas Party" pool but that was fine with us. The kids enjoyed it. My kids spent a lot of time in the Game room too. The SouthPoint Casino is next door and has a great ice cream shop at the entrance. It is a super easy walk from the Grandview. Down the road are markets, banks , drugstores..anything you'd need. The main strip of Vegas is quite far so you would need a car. It cost me $30 to get a cab to go to the Mirage. Overall this resort is nice and clean. I was not bothered once to do a timeshare tour which is a bonus for me since I hate being bugged to attend those things! I would surely recommend the Grandview for families who need a break from the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Over promise, under deliver”
Reviews.Author: Carol-Lynn R
Reviews.Content: This is not a gold crown resort, unless you know what building to ask for. Ask for #6 & 7. We had to strongly request to change our room - it was stinky and falling apart - needs a reno. the pools don't get sun past 1:00 in the kids pool and limited in the main pool. This is our second time here - never staying here again. The other hotels are much better. Don't go to the timeshare presentation - you don't get the gifts that are promised and we finally walked out at 3 hrs with no gift. Your choice. The malls have the same deals without the stress - it is high pressure - many people to go through. Have a nice trip wherever you go.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort away from the Main Strip”
Reviews.Author: alacruiser
Reviews.Content: This is a new, clean, beautiful resort, located on the strip, but on the south end, apprx 4-5 miles from the hustle and bustle of the strip. There are pools near every building. Grounds immaculate. We were in a double unit (two 1-BR units joined by a foyer). We had a small issue with the TV, and maintenance responded immediately. Wi-Fi is available in rooms, but costs $10/day. That was my only complaint. Took the timeshare tour and was given $150 in slot money. Resort is just across the street from SouthPoint Casino--convenient to restaurants, casino, movie theaters, and a bowling alley. We had a rental car, which was nice, but there is a shuttle available at the resort for some transportation for a fee. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort, few bad points, amazing vacation!”
Reviews.Author: DanAna08
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Grandview from September 18-25 and there was 4 of us in total (my husband, my brother-in-law and his girlfriend) and overall had a wonderful stay. Her parents are timeshare owners so we were invited to the owners’ update and offered free tickets/meal vouchers. At first I was the only one really hesitant (after reading all the reviews on here about the misinformation/lies some people were told). In the end we did get our Lion King tickets (last row, but still great seats and a must-see) and $100 (total for the 4 of us) in meal vouchers. *Side note: We chose to eat at the Luxor (at a fancier restaurant but not outrageous prices called Tender) and we got to see Criss Angel walk in and sit down and eat about 10 feet away from us which was amazing!!!* We were told that all 4 of us HAD to attend, however, when we arrived the 3 of us didn’t have to attend which was quite annoying to find out after the fact. We almost did buy a timeshare though! They got us down to $5,000 for a unit but we still declined as I felt we could not decide on the spot and especially after only being at the resort 1 full day and not seeing what else is out there. ROOM Before arriving I told my future SIL to request one of the new rooms as I heard that the older buildings were not in the greatest shape. They had no problem fulfilling our request and we ended up in the Daisy tower with 2 full suites which shared an entry-way. The rooms are absolutely gorgeous! No complaints whatsoever. We had a full kitchen with granite countertops, nice black appliances, dishwasher, utensils, flat screen tvs, double sinks in the bathroom (also with granite), king size bed, Jacuzzi tub, washer/dryer, pull out sofa, etc. The rooms were also very clean and perfect for our stay. RESORT The overall resort was really nice and everything was pretty easy to find. The staff were very friend and polite and we had no issues. There are 3 pools, however, we only used the main pool. There are 2 pools there – one heated and one normal pool as well as 2 jacuzzis. No complaints here. I always found seats, was never overcrowded and the water was nice and warm. There is a gym on site which I used twice and was satisfied. I only used the cardio side but my husband used the side with weights and he said it was fine for his needs. There is a restaurant/mini gift shop on the resort by the main pool area and we ate there the first day and were pleasantly surprised. It is a bit expensive so we never went back but they do have burgers, fries and even a really yummy veggie burger! They also offer some souvenirs and basic groceries but I wouldn’t buy any of that here unless you’re stuck. They even have a patio with barbecues that you are able to use and we planned on doing a bbq one night, however, we never got to it but it nice that they offer this. The services offered/available is another story. The major downfall of the resort is that the shuttle was $8 per person, per day, so that ate up a bit of our money during the trip. A few times it was an hour late picking us up from the strip with no explanation or anything and one time it took us almost 2 hours to get home from the strip. The shuttle to the grocery store is free, however, they only give you 45 minutes!! We kind of felt like we were on a game show racing near the end to make sure we didn’t miss the shuttle! Also it didn’t run every day. There was a shuttle running to the old Vegas strip, however, that was also $8 per person but picked you up at 8:00 p.m. and back at midnight, however, we took the city bus from the new strip as it was cheaper and an experience. The shuttle to the malls was also free, however, it dropped you off at 2:30 and didn’t pick you up until 6!!!!! We regret not renting a car. There was an internet lounge that you can use for free, however, the computers are pretty much running on dial-up and log you out every 15 minutes. I only used them to check Facebook, so while it was incredibly slow, I was able to do what I needed to do, however, the people actually using them for business or to print their boarding passes or research anything complained a lot and gave up about 90% of the time. To have wi-fi is about $10/day so in my view it was not worth it and I opted to use the internet lounge. We ate a few times at the resort next door (South Point) which is an amazing resort! Their buffet is amazing and a great price too. We also ate at Shake ‘n Steak which was really good (and cheap!). The resort also has a casino with looser slots, bowling alley, spa, huge pool, hair salon/barber shop, movie theatre, etc. Definitely make a visit here at least once! In the end we didn’t mind the distance from the strip, just the means of getting there. I liked that we were away from the craziness of Vegas and at a quiet resort, yet had the choice to go to the Strip when we wanted to. It did suck at times that we were so far from everything, such as when we ran out of milk and it would have been nice to have a variety store or Wal-Mart nearby that you could walk to. Overall we had a great time in Vegas and the resort was gorgeous!! A few downfalls of the resort, but nothing is perfect!! I can’t say I would stay here if I had the choice but for us it was free so I have no real complaints!

Reviews.Title: “Various Stays”
Reviews.Author: JohnnyJimmy
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at the Grandview several times over the past few years. Great accomodations, good price, the South Point casino next door is fabulous. The only downfall is the distance away from the strip. Who wants to rent a car and drive to the strip when you want to party? There is an hourly shuttle to three casino's on the strip, but the last run back to the Grandview starts at 1 AM .. early for Vegas. Taxis can cost up to $30 one way trip. There is also no pool bar ... and alcoholic beverages are not permitted. Also not allowed to use the in-room spa tub after 10 PM

Reviews.Title: “Room was great! Front desk was awful!”
Reviews.Author: 1953mimi
Reviews.Content: We asked for a nonsmoking room, but the frontdesk sent us to a smoking tower! We went back to the front desk to get another room, because when I called from the room I was on hold forever. Second room was a different tower, but the room we got had not even been cleaned! This time when we called, we were transfered 4 times. Two people came to take us to our next room, across the hall. Yea, it was clean and smelled good. But guess what. The TV didn't work! They fixed that for us, and the rest of the stay was good. I won't go back again though. They never even offered to comp us for the issues.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic with reservations”
Reviews.Author: TheAlbertan
Reviews.Content: Got a 2 bedroom with RCI points. Absolutely no hard sell which was greatly appreciated. What they consider a two bedroom is actually two complete one bedroom suites (with separate kitchens) with a common door. Was not happy at first but great once I saw it. Large complex with a lot of high floors so be careful if you do not like heights. Pool looked great, but I did not use it. Parking late at night was dark (had to use the parkades) but never did see anybody "scary" around the place. Place is listed as on-strip but is so far south that it really isn't - not a big deal since you can access I-15 very quickly, or just drive up the strip because are not that many lights. So in a way does not have the charm of an off strip place or an on strip place, but am looking forward to staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “I Loved It”
Reviews.Author: summertimefun
Reviews.Content: I exchanged my RCI week to stay here for the 1st time. I loved it. I had a 2 bedroom which was a little big for me and my hubby because my friends backed out, but I just used the 2nd bedroom and bathroom as my own private dressing room which was priceless. You can leave the doors to the two separate one bedroom condos open to make it feel even bigger than it already is. We stayed in the Jasmine building that didn't have the granite like the Daisy building but I swear its still beautiful and you wouldn't miss it. They have plenty of pools and hot tubs so its easy to find a quiet one. And no they don't have deep pools but I did not mind. The property itself is gorgeous. Plenty of parking and a garage for overflow but I never had to use it. I did do the little sales presentation and yes it was longer than promised, but I took a early morning tour so it did not bother me because I had the rest of the day to do whatever I wanted, besides I got $175 (in exchange for my $20 deposit) in spending in the SouthPoint casino for meals, spa, or bowling. Needless to say food in Vegas is rediculously high so that money was a big budget saver (note they come in $25 certificates and you don't get change so we just ordered extra to take back to the room, no sence in wasting money). So worth a few hours of hearing someone talk. So unless you are weak and vulnerable the sales pitch should not affect you. The food at Southpoint is more than reasonable especially at night when we came back from going out, the prices seemed unreal. $3.95 for steak and eggs. WOW. But back to Grandview, the execise facilties are spacious and had more equipment the the majority of other places I've seen. The cardio room and weight room is separate but it's only across the walk way. They have plenty of gas grills all ready to go. I didn't try the little deli food (why when I ate at Southpoint for free) but I did notice their grocery items were a little pricey but we had a rental car so we just went to the food 4 less and the Walmart which were close. I can go on forever but there is nothing bad to say about the place.

Reviews.Title: “Great, relaxing vacation in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: ScubaTrek
Reviews.Content: I'll start by saying I am a timeshare owner at Grandview, so I didn't have to deal with the sales pitch. They did invite me to an "owner's update" which I declined, and was not asked again. This was our first time actually staying at the Grandview since purchasing our timeshare in 2008. When we had toured in '08 there was construction noise from more buildings going up, but they seem to be in a construction lull right now. There are a couple areas that look like they're being prepped for new buildings, but no actual construction going on right now. Check in was a breeze, and the rooms were big as we had remembered. We had myself, my wife and baby, and mother in law. We booked a 2 bedroom, which is really two one-bedrooms with a shared foyer. The rooms were clean, and kitchens well stocked. There is only a "tidy" service on Wednesday instead of daily maid service. I loved the jacuzzi tub. Complaints about the décor are unfounded in my view. My only real complaint is that the TVs are still the old tube type vice the modern flat screen HD TVs, but I hardly watched any TV anyway. Didn't get a chance to use the pool, spa, or fitness center, but all looked very inviting. Although there is no "room service" per se, there is an on-property Deli that will deliver to your room, but we didn't try it. Next time. I agree with previous reviews - parking near your building can be difficult, especially at night. There is parking at the west end of the property, as well as a 2-floor parking garage. I did not experience the thin walls that others have complained about. Yes, I could tell when the room above flushed the toilet, but I never heard other people's conversations as some others have noted. We were on the 2nd floor of the Lily building. Grandview is about 7 miles south of the strip. Travelling with a one year old, we liked not being on the strip at night. We did spend a couple nights on the strip with some comped rooms, and definitely more noisy and harder to sleep on the strip. Although there are shuttles available, we had a couple day trips planned so rented a car for the week. Having the car was definitely convenient. And if you go to the strip hotels they all have free parking anyway. We really liked the South Point casino across the street. Food was good, ate at the buffet twice. Slots seemed looser than on the strip, and with smaller maximum bets. (for example, on one of the penny slots I like to play, maximum bet on the strip was $4.50, max bet at South Point was $2.00, so if you assume you're going to loose your slot money, at least you can play longer at South Point. However, also hit a couple big payouts.) Overall, we are pleased with our timeshare purchase, and will continue to stay there on future trips to Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “We had a wonderful time and they helped us immensely!”
Reviews.Author: johnstonsm
Reviews.Content: This review is late, but I'm afraid I've been more than a bit busy since our trip. My fiance' and I arrived at the Grandview Las Vegas on 20 Aug 2011. The staff was very welcoming and friendly. We signed in without issue, were invited to gain free tickets to a show for a 90 minute presentation, and were given information about all of the amenities of the resort. Our room was wonderful. The bedroom had a large King sized bed that both my fiance' and I agreed was one of the best we'd ever slept in. There was a jacuzzi tub next to the bed with a small privacy wall. We enjoyed and indulged in that as well. There was also plenty of closet and drawer space. There was a fully functional kitchen that was perfect in size for just the two of us. Utensils and dinnerware was available for use. The washer and dryer in the laundry closet was appreciated and used. We also enjoyed the laundry detergent the hotel provided on the first day. In the living room, there was a pull out sofa. I read a couple of reviews that it wasn't that comfortable, but I was fine with it. Though I preferred the bed. The presentation. My fiance' is already a 5 Star Timeshare owner, so we pretty much knew what to expect. The presentation, the amount, etc. etc. The tour was nice. The lady presenting was friendly. We told them no a couple of times explaining we are in the process of planning a wedding and home ownership prep and this is not the time for a large purchase. They still tried to convince, but accepted the "no" and we were on out way with the tickets as promised. The amenities. We received a coupon book to the Southpoint Casino next door and were able to use $25 (free to us) on the Casino floor. There were also discounts on the buffet, on beverages, and even a trinket from the gift store. We enjoyed ourselves. The Strip. A lot of people have been complaining about proximity to the strip. I loved where we were. We rented a car the week we were there and were on the Strip just about everyday. Only once did we not visit and that was because we were at the Hoover Dam and Grand Canyon that day and were too tired when we got back. We saw the show whose tickets were given in addition to seeing The Lion King (definitely GO). It wasn't that far from the strip and I liked the quiet that I felt after the hustle and bustle of the Strip. Lifesavers. We were at this resort when Hurrican Irene hit and the evening before our flight was to leave that next morning, our flight was cancelled. No flights were going in or out of our home airport and we were scheduled to check out that next morning. Grandview was amazing. They allowed us to use the Internet facilities after hours to see what information we could find out and what arrangements we could make for the next 24 hours. When our attempts were only minimally fruitful, the resort provided us another room at an extremely reasonable and appreciated cost. They even called to make sure we didn't need help with rental information. I cannot remember the name of the woman who helped us so wonderfully (I am so much better with faces-maybe Ms. Judy?), but thank you SO much. All in all, it was a GREAT trip and I'll definitely reurn if ever in that area again. If I can recommend any improvement, it would be free wi-fi in the rooms. Other than that, I recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay when visit Las Vegas( if you have a car ).”
Reviews.Author: nata2009
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Grandview this August, it was great! Me, my husband and our 14 years daughter really liked it- we had one bedroom suite, kitchen with granit countertops and good appliances, two TVs and jacuzzi in a room( that was great, but we were so busy running around and having fun that we have not even used it once!). The pools in the resort were great (there are few), we also enjoyed a hot tub-spa. We went often to a neighboring casino South Point, we liked it there, they did not asked for a $10 bid as the smallest amount you put on a table and looked like more down to earth. Also if you want to go to the strip you really better have your car- it's a free parking in a lot of casinos and you are free to go anywere you pleased. While staying a week in a Grandview we also took a two-days trip to Los Angeles, we've not been in CA so wanted to see at least some of it, we loved it. We also went to the Red Rock Canyon- that was great too. Then we drove to see the Hoover Dam and Grand Canyon ( I just wish we had more time - the Crand Canyon is more then 5 hours drive one way, so pretty far away. Also be ready to pay about $44 for a person for being able to see the edge of the Canyon- which really surprised us- I sought it should be free for anybody to see, but...). Our stay in the Grandview was great, also we agreed on a time shares presentation for some show tickets and play money,which made our stay even more fun. If we go to Las Vegas again we would stay in the Grandview.

Reviews.Title: “very nice place”
Reviews.Author: deputydognmfr
Reviews.Content: This was our first time not staying on the Strip. We will never return to the Strip, our stay was wonderful. We did travel twice to the Strip / Downtown, drove to the Strip and took the bus to Downtown. Our check in went very smooth and received our room well before our noon arrival. In order to get your parking pass you are asked about the timeshare presenatation and it only took about 5 minutes to sign up and get our pass, no pressure at all. We did sign up for the Timeshare presentation and were more then happy with we received for the 97 minute presentation. If there was anything to complain about the presentation is that the examples they used for using your points for flights and cruises were not factual. If you look close at the dates on the information sheets that they are showing you they do not match what they are telling you. It seemed odd that the name on the printed sheets happen to match that of the sales person who was the last person we spoke to before we received our gift. We do look forward to staying at he Grandview again, everything was top notch other then the few issues with the timeshare presentation and getting help opening our safe. It took three days to get someone to actually show up. In their defense they may have showed up when we were not in the room, they have a policy that they will not work on your safe without you present. However each time we called we did stay for one hour. This is a top notch resort.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but only if you want to be far away from....................the stip and things to do!”
Reviews.Author: 04-rt-rider
Reviews.Content: To start off with, it beats out most of your regular places to stay on comfort, amenities, and room size. Rooms are nice, but on a scale of 1 to 10 I would give them a 5. Stayed in much better places where everything worked as it should. The pools were very good. Would have been nice to have a pool that was a little deeper than 4 feet deep. Staff was pretty much not seen or heard unless you called them. If you plan on going and seeing things you will need a car, cab or a shuttle to get there. I would say a rental car would be the most cost effective if you plan on going anywhere. The only thing really in walking distance is the South Point. They have a lot to do there. Most everything at the Gandview is pretty expensive. A 16oz soda will cost you $2.00 and a two liter a mile and a half down the street will cost you $1.99. As this is a timeshare, they will ask you to see a 90 minute presentation (expect the hard sale and it to be 3 hours long at a minimum). Just say no! I would have to say oversell and under deliver is their motto when they deliver the presentation. They are big on hype, show you marble and nice fancy rooms and then have you stay in a room that does not look like what they showed you. As for resorts, I would only give it a middle of the road. It is more of an island from most everything so the manditory need for transportation drops it down on the score. The 90 minute (3 hour) hard sale drops it down again. Room maintenance was on the low side, (burns on the Formica counter tops, kitchen cabinet doors loose and the garbage disposal inoperative. I drop the score again. I did end up giving this resort a 3 since I could not give it a 2.5.

Reviews.Title: “Almost a "FIVE"”
Reviews.Author: JustAnOldGuy
Reviews.Content: We had four two bedroom timeshares reserved for a family reunion – 20 of us). The posts here I had read warned of high pressure selling before you could get a parking pass. I did not find that at all. We were asked once, politely, and when I said no thanks, politely, that was accepted. We were assigned four units on one wing of one floor – the total wing – which made for great freedom of visiting between our family over the week. Overall it was a great vacation and I have just one small negative to report. A gold crown resort should not charge for wireless internet - this one does ($50 a week). Also the computers in their internet room are so old that my bank's website refused to allow access - they no longer support that browser. Small points but they stop the resort getting 5's across the board in my view. The kitchen utensils were also a little limited from a cooking point of view.

Reviews.Title: “"If you have a car not a bad location...otherwise stay closer in"”
Reviews.Author: Lynette312
Reviews.Content: We just spent a week in this resort and we have traveled for years in beautiful resorts I would rate this one at about a 5 out of 10 and that would be for the pools alone ++. The rooms needed updating in fact we asked to be moved after 3 days we had had enough of things not working like (tea kettle leaked, kitchen faucet leaked all over when you turned it on, jetted tub had broken valve and the breaking point was the smoke coming in thru the non smoking room from the 10th floor. We were on the 9th floor and floors 10,11 and 12 were smoking floors) With 9 towers I figured they could find us somewhere else and then they wanted to charge us $50 a room for housekeeping service I refused and talked to a manager and that was waived. We had 2 units 907A and B in the Primrose which is an old building then they move us to the Jasmine almost the same but everything worked this time. ***warning the front desk will invite you to see a show just watch a 90 min presentation" well not a big deal we are owners we could handle that well they are pushy and 3 hours later during the presentation you are turned over 4 times I'm not kidding and hard sell after hard sell. The main pitch is development is coming soon to that end of the strip but for 45K for a buy in it is not worth it. They went all the way down to 5K with alternating years and we still walked. So I would avoid them they want a sell no matter what. Do not go in August it was 112 degrees almost everyday and a hot wind blowing. We did get to see the Hoover Dam, Fremont street which I was impressed with the Golden Nugget hotel and Shark Tank and the Plaza in old town. The people on the streets handing out disgusting literature to our teenage children and my husband was disgusting and rude. They were all over the ground hopefully the city can fix that problem. I would come back to Vegas again but stay in a different place for sure.

Reviews.Title: “What a great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Jackie007_41
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a week in Las Vegas with my sister, her husband, and my friend. Altogether we had booked 3 one-bedroom condos - more than we needed but very comfortable! The condos were beautiful and well appointed. We cooked brunch in our suite each morning and then returned in the late afternoon for 'happy hour' before going out for dinner. It was the perfect mix of in and out. The shuttle back and forth from the strip proved to be an excellent way to get from the Grandview to many of the locations along the strip. The driver's were friendly and informative and they arrived on time at each location. Once we established their schedule, we became very proficient at using the shuttle as our main form of transportation. It was a great time and all four of us would be happy to return to the Grandview when we visit Vegas again!

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay if you're planning lots of time on the Strip”
Reviews.Author: katej715
Reviews.Content: Very nice rooms, large kitchens, living room. Unfortunately, the TV in the living room did not have cable, only access to the DVD player. There are two pools. I would have preferred an "adult swim" time from 10pm-12am. There were still tons of kids splashing around when all I really wanted to do was soak and relax in the pool. There is a shuttle that travels to the Strip at 3 convenient locations at various hotels. It was $8.00 per person for an unlimited 1 day pass. Stayed 6 nights and probably went to the Strip 4 of those days so $32 in transportation isn't too bad, but it did eat up a lot of time waiting for shuttles to and from. If you need cash, don't use the ATM in the Grandview lobby. It's a $9.25 charge just to use the machine. South Point Casino is very close by, and they only charged $3.50 for an ATM withdrawal. The least appealing thing about the hotel are the pushy staff members. Upon check in, we were ushered to get our "welcome" package, which was just a sly way of them getting us to take part in their sales pitch. We were offered deep discounts on tickets to multiple shows. Initially we turned away the offer (after being rebutted several times), but returned to the front desk after we settled in to our rooms to learn more. We talked to the same staff member who said we could not get more than one show at discount. We didn't want to take part in the program if we couldn't get two shows but she was relentless. She kept saying she'd put us down for the one show, after us repeatedly saying we did not want to take part. Finally we just walked away after our final "no." Overall, if you have thick skin and don't mind a lot of pushy staff, and also don't mind being far off the Strip, this is an ideal location for your stay in Las Vegas

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms, pushy sales people”
Reviews.Author: Petey1234
Reviews.Content: The Grandview is actually a HUGE timeshare complex. While the rooms are amazing and the pools are nice, be prepared to have a timeshare sales pitch thrown at you every step of the way. They are WAY too pushy about it. Also, the location is really a pain. We used the shuttle to get to the strip ($8 per person for all day). Depending on where you want to go, it takes 10-30 minutes and only runs until 1am, which is crazy. Let's face it, this is Vegas, no one wants to go back to their room at 1am. Also, the shuttle had a bad exhaust problem that leaked fumes inside the shuttle. If you want a very fancy room for a good price and don't mind pushy sales people or the location, you will love this place.

Reviews.Title: “NO FREE SHUTTLE SERVICE TO AN FROM AIRPORT.”
Reviews.Author: Colleen M
Reviews.Content: Just want to let those know who will be staying here. This resort does NOT offer FREE airport shuttle service. The price just from the airport to the hotel....$12.00...one way. Thats a lot if you ask me. South Point Casino right across the street has free shuttle to and from the airport. So look to put out $22.00 round trip PER person plus tip for bags to get to and from the airport to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “biggest scam ever!”
Reviews.Author: taranm
Reviews.Content: went to view this property under the promise of receiving a great deal on show tickets. The "high pressure sales" were crazy and so were the the insults and the decreasing level of professionalism of the salesmen as the day dragged on was astonishjng… long story short, we never did get our show tickets but they did manage to scam us into losing a whole day of our vacation! I won't be back!

Reviews.Title: “Not that great”
Reviews.Author: MP526
Reviews.Content: We exchanged for this property and stayed with our family of six and had a 2 bedroom suite - which was actually 2 of the rooms, connecting with a single entryway. The rooms are not adjoining except for the entryway - for all three doors, you need a key - which made us a bit paranoid about locking ourselves out of a side especially with our 4 children. The good: There was a stack washer-dryer in each side. The kitchen was full and had the necessary appliances. The bathrooms were roomy as were the rooms & living areas. We stayed in building 3 Lily which was right across the main pool area. The main pool area was nice - double pool, one with a nice waterfall. They are not huge but it was comfortable enough as far as being accomodating for the guests. There is also a hot tub. I believe that there was another pool a little ways down from the main one which had a kiddie area - although, I can't speak of it personally but my husband took the kids one day. Elevators were fast. The not-so-great: First off, parking can be an issue. If you are out after 8-9pm, most of the stalls fronting your building will be taken. We had to park quite a ways away from our unit most nights. There is covered parking at the far end of the property but most of it is outdoors. The rooms are decorated in what I call a 70's style. I haven't seen that much formica in awhile, especially in a new property. The tubs have jacuzzi jets but are outside of the bathroom itself next to the bed so there is little privacy. The water and jets can be easily heard from the room next door - we heard theirs, I'm sure they heard ours. The showers have no spout and the showerheads are not that strong. There are double sinks though. The beds in the bedrooms are adequate but the linens, again, appeared very outdated. The sofa beds have VERY thin mattresses and as sofas, are very uncomfortable. The TV's are HUGE - but not in the good way - they are the old style with the large back to them. There are TV's in the bedrooms and TV's in the living area with a DVD player. However, the remotes worked sporadically at best and most times, we had to walk up to the TV to change the channel/volume. The pitch: We got one when we checked-in. My husband said we were not interested - pressed him a bit, but not too much. We got a call 2 times later - again, not interested but they weren't pushy. Not bad. One thing that I did not like or appreciate - since we had both sides of the one entryway we kept our doors open and used the entryway door as our main door whiile we were inside. One day, without knocking, an male employee just opened the entryway door and hollered "Oh, are you guys leaving? This is supposed to be vacant later today." There is a reasonable expectation of privacy when you are a guest at a hotel and while it may have been a mistake on his part, knocking and giving us time to actually answer the door would have been a lot more courteous. Overall, this was an adequate property. Would I stay here again? Not if I had any other choice.

Reviews.Title: “The Grandview is peaceful.”
Reviews.Author: Giardina47
Reviews.Content: My wife and I visited the Grandview the last week of June though the 4th of July. The Grandview resort is South of the Strip next to the South Point Hotel and Casino. The resort grounds are clean and safe and peaceful, compared to the hustle and bustle of the strip. The Grandview towers are also clean and quiet. The units are more like apartments than hotel rooms with a separate kitchen and dining area next to the living room. My wife and I have been going every year since 2005 and plan on going again. There is a TV in the living area and the bedroom and the king size bed is very comfortable. There is free internet in the registration area and an exercise room beside the pool area. There are numerous restaurants nearby as well as in the South Point Casino and the more upscale "M" down the road. The South Point has movie theaters and bowling and is a few minutes walk from the Grandview. The Grandview is a Timeshare resort and there are always people touring the grounds, but we never found it to be an intrusion. For us the South Point has been a nice haven. We highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: Meaganinez
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here during our visit to Vegas last year, and thought it was great! We're RCI owners, and were able to trade in our week elsewhere for a week here, and we were very impressed. I liked being able to park in front of our building and being able to get to my room quickly, without having to walk through a casino. We had driven down from Canada, so we had our own car. This was a bonus, as the hotel is about 8 miles south of where the "Strip" starts. The room was great! Lots of room for the two of us, and nicely decorated. We shared an entrance with another couple, but didn't see them at all. We took advantage of the full kitchen and stayed in for a lot of our meals, which saved us a decent chunk of change. We would have used the laundry, but we did so much shopping it wasn't necessary! The pool area was nice, with great hours. We didn't spend a lot of time there, but the hot tub was great after a long day of walking the Strip! There were organized trips to Fremont Street, grocery stores, and the like, but we didn't use any of these services. Check-in was fast and easy, very little waiting, and they asked us if we had any room preferences before they booked us in. Overall, great rooms, good amenities, clean, well-kept, and the service was good. I would recommend this resort without any hesitation!

Reviews.Title: “Love the resort, hate the sales pitch”
Reviews.Author: CalNevari
Reviews.Content: As an owner, I have nothing but good things to say about Grandview. As somebody who values his vacation time, I will do all I possibly can to steer clear of the sales pitch. On our first stay after becoming owners, we naively agreed to attend an "update" meeting. Only truly dumb thing I've done in Vegas. Of course the meeting turned out to be a sales pitch, which annoyed us, as we'd already bought a timeshare. Like others, when we weren't receptive to the high pressure tactics, we were sent to talk to a series of other sales staff. Each subsequent seller was both more insistent, and more condescending. The last guy we talked to was downright insulting, basically telling us we were stupid for passing up the "golden opportunity" he was trying to ram down our throats. At this point I'd had more than enough, and I advised Mr. Charm that we were through. I collected our 50 dollars In gaming vouchers and we left. Hardly seemed worth it for being held hostage for three and a half hours. No when we check in, we agree to attend the update, and just go to our condo and unplug the phone. As for the resort itself, we love it. Although the last time out, we were somewhat taken aback by the condition of the suite. It wasn't horrible, but having always stayed in the newer units, staying in the oldest unit didn't quite live up to previous years. Still enjoyed it though.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best!!”
Reviews.Author: koolsmum
Reviews.Content: Myself and my wife have enjoyed timeshare for over 21 years around the world. The unit we had at the Grandview was exceptional. Large open plan kitchen and living area. Ensuite bathroom with jacuzzi tub. Huge bed too. We did the one hour timeshare blah blah knowing at the end we would get $50 credit each at the South Pointe casino next door along with free meal vouchers at the casino buffet.............we never bought a meal....fantatstic food!! The resort was immaculate and laid back with good pools and great staff. Free transport was laid on for guests to the local supermarket plus for a small fee the use of the shuttle bus to the Strip. Timeshare at its best!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Friendly Resort”
Reviews.Author: rickwend
Reviews.Content: Really great location just off the freeway and at the south end of the strip ideal for families to have access to the fun of Las Vegas without actually being in the middle of it! The resort has lots of things planned like free snow cones daily and an early evening movie for the kids. They also offer a shuttle bus to go grocery and outlet shopping. Really lovely new, clean apartments with everything you need in the kitchen but also lots of places to eat with a 10 minute drive. Not to mention a huge whirlpool tub in the bathrooms. The South Point Casino is right next door, so you can make use of all that they have to offer food wise and there is also a cinema and bowling alley.

Reviews.Title: “Don't hold your expectations too high!”
Reviews.Author: Bako72
Reviews.Content: From the outer appearance, this hotel looks nice and the rooms look nice and clean. However, the sofa sleeper was junk. A one bedroom does not sleep 4, as advertised. We took our 2 children, who couldn't even sleep on the super thin, spring "mattress." We stayed for 3 nights, and the first night, the only remedy hotel staff had was extra blankets. It wasn't until the second night that we were able to get one of 600 (super thin) egg crate toppers for the mattress. With 600 of these, you know they have many other complaints about the mattresses. Also, they consider a 2 bedroom, 2- 1 bedroom units side-by-side. If you have small children, I definitely wouldn't recommend this accommodation. The pool area was pretty small, given the size of the "resort." The lighting in the pool area was pretty dim at night and we had to go to the kiddy pool area to find towels, as they weren't sufficiently stocked and staff we're nowhere to be found. We did an RCI exchange to stay in Vegas, and the Grandview was nothing like the service we were used to at our home timeshare resort. We decided to listen to their timeshare presentation (to get cheap show tickets- saw David Copperfield, which was great, so I guess was worth the presentation), but given the lack of service and poor sleeping accommodations, we would definitely not stay here again, let alone spend money on a timeshare. Overall the accommodations were okay, but not worth staying again.

Reviews.Title: “2nd visit to Grandview Las Vegas. Does not disappoint.”
Reviews.Author: WebSerf
Reviews.Content: Grandview is one of the best compromises of price and accommodations I've come across. (Important. this is not a hotel/casino). At less than $100.00 a night (when we stayed), one can stay in a suite that has a full kitchen, stacked laundry unit in the room, along with a very nice layout of both space and furniture. Don't take the word "luxury" the wrong way. This is NOT a 5-star luxury stay, but, for the price, a family of 4 can easily stay, and enjoy the time there, and for a couple, it's a very comfortable stay. Although we didn't make much use of the kitchen, it was nice to have it available for the limited use it did get. The laundry unit allows you to travel light, but remember to bring your favorite detergent. All Grandview rooms are mini-suites (note, there may be larger units that I'm not aware of). The following made/makes a stay here a more enjoyable experience: 1. There is/was a Television in both the main room, and the bedroom. 2. Separate from the bathroom, there is a bath tub that, in essence is part of the bedroom, allowing others to use of the toilet and shower without losing privacy. 3. The stacked Washer/Dryer makes traveling light a breeze. 4. All rooms have a full (or nearly full) kitchen. 5. Internet is available. 6. Large enough for a family of 4, but really nice for a couple. 7. Reasonably priced (at the time of our stay). 8. Only a few minutes away from the main Strip, off of the 15 FWY, just south. I think most folks will find Grandview to meet all reasonable needs for a stay of most any number of days. It's not a luxury resort, but it is a great place to stay otherwise.

Reviews.Title: “Very satisfied with accomadations!”
Reviews.Author: SteveiG
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a week at Grandview. Check In went smoothly other than being passed off to another employee for a parking pass (timeshare sales appointment). This was just a little annoying but did not take much time since I explained I was not interested. Parking lot near unit was often full and at times we had to walk a short ways to our building (yeah I know welcome to Vegas). Unit was spacious, clean, and comfortable. The unit had a comfortable king size bed with an assortment of different pillows some firm, others soft etc. We did not use any of the amenities on the property so I can not comment on those. I also got one message on the phone about a "a free gift" to be picked up, another timeshare sales tactic which I ignored. I actually expected them to hound me more about this timeshare thing, trust me avoid it! "Free" show tickets or a hundred bucks is not worth your time. They will likely irritate you by taking to long, or rope you into buying something that is not that great of a deal. Timeshares are not investments! Distance from the strip is short, and highway can be used to avoid evening traffic coming or going. Nice inexpensive burger joint at the casino next door. The Casino across the street is within walking distance, has a few dining options. I was not impressed with the gaming, however I am a picky gambler. Craps tables allowed limited odds and dealers were less than energetic. I would stay again, I really like the Grandview. PRICE was very affordable since this is a timeshare you can trade in for next to nothing.

Reviews.Title: “Great resort but has a few flaws...”
Reviews.Author: cherylfabry
Reviews.Content: Through our time share, we booked a one bedroom with a sleeper sofa which claimed to sleep up to 4. We were greeted promptly and check in was quick and easy.
