We were not offered a time share presentation which is good since I would have declined. The room was very clean and spacious. There was a full kitchen with a utensils, pots and pans as well as a small washer and dryer and detergent for one load. There was also a jacuzzi tub and 2 TVs. The sleeper sofa was completely shot unfortunately. The bed was broken...it pulled out from the sofa but the lower portion was broken so that the main support in the middle rose about 8-10 inches above the broken middle piece. We tried to just sleep on the couch and floor after that but the couch cushions were completely flat and sank into the broken bed. Tune resort was completely booked so we booked a second room at the South Point hotel across the street so we could all get a good nights sleep. The pools were clean but nothing special. The hotel is convenient to the South Point casino where we spent most of our time. There is a 64 lane bowling alley, movie theatre, poker room as well as other card games and slots. The restaurants were reasonably priced but there was always a wait...I gather the service there is really slow. Its a nice off the strip alternative for Las Vegas but you need your own transportation and be aware that each suite really only sleeps 2 people.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, but a lot of minor annoyances”
Reviews.Author: ldpickup
Reviews.Content: Just returned from an 8-day stay at the Grandview. If you're looking for Las Vegas glitz and glamour and convenience to the strip, look elsewhere, but if you are looking for a great bargain and a chance to take a break at times from the hustle and bustle, then the Grandview might work for you. The Grandview is conveniently located across the street from a casino, although the South Point is by no means fancy. It is a very basic casino, but if you just want to gamble and visit the buffet every now and then, it will suffice. It's also within easy reach of the highway and you can easily be right in the midst of the strip, and parking at strip hotels in Vegas turns out to be cheap (free if you park yourself) and fairly easy, so it's very easy to be downtown in no time. I thought it was nice to be able to get a reprieve every now and then! However, the rooms and facilities were basic and we had several minor issues that really added up. Such as: the toilet paper holder was a strange design and loose so that the roll kept simply falling off the holder; 2 of the 8 treadmills in the fitness room were broken the whole week--I wonder how many weeks they will be/were out of commission; there were wet wipes for wiping off the fitness equipment the first 2-3 days were were there, but after that they were nowhere to be seen (not really sure why it would be difficult to replace the wipes?); internet access was $10/day or $50/week. This seemed excessive to me. I think they throw this in for free if you take "the tour". All in all it was a positive experience, but it did seem very basic and the minor annoyances made me glad I did not spend much money on this one.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay - Absolutely Return Again”
Reviews.Author: nemdog
Reviews.Content: Was there over 4th of July weekend. Had a room on the 12th floor of the Jasmine building. Found the room to be very spacious and clean. Wouldn't have changed a thing about the room. The various pools at the resort were a hit with my young children. Towels and chairs were always plentiful.....never had to fight someone for a good spot. We did the time share meeting, and it was well worth it. We rcvd $175 worth of food vouchers at the South Point Casino. We knew they were gonna be pushy during the meeting, but that was the trade off. I'd do it again in a heartbeat. Having been to Vegas many times, staying on the strip was not necessary. This was in a great location for us. It was only a short drive to the strip, and probably 15-20 minutes to 'Old Vegas'. Can't wait to come back and stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Will Never Stay again!!!”
Reviews.Author: kpmoffatt
Reviews.Content: I own a RCI time share at the Cliffs of Peace Cannon in Vegas. I recently stay at the Grandview Hotel and it was a horrible experiences. When I first checked in they only reserved one suit. I was supposed to have two. Of course, it was 4th July weekend so there were no other suits available! Second I made the mistake of agreeing to meet one of their representative for lunch to promote the resort. This guy was the rudest individual I have ever met!!! He insulated me three times before I ended the meeting and told them they can keep their gift. I am just one review but I will never be back at The Grandview Hotel Las Vegas! "Semper FI"

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, be very aware of the timeshare scam!”
Reviews.Author: iceman2011_11
Reviews.Content: Was in Vegas with wife and mother in law enjoying a nice vacation!!! We were offered free tickets to shows or events if we went to a tour of hotel.. Told it would be 1 to 2 hours and to keep questions to a minimum.. Got picked up by shuttle bus and brought there, 15 minutes late already.. Donuts and coffee for breakfast, subs and juice for lunch. Just ok not great.. Tour and sales pitch went about 3 hours, sales lady "Donna" and sales manager, aka the closer "Lance" were very friendly at first.. After saying no to many offers, starting at about 49K and ending at around 15K, each offer having different options of down payment and monthly payments their attitudes changed.. They questioned my wife and I's commitment level, asked if we were scared to make decisions in life, just because we didn't want to make a 3 to 7 year financial agreement with them after a 3 hour sales pitch!! Lance at one point even questioned me about providing a better life for my family, which I might add we already vacation 3 to 4 times a year, so not bad to begin with.. All in all we felt very insulted by the end and misled as to what we were getting into when we signed up.. Not worth the cheap tickets we paid $22 dollars for, would pay full price next time and save the 4 to 5 hours total we wasted of our day! Place is average to slightly better, but service to us was overall poor, due to the two we had dealings with.. Save your time and money, go somewhere else!!!

Reviews.Title: “exceeded expectation - exeptionally accomodating management”
Reviews.Author: 1agrammy
Reviews.Content: 2 BR suite - friend needed scooter, thus required frequent loading/unloading into rental van - management went out of its way to facilitate - stay was flawless in every respect - casino next door, close to airport, nice pool area - definately recommended - will stay there again -

Reviews.Title: “Great place off the strip”
Reviews.Author: hollsdolls
Reviews.Content: This is mainly a timeshare hotel but I found it by booking on hotels.com. I went with two friends and it was by far one of the cheapest hotels during one of the most expensive weekends in Vegas (Venetian was going for $500/night)! The hotel itself was nice - had a full kitchen stocked with everything we would need if we were going to eat in. Beds and pillows were comfortable and staff was very nice. We never once were approached about a timeshare tour but that could have been because a) we checked in at 12:30 am and b) we were three single girls. The staff was all very nice and check-in/check-out was a breeze. We were given a handicapped room, which wasn't a problem because the shower and bathroom were huge! The walls are thin - we did hear the people staying in the room next to us and the people above us. Pool area was great and so was the deli/snack shop. Gym had great equipment. The only drawback for me was that we were so far from the strip (coming from someone who is used to ALWAYS staying on the strip).... construction on Las Vegas Blvd and I-15 was annoying but what can you do? It is great for those who don't like the hustle and bustle of the busy strip and it would seem like a good place to take a family. Had a parking garage which was helpful during those 100+ temp days. Good hotel for a great price!

Reviews.Title: “Spring Stop in Vegas!`”
Reviews.Author: cresil
Reviews.Content: This hotel looks new and is very clean. Our 2 bedroom suite has complete amenities such as full kitchen, washing machine, 1 king bed, 2 single beds, 1 sofa bed, 2 T&B and 1 jacuzzi. The only problem is the location, it is far from the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Great Fun”
Reviews.Author: edmontonian1977
Reviews.Content: We have a timeshare at the Grandview so we decided to stay for the first time in March 2011. It was great and a lot of fun. It was so comfortable how it was like being at home and not in a cramped hotel room. It had a full kitchen, living room with pullout couch and very nice flat screen tv on the wall, huge bathroom, huge bedroom with another flat screen tv on the wall and a jacuzzi, and a washer and dryer so I didnt have to pack heavy as I could wash my clothes and this is very convenient when you go anywhere for a week or more at a time. We could cook in the suite or eat out. There are a lot of activities here or next door at the next resort and the strip is still close enough to go often. Also, shopping is nearby and there is free shuttle to shopping, grocery store, liquor store, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Love the condo, hate the location and beware of the timeshare peptalk”
Reviews.Author: Gensmith
Reviews.Content: This is our first time using this resort. We like the size and the unit. I love that it looks like a regular condo. We didn't like the pool. Although they had a few, It was average for such a big resort. I do like the fact that it was next to the South Point casino and that was actually a plus BUT, it's so far from the strip. If you didn't have a car, you would be forced to take a taxi or another form of public transportation. We also opted to attend the "owner's update" breakfast. I didn't mind it except for the fact that they were not clear on what exactly you would get after the presentation. When we checked in, the clerk who signed us up said we would get $100 cash plus for $50 bucks i can have 4 tickets to a show. He also said we would get $25 of free play at South Point and coupons book which he handed out at check in. When we showed up at the meeting, the girl who checked us in confirmed the "gifts" we were receiving. after the presentation, the guy who was giving the "gifts" said that if we chose to get $100 cash then we cant get the show. When i asked what about what the people told us we were getting, he just casually said that they were not supposed to mention anything regarding the gifts and if they confirmed what we were promised, they were only going by what we told them...Really? The meeting took over two hours long. The price started at $46K and at the end became $9K..it was like buying a car. If i were to upgrade what we own now, i will not do it with these people. Virgin Timeshare owners to be, listen up...be smart about what u want to get. They always start up HIGH to see where u are at, just know that they have foreclosed "inventory" as well that is a bargain deal.

Reviews.Title: “If you have kids, you'd want to stay here!”
Reviews.Author: gspdominates
Reviews.Content: We took this trip from 6/11- 6/18. Never been to Las Vegas before and always heard, you need to stay on the strip. Well after living in NYC all my life- staying on the strip is not a vacation. It's nice and all the action is there, but it's crowded, there are lines to all the restaurants and walking the strip is not an easy task, especially with children or elderly. The Grandview is a pretty big resort and it's about 7 miles from the strip, but to me that's what was so great about it- when I went to the pool I never had to fight for a chair or towel. They had a pizzeriz/ deli at the pool or bring down a cooler. There's a children's pool with the mushrooms and then a building over there's a refrigerated pool and a heated one as well, and I don't mean a jacuzzi- they had those as well. Parking can get crowded, so there's a tower, which is covered and in that Vegas heat, you may want that. Parking is free at all the casinos so rent a car and drive to the strip. Mind you traffic can be nighmarish (like in NYC). But, even if you stayed on the strip and drove to the other end, it can be tough. You need to understand if you stay on the strip, when you go to the pool, you need to go through the casino, the crowds etc, fully clothed. Imagine doing that with kids and their toys. But the pools are insane too. Staying at the Grandview made me realize that Vegas is a beautiful place and that you can go on a family vk there. We went to the Grand Canyon, Red Rock canyon, Hoover Dam, saw shows etc and will definitely go back and defintely stay at the Grandview again. We did gamble a bit, but we're not big on that. We had a 1 bedroom and there was a jacuzzi tub. 2 flat panel tvs, fully equipped kitchen and all modern furnishings. The Southpoint casino is next door and has restaurants, there are supermarkets and shops down the road. If you're looking for a compromise, a lil r&r and then some night life- this is the place for you! Internet access is free and plentiful. I even considered pourchasing, I loved it so much, but I only get 4wks vacation and I already own elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend staying here!”
Reviews.Author: KiaBJ
Reviews.Content: Our stay at this resort was wonderful. The staff was not pushy at all and were extremely accommodating. They only bugged us 2x about listening to there sales pitch after that we were left alone. They helped us with excursions and the shuttle to go further down on the strip was so convenient and can be used all day for only $8 bucks per person. Our room was perfect - so clean and everything was in working order. We stayed in the Daisy building. It was the perfect getaway. It was nice to come back from the craziness of the strip to a nice clean quiet hotel. Having South Point right next door was perfect too.. when we wanted more food or something else to do it was right there for us to hang out at.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for Families Exploring Beyond Vegas or Extended Stays”
Reviews.Author: StarAlly
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at The Grandview at Las Vegas because this was the choice resort of a buddy celebrating his birthday. I'd never been to Vegas so was not familiar with much. While everything about the resort is great, this is not for those interested in enjoying the strip or nightlife for the weekend. This is definitely for those with children who want to do more than walk the strip and drink or plan on being in Vegas longer than 3 days. The location is far south of the strip, but close enough that you can hop the shuttle to the strip and be there in 20 minutes. Location is excellent for day trips to Hoover Dam or Lake Mead. Overall, the resort was great. Room was clean and, since it's a timeshare, was equipped with many amenities found at home. We found this very helpful for stocking our "beverages" and making margaritas. :) We even used the stove to make breakfast. I'd recommend, but only for persons who plan on being in the area longer than a couple days since it offers many of the amenities found at home or for families with children.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice”
Reviews.Author: AZ2MI2AZ
Reviews.Content: This place is great and would recommend for all ages; family or friends. The Grandview is on Las Vegas Blvd on the South end. I have a timeshare in Mexico and was given opportunity to visit via RCI. The staff is very friendly and the property well maintained. We had (3) one bedroom units and asked to be in the same floor near each other. There was a 45 minute wait to accommodate this request, but well worth it. We were on the 3rd floor of the Daisy Building. The rooms are beautifully decorated, very spacious, clean and no smells. Granite countertops in kitchen, bath including divider in the bedroom. Bathroom has double sinks, full shower and vanity with bench. There is a nice Jacuzzi tub in the large bedroom. 2 nice large TV's, DVD player and a washer/dryer in each room. While we never cooked, I did keep the fridge stocked with beverages and made use of the fridge ice maker. Kitchens full size appliances, have both plastic and glass beverage glasses. This made it very convenient to take a beverage to one of the many pools. We did see quite a few guests using the gas grills near the pool area. This is a large complex, but it never felt crowded. There is a convenient deli / pizza and convenience store near the pool with the waterfall. There is a lot of parking near the units and there is a very nice parking garage at the back. To be honest when we got home after midnight we did park in the garage. There is security on the property and since I was not going to be getting up and leaving early the next day it kept the car cool. There are plenty of handicapped spaces near each building and at least 3 elevators in each. The South Point Casino is conveniently located next door. This is a very big casino/hotel/equine/ theater. It was quite the happening place, very clean and bright. There are probably about 11 restaurants from sandwiches/ sushi/ steak / buffet. Out favorite was the Coronado Cafe, each of us enjoyed all of our meals there. The Coronado Cafe has great Chinese food too. The entertainment was fun and enjoyable. Shows were only about $5.00 admission and were better than those we paid more for at the Las Vegas Hilton and Hard Rock. I would recommend a car for convenience; rental rates are not too bad in Las Vegas. While we were there we visited all the new casinos ("M", Aria and Cosmopolitan) as well as the regulars. While we never won at any of them, we enjoyed our week at the Granview. It was nice to go back to the quiet serenity and get off the noisy strip. I would recommend the Grandview and look forward to visiting again. Only negative was wifi price, would rather pay one fee like $20. for week. They do have a nice computer room for free.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Timeshare!!!”
Reviews.Author: SHAKIMAH26
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the The Grandview May 26- 1 June and had a great time. The resort is nice but the room we stayed in was beautiful. We had a room on the 17th floor in the Daisy Building. When we arrived we were greeted as soon as we stepped foot into the lobby. The people were very friendly and very professional. I am a firm believer in when you treat people with respect you will receive the best. I received the best this resort had to offer. For the people complaining about the timeshare presentation; the resort is not to blame, the blame falls on you for volunteering to do the tour. It is so easy to say "no"; however, being greedy gets you some nose bleed seats in threater. I was on vacation and did not have 3 hours to spare. I said "no" and kept it moving. The only negative feedback I have for the resort are: no restuarants and too far away from the action so they need to provide a free shuttle for their guests. I will stay here again and look forward to returning.

Reviews.Title: “Grandview-tastic”
Reviews.Author: kidhead
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Grandview for one week and thoroughly enjoyed our time there. We were reluctant at first as the photographs looked liked you were sunbathing in the car park, but there are a few pools and trees to break up the scene. The flat itself was superb with everything you could wish for in a stay. The South Point Casino next door had a good buffet with a cinema and bowling area. There are two negative points I can think of with Grandview and they are the transport to the strip and the internet, which is why it did not receive five stars. It will cost you $8 per person per day to take the shuttle to the strip, which over a week runs to $112 per couple! As an owner I am very disappointed as I asked our seller if there were shuttles and he assured me there were and they were at no cost. What would it take to reduce the ludicrous amount of staff on at the reception (at one point there were 12 members of staff) and get get a few drivers in instead to drive a coach? They do run free shuttles to the small Wal-Mart and Outlet Centre so it is possible. The internet really needs to be addressed as well. If the International Airport in Las Vegas can provide free wi-fi then I am sure the Grandview can.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful resort”
Reviews.Author: J08N
Reviews.Content: Stayed here end of May 2011 and it was a great unit. Stayed in Iris building and had requested and received a 2 bedroom, top floor (so we wouldn't hear people walking and running above us.) Called in a week before departure and made request. Received top floor of Iris building and the 2 bedroom was 2 one bedroom condos connected by a foyer - great way of vacationing with my sister - we had privacy when we wanted it and close by when we didn't. this building has a pool. Close to the casino across the street, well lit at night close to the highway. We had a car rental and it was great-no timelines- 10 minutes from strip by car and on strip casino parking was free. Malls only short distance from casino Best trip we took was helicopter to Grand Canyon with limo pickup at the hotel and lunch on the canyon.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to return to the Grandview!”
Reviews.Author: gmk82282
Reviews.Content: We just returned tonight, and before I even unpack, I just want to write about what a wonderful experience we had at the Grandview. Wow - it was ideal for us - especially the separate units. My 17 yr old and 19 yr old stayed in the A part with my 8 yr old and I was able to let them sleep as late as they wanted to and they were able to keep their unit as messy as they wanted (I really didn't care). We made meals in our unit. The first morning, we went to Wal-Mart (really really cheap!!) and bought tons of groceries and we actually all enjoyed not eating out. We only ate out once for a 5 night stay. South Point is great - I miss it already. I almost caved at the time share presentation but my husband was strong. The presenter was ever so pleasant and let us walk away. My husband and I really couldn't believe there were negative reviews about this resort. Yeah, the elevators are a little slow but they beat walking. How much of a rush can anyone be in when they're on vacation in Vegas? The jacuzzi didn't work one morning but the circuit breaker was tripped - that happens. The view from the window was of the parking lot, but we really didn't care. We were basically only in the room to eat, sleep, and shower. Our time was spent at the pool and being out. We had so much fun, we can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Things are not grand at Grandview”
Reviews.Author: correa1138
Reviews.Content: This was our 5th consecutive year at Grandview and our experience there has become worse in the last two years. The quality of clientele at the resort is on the decline and at this rate, the place will feel more like public housing than a resort. Extremely noisy guests, inoperable elevators, unheated pools and filthy poolside toilets were just the beginning. Security never addressed our raucous neighbors who forced us and our seven year-old to move to a different room at 1:00 A.M. The A/C did not work in the new room but maintenance person Milton responded promptly to temporarily fixed it until morning. The next day, maintenance was at our door first thing to fix the problem. Although this was the only positive interaction we had with staff, it is not enough to bring us back for a 6th visit.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely”
Reviews.Author: SandyC1969
Reviews.Content: To address some of the negative reviews: Yes, you are not on the strip, but you are only minutes away by car or bus. If you didn't know this when you booked it, then you didn't do your homework, so don't complain. Actually, it was nice to come back to a comfortable, quiet place after a day on the strip. The suite is quite large with a nice living room/dining area, full kitchen, huge double sink bathroom with shower. The master bedroom is also large with a very comfortable king bed, and with a roman jacuzzi bathtub. All the comforts of home and then some! The pool area is beautiful with two pools, two spas,and you are steps away from the South Pointe Casino that has nine restaurants, movie theaters, bowling, and of course all of the slots, video poker and gaming tables you could ask for. This resort is a timeshare. Those who have posted that it is a rip off either do not know what staying at a timeshare resort may entail, or didn't do their homework. You will be asked to take the tour and will be offered freebies for doing so. If the only reason you go on the tour is to get the freebies they offer, then don't complain about the heavy sales pitch that you will receive. It's a matter of your own greed. All you have to do is politely say no. We said no thank you, and were not ever bothered the rest of our week there. My only issue is that they will charge you $10 per day to have access to the internet from your room. This, in my opinion should be included for free. Wonderful stay, thoroughly enjoyed it.

Reviews.Title: “Did Not Meet Our Expectations”
Reviews.Author: Equity
Reviews.Content: My wife and I returned last night from a 5 day stay at Grandview. While the property has some good points, on balance we were disappointed and would not choose to stay there again. We actually liked Grandview's location far south of the strip and next door to South Point Casino which is handy for gaming, dining, seeing a movie or bowling at its 70 lane center. A car is an absolute necessity to get around unless you want to just stay at Grandview and walk to the casino next door. Grandview is comprised of several nondescript looking high rise buildings. Architecturally they are as appealing as public housing. Check in was fast and pleasant. At the end of check-in you are directed to an area close by for your "information packet" which just as easily could have been distributed to you by the check-in clerk. But the purpose of moving one to this area is to be assaulted by a predatory time share salesperson, offering you a bottle of wine and $100 to attend a Saturday sales presentation. We quickly passed on these so called freebies which seemed to anger the salesperson who got kind of snotty. Stay away from them and do yourself a favor! You don't need the $ that bad and certainly do not want to buy in here with so many better options in Las Vegas available. At the check in area there is also a room called the "members' lounge" which has the warmth and charm of a waiting area of an unemployment office. There are several computer terminals available, some of which were not operable. They were also very slow and there was always a wait to use the working ones. The units themselves are nicely furnished and equipped with a jacuzzi, full kitchen with utensils, washer/dryer, decent amenities, comfortable beds, but very uncomfortable pillows. A bad inexcusable feature were the closet hangers. These are the kind that do not hang on the bar, but have to be inserted in plastic hooks some of which were broken. I hate these things - they are cheap and tacky and clothes fall off them too easily. Plain wire hangers would be an improvement. Another problem was the noise made by the jacuzzi from either the unit above or below us. The noise was deafening and woke us from a sound sleep. Finally, what really annoyed us was that one of the two elevators in our building (Jasmine-8) was out for all but one of the days we were there. This resulted in long waits. What made it worse was that were were only on the second floor and could go down the stairs to the outside. But there was no access to the staircases from either the outside or the inside to walk up one flight. Awful design. Sometimes there were 20 or more people waiting for one elevator serving a 12 story building. This was not a minor point, but a real nuisance. There were too many issues with Grandview to really recommend it to other travelers. We found the Cliffs at Peace Canyon to be far superior, but farther from the strip. We still enjoyed our short vacation and love visiting LV. We hiked for a day at Red Rocks National Conservation area just west of Summerlin, which is not to be missed!

Reviews.Title: “If you already own a timeshare and want to stay in Vegas, this is the place”
Reviews.Author: purrmate
Reviews.Content: My husband, my two grown daughters, and my son-in-law spent a week celebrating the Passover holiday. The Grandview management went out of their way to make our stay comfortable. Everyone there was nice and helpful. We had a 2 bedroom, 2 bath, 2 kitchen, and 2 living room unit. Plenty of room for us, although my single daughter did complain about sleeping on the uncomfortable couch that turned into a bed (in each of the bedrooms, there was only 1 king bed). Since we were eating all of our meals there, it was great to have all the utensils,plates and cookware necessary. The Grandview has pretty pools with hot tubs and there are grills for outdoor cooking. Next door is the Southpoint casino and the strip is not far away, but a car is needed. I would highly recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent resort and wonderful vacation”
Reviews.Author: Pweb44
Reviews.Content: My now wife & I along with another couple stayed here the week of our Vegas Wedding in a 2 bedroom unit. We stayed here during the first week of a 2 week vacation in Vegas, checked in Apr 3rd through Apr. 10th. We were plesantly surprised to discover that the 2 bedroom units are actually 2-1 bedroom units with matching floor plans that split off a shared enterence. When you enter the door from the hall you then have a common area that has 2 more card key locked doors leading to each unit. This work well since this allowed both couples to have a full unit that included full kitchens, bathrooms, washer/dryers and living areas. When we were in the unit we could keep our doors open for easy passage back and forth while the main door to the hallway was securely shut with key card access. The units were very clean and provided everything we need to be comfortable. The bedrooms are large and had a tub just off to the side with bathroom access from the bedroom and a 2nd door off the kitchen/living area. The bathroom had dual sinks, a stand up shower and flush in a very large bathroom. We liked that the tub was set up between the bathroom and open to the bedroom. This way if my wife wanted to soak in the large tub watching the bedroom TV she could, yet others could still use the washroom or take a shower without disturbing each other. We had no issue with noise from other units, I'm not sure if the fact we were Daisy building may have been a factor as the building seemed to be a newer one on the property. We were on the 15th floor and had a great view of the mountains. We also overlooked the area they were in the process of completing another pool area that looked like it would be designed for kids to use. We used the pool area 1 day while there and it was very lovely. One of the pools was cold and being from Eastern Canada we understand cold water from the Bay of Fundy but this pool seemed too cold for our liking. It was okay once you got past the initial shock but still was too cold for our preference. The 2nd pool in the pool area was heated but it tended to be full which I think is due to the other pool being so cold. I would suggest having both pools heated in the area. We loved that South Point Casino was directly across the street and you would easliy walk there from the resort. In less than 5 mins you could walk from your room to the Casino floor. South Point also offers so much even for families, like the movie theater, bowling alley, even the spa would be a good choice if someone was looking for some pampering. My wife booked a spa treatment for our wedding day, and being a guest of the Grandview, they gave her a 10% discount which was an added bonus. My best man and I even took advantage of getting a straight shave from John the barber at South Point. The choices of places to eat at South Point are great and pretty reasonable for prices. Also the location of the resort is a little off the main part of the srtip, but being on Las Vegas Blvd your were only 5-10 min drive to reach places like Mandalay Bay & Luxor, and a few more minutes you would be in the heart of the Strip. We liked that we could visit the strip quite easliy but could get away from the craziness and have some peace and quiet. You do need a car to fully enjoy the area, but the location of the resort meant very easy access to I15 and other routes you would take to see places like the Valley of Fire or Hoover Dam/Grand Canyon trips. The resort did offer Shuttle service but it did cost around $8 a person for a round trip. Alot of other resorts closer to the strip offer free shuttle service. I believe the shuttle service is run by another company and not the resort directly but I did not use the shuttle since we had a car rental for the week. I would recommend to the resort to consider offering some sort of free shuttle service to guests. This IMO would make this resort more attractive to people that don't want to rent a car. If they did offer a free shuttle service they would only need to have drop off and pickup at a couple of places on the strip. If this type of shuttle service was available then I could see my wife and I staying there more often (then again we loved the resort and will place Grandview at the top our lists to stay anyways). Overall, our stay at Grandview was well beyond our expectation and we loved every minute we spent there during the week leading up to our wedding. We look forward to getting back to stay here again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “There's Better Places and Better Timeshares”
Reviews.Author: kewlbreezes
Reviews.Content: At check in I found the staff to be extremely courteous and helpful. It wasn't until I was directed to the lady who wanted me to sign up for the timeshare breakfast presentation when I received a chilly response. I politely declined and she became curt and unfriendly. Ironically, I own five other timeshares affiliated with the same company who owns the Grandview and told her this but she was still cold about my disinterest in THEIR timeshare property. The units here are the exact floor plan of my timeshares in Florida and look to be a less impressive version. While I got a newer unit and had no maintenance issues or stains on furniture, it looked to me like the furniture came from one of those Furniture Outlet places. The furniture in my Florida units LOOK much nicer and show more taste. But then that's just a minor issue. The drawers under the TV were installed haphazardly and crooked so drawers couldn't be pulled out. The small kitchen was adequate for two people and clean. There's a small washer/dryer in the unit and a big shower and jacuzzi tub, which I enjoyed very much. The biggest issue I have with this unit is that the walls are thin enough that one hears noises from units above and to the side. This being Las Vegas, many people don't even go to bed until 1 or 2 am and wake people like me up when they come in. Two things are extremely unacceptable here. They use a third-party company for internet service and you have to pay $9.95 a day. As someone who's already invested thousands of dollars in the properties of this company I find that to be insulting. You can get internet access at a Motel 6 for $2.99! This property is also a long ways from the center of the Strip and you have to drive yourself there unless you want to go next door to South Pointe Casino and pay $8 for their shuttle. This is also an insult. At their sister property in Las Vegas (where I own two units) they provide FREE shuttle service to the Strip. I am so happy I invested there and not here. I also forgot to mention that while the units at Grandview are a mirror of those in Florida, they do not have balconies, like the ones in Florida. Their sister property in western Las Vegas does have a nice balcony with each unit and during visits like this one (where it's 75-80 degrees) it's nice to dine or sit on a balcony. Grandview is also just too big. It's a series of high rise buildings (and looks like a yuppie ghetto) and it takes a long time to walk anywhere. I stayed at Summer Bay timeshares in Las Vegas where they transported you to their sizeable property at the drop of a hat. At Grandview they also had golf carts for that, but one could never find anyone who would drive you....and the last thing you want to do in Las Vegas is wait around. There are many timeshare properties in Las Vegas and I have traded to spend time at most of them. I wanted to try Grandview because they were pushing it so hard at the sister property. I am very disappointed in it and won't stay here again. In terms of function and comfort, just about every other timeshare property I've stayed at (seven so far) is much better. It'd be in your best interest to check them out first. You won't have a horrible stay at Grandview, but there's better accommodations available if you're interested.

Reviews.Title: “1st family vacation was relaxing and memorble!”
Reviews.Author: SMSopi-Lemauga
Reviews.Content: We were privileged to have been quests at this exquisite resort! My husband, daughter and I were genuinely pleased with the spacious and clean room, as well as the property itself. The view we had of the Las Vegas Strip was remarkable! The staff was very friendly and professional! It was our home away from home for a week, and I would recommend it to our family and friends! Perfect location away from the Vegas hustle and bustle, but yet conveniently located making it very driveable to all the attractions. And I felt very secure! Didn't bother me that parking was 1st come 1st serve and that it was difficult to find a spot closer to the bldg entrance at night. Noticed that there was always roaming security and police officers monitoring the parking lots. Then hotel security constantly walking the floors, awesome job! Thank you GVR! See you guys next year!

Reviews.Title: “BEWARE...Stay here at your own risk!!!”
Reviews.Author: AmityK
Reviews.Content: My friends are timeshare owners here. They graciously offerd to allow my fiance and I to stay at the Grandview during the time leading up to our Las Vegas wedding and over our honeymoon. We were supposed to have 4 one-bedroom suites so that family and friends (including the timeshare owners) could stay with us, but they lost the second half of our reservation and we would up with only 2 one-bedroom suites. This left many of our guests scrambling to find accommodations the week of the Con/Ag expo (Las Vegas' largest convention - with over 140K attendees). My poor sister and a friend had to sleep on the pull out couches until we could find them another place to stay. The furniture in the suites also left much to be desired. The couch in one had a large and noticeable rip, while the two overstuffed chairs in the other had a couple medium size stains (don't even ask). The coffee tables in each room also looked like it had seen better days and there were a couple of large black smudge marks on the walls in each room. The ovens also didn't work in one of the suites. The one thing that really pushed me over the edge was that the two person Jacuzzi tub in one of the suites kept spitting out this DISGUSTING black stuff. My poor friend, who was staying in that room, had housekeeping come twice to clean it. They even cleaned it using this horrible smelling chemical that drove everyone from the room (thankfully this was the day after the reception), but it never solved the problem. GROSS....This isn't something that happens from missing a cleaning just once. This is something that happens when a jetted tub isn't cleaned properly over time. Thankfully, the Jacuzzi tub in our room didn't have the same problem, but it still made me leary to use it.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable stay at the Grandview”
Reviews.Author: annedins
Reviews.Content: I was favorably impressed by the accomodations at the Grandview and found the room very clean and cozy. Loved the in room jacuzzi and the South Point Casino next door was all I wanted in a family friendly casino.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: alanaher14
Reviews.Content: Second visit to Grandview at Las Vegas and once again we were very pleased. Location for us is perfect as we prefer The Southpoint Hotel and Casino (next door) to the overdone, overpriced strip hotels/casino's. Grandview offers spacious condo's, equipped with full kitchens, washer/dryers - everything you need while away from home. Nice pools and hot tub facilities, though this year was cold and windy, and unfortunately only used pool once. I am fussy about my pillows; these do not impress me, but, overall, slept well. Across Las Vegas Blvd. is the Boulevard Grill - good menu with good prices. If you show your Grandview key card, there is a discount on your bill. Rental car is suggested if you plan to visit the strip often or to go downtown, though I believe resort does offer a shuttle. Computer Room (with printer) in reception area came in handy when getting our boarding passes to return home.

Reviews.Title: “Not Pleased”
Reviews.Author: ArmyGirl516
Reviews.Content: Timeshare ammenities are nice, but I prefered my stay at Tahiti Village over Grandview. The room here is very noisy, I can hear other alarm clocks, running water is so loud I have to turn the TV up and I can here the neighbors' conversation in the foyer. Also they don't hastle you at Tahiti Villiage AT ALL. Here I was told at check in they would give me $250 in food vouchers for a tour and then tell them what I think- since I was already an owner. I woke up early to make the tour only to be told that I didn't "qualify" because my spouse was not with me. Malarky! It is nice having South Point right across the street for dining/gambling/entertainment. The rooms look nice there too.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasure to stay here, bigger than it appears.”
Reviews.Author: oraclepr
Reviews.Content: A week long stay with two kids. Ask to stay in the "new" or "updated" rooms. Big rooms, very quiet, flat screen tv, no salt and pepper. Comfortable king bed, but hide-a-bed was useless. Had to rent a cot. Nice pools, main pool was very warm. A bit breezy at times as there are NO buildings, just open desert, to the south. A huge development, 6 or 7 hi-rises with pools and hot tubs placed amongst them. LOTS of people around, especially in the morning when the time share tours are happening. Did the tour - a bit heavy handed but received $100 (Ask for cash) Didn't bug us again. Computers available in the main lobby bldg. Very helpful staff. Games room not much to speak of - old video games and a few pool tables. Across from South Point Casino with cheap (but good) buffet. Steak and Shake was good value also. Last resort on the south end of the strip except for the "M".

Reviews.Title: “Good trip as long as you dont tour the resort...”
Reviews.Author: Ozarksbbq
Reviews.Content: Very easy access from McCarran Airport. Check-in was fairly quick. No hard sell for timeshare tour. Stayed in the Daisy tower. Nice room, soft bed, plenty of utensils and towels for the week. Washer/dryer was either unlevel or just extremely loud. Ran the master bath (not jacuzzi jets) one evening around 10:30 and the folks above us were beating on their floor and even had the nerve to come down a floor and beat on the hallway wall of our room and the outside door. I almost hit the jets in spite (note on tub to not run jacuzzi after 10pm but nothing about just water). No next door neighbors until the last 2 days. Understand comments about thin walls, luckily our bedroom was on the end of the building so we slept quite soundly. Rode the grocery shuttle to the Wal-mart Market - only groceries. The WM Market is across the street from a Walgreens and you can run across if needed. Southpoint is a short walk across the street and has multiple restaurants and a Steak and Shake. Gas station in on the corner. Outlet mall a short drive up the road. If you are looking for excitement, you are too far from the strip and a taxi costs $25 to the MGM Grand/Luxor/Tropicana area. We rented a car from Payless. Much less than competitors and even left my cell in the car upon return and they shipped it back without charging an arm and a leg. We tried to take in the sights - Carrot Top - Excellent!, BB Kings for dinner and show - very good, House of Blues for dinner - good, Memphis Championship BBQ for lunch - so good, we ate their twice!! Hoover Dam - watch for the dam going South as we missed the sign and ended up in AZ and had to turn around along with about 6 other cars... Hit Freemont St Experience which was quite interesting-never seen that many impersonators in my life - Michael Jackson x 4, Star Wars, Hello Kitty, Homer Simpson, KISS and many others. Purchased our Carrot Top tickets from the 1/2 price place and they just give you a voucher which requires you to go to the Luxor ticket box office to get your actual ticket. When standing in line, there were 2 other couples who relayed HORROR stories about their timeshare presentation at the Grandview which got them free tickets. One was kept for 5 hours after repeatedly telling them NO and the other was 3 hours and was told that they would be left at their table waiting for a supervisor for a couple hours if they did not go through the whole tour. The sales person also said something about being sorry for the couples kids since they would never get to go on nice vacations if the couple did not buy a timeshare. Grandview has the lions share of the kiosks set up to gather appointments for presentations. We were hit up probably 6 times between the Luxor (twice), Stratosphere, and a couple of other casino's that we went into.

Reviews.Title: “A Gamble at this place”
Reviews.Author: LeelowRegina_Canada
Reviews.Content: If your in Vegas to gamble, staying here is your first gamble. The rooms are OK but the walls are paper thin. You can actually hear the complete conversation of the folks in the next room through the wall. If your lucky enough to not have neighbours, or quiet neighbours ,the place is fine. Its a gamble.

Reviews.Title: “Could Not Be Better”
Reviews.Author: almond20009
Reviews.Content: Returned last night from the Grandview. This is a very large complex of over seven high buildings. We were given a very beautiful one bedroom apartment in the Daisy building on the 20th floor. Full modern kitchen, dining area and living room with a great large bathroom that had a double sink, walk in shower and a large jacuzi between the bedroom and the bathroom. Two large flat screen TV's. A king size bed that was very comfortable.The unit is furnished very nicely. We did not do the time share sales thing. The South Point Casino next door is great. It has everything you could want from a casino. We were given coupon books from the Grandview for alot of great freebees at the Southpoint. This complex is a ten minute drive to the Strip. You really need a car to enjoy youself. The best buffert is at the Silverton Casino , a few miles futher south of the Grandview. A good meal was had at the Outback going towards the strip. Vegas itself is over built and the entertainment very expensive. We saw the Beatles show at the Mirage, that was great. We received tickets from our children as gifts. I think you can dicount tickets on the Strip. We had a great time in Vegas seeing friends who have recently moved there. The best payoffs we got was from the Mirage Casino. Not that we walked away with any winnings. Our friends won over $800 at the Southpoint. I hope my comments are useful to you. I know I check out these reviews when I travel.

Reviews.Title: “More Than Satisfied”
Reviews.Author: wab123456789
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the GrandView was outstanding. The one-bedroom unit was beautifully decorated, and immaculate with everything in perfect working order. Having the SouthPoint Casino next door added to our Super Bowl weekend fun. We had stayed here once before. Without a shuttle, what made this visit much more enjoyable was a car rental. We easily traveled between GrandView, the strip, Red Rock Canyon and the M Casino in Henderson. The large staff was friendly and very accomodating.

Reviews.Title: “sweet suite - close to but not on The Strip in LV”
Reviews.Author: culinarytourist
Reviews.Content: Excellent value for money. A well appointed suite complete with fully equipped kitchen, comfortable living room and very comfortable bed in separate bedroom, laundry, jacuzzi tub. Free internet in the rooms would be nice but it was available at the registration centre. Heated pools and hot tub, shuttle to downtown, friendly, helpful, efficient staff. It's an RCI property but we appreciated not being solicited to attend a timeshare info session or to sign up. South Point Casino next door even has a bowling alley! You will need a car if you want to travel beyond the strip. We thoroughly enjoyed our week.

Reviews.Title: “Need a rental to get around, and the far South end of Vegas”
Reviews.Author: PaintedCanvas1975
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in this hotel 3 times over the last 3 years, and every single time I stay there I find things broken in the room. This time the DVD player remote didn't work, and the dish washer detergent door didn't close. My wife was also going through the channel, and stopped on a pay-per-view channel. When we went down to the desk to ask a question about the room safe (which they told us we had to pay for it) we were informed that we had been charged for the movie. I complained and told them that our bedroom remote had no way to purchase movies. I told them that if they could go to the room and show me how I would purchase it on that remote that I would pay for it. They dropped the charged. My wife also used the jacuzzi and she said that several of the jets didn't work properly. Also the cleaning crew ignored the do not disturb sign and knocked, then the following day, when the sign was still there they called the room. Totally uncalled for. Parking at night is a pain because the parking lot fills up quickly and we had to walk from the other side of the resort. When you check in make sure you stayed with them before, and don't take the half price ticket offer because you will be stuck in their high pressure sales pitch to buy a time share.

Reviews.Title: “Overall a great retreat!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Wayner76
Reviews.Content: Hi There, My girlfriend a friend of ours and I stayed at the Grandview for a week and were quite surprised. When we looked at photos, the rooms looked pretty small and kind of tacky. This was until we arrived. We were quite impressed. This is a timeshare and they do pitch you a bit but in a friendly and non-pressured way. I will say the rooms look ed absolutely amazing and are quite spacious!! Being our first trip to Vegas we loved the decor and the fact we had a jacuzzi in the bedroom if you know what I mean =). This hotel is about a 10 minute drive to the Strip and you will need to find a way to get there. We rented a car and any casino on the Strip will allow you to park for free. The awesome thing about this resort however is that there is this Casino called South Point right across the street and we thought it was the best one down there. South Point has everything!! Great restaurants, Movies, the Casino, Bowling and a couple of stores. The last day and a half we spent mainly at South Point. One other thing we liked about the Grandview was the fact they had shuttles to shop. If you have a spouse/partner BEWARE!! The prices at the mall are amazing. The only negative thing I have to say about South Point was there wasn't really a great concierge service. If you want tickets to a show you need to go through the timeshare presentation. If I can recommend something it would be to offer your customers discounts to shows. Overall a great stay and I will be back. Great job Grandview.

Reviews.Title: “Great for heavy sleepers!”
Reviews.Author: SacCali
Reviews.Content: Overall, other than being woken from my sleep due to noise, not a bad experience. Jasmine Bldg, 10th floor. Pros: Spacious rooms (a two bedroom reservation gets you two, one bedroom units each with separate entries, full kitchens, living rooms, etc..), large bathrooms, very well stocked (towels, blankets, paper towels, soap, etc), comfy beds, ample closet/drawer space, safe and secure, South Point Casino is right next to the property so you can still get your casino fix though you are miles from the Strip. Cons: I have to agree with some of the other reviewers that the walls were paper thin! I heard full conversations of those in the neighboring unit (even someone vomitting) as if they were in the same unit. Also, the sound of the heavy wooden dining chairs being dragged across the tile floors from those eating breakfast at the dining table in the unit above you will wake you from your sleep (exactly what you want after a night in Vegas-lol). They were digging for a new pool so there was some construction noise but more noise was definitely from inside the building. Furniture was old and worn and kitchen counters need upgrading. No free Wi-fi. The property itself is several miles from the Strip and there is not a free shuttle available.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Ambiance”
Reviews.Author: Liltaz34
Reviews.Content: Everything was perfect! They also have a daily activity list posted that would keep you busy. With the South Point Casino next door I didn't miss being on the strip. But, if you wanted to go to the strip, they provided a shuttle. The only down side to going in January, is no inside pool.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: VWebb
Reviews.Content: The reviews on this hotel are so mixed. I had one of the good stays. I did get the hard sell upon checking in but when I declined the meeting they were still polite to me. The hotel is pretty far south on Las Vegas Blvd, but very convenient to the freeway and I was usually pulling into park on the Strip within 10 minutes. (If you stay here you really should rent a car. I rented one at Fox at it's just a short drive from the hotel, plus they don't pay airport taxes so the total price was much cheaper!) I stayed in a one-bedroom room on the 16th floor in the Daisy building. The unit was very clean (and I am picky) and was decorated hotel-modern. There were two tvs, a fully equipped kitchen, laundry in the unit, a nice sized bathroom and a jacuzzi tub in the bedroom. The workout room is divided into two spaces one room that focuses on cardio with bikes, treadmills and elliptical machines (4 of each) and a weight room. I used the room off hours and basically had the room to myself! There is a decent casino (South Point) literally next door with a great movie theater, Seattle's Best Coffee shop, bowling lanes, spa, restaurants and plenty of gambling. The Grandview will give you a coupon book when you check in. As a side note: I am not the gambling type so I drove to Hoover Dam one day and Red Rock Canyon the next. Both are well-worth the effort. In Las Vegas I visited the Atomic Museum, also worth it. The best meal I had was at Sensi in the Bellagio - it wasn't cheap but it was worth it! I am completely new to gambling and the most helpful people were at the Wynn. By the way, I saved a lot of my own money by joining all the casino clubs and they usually gave me $10-$25 of free slot play - fun on the casinos!

Reviews.Title: “shady time share tactics”
Reviews.Author: rapalm
Reviews.Content: It angers me that I was stupid enough to fall for the street pitch, but more so that the Grandview apparently encourages & supports the whole tour fraud. We were not interested in the tour, already being timeshare owners, but the street vendor offered $500 in a gambling voucher to go on the 90 minute tour. In his defense he did say it was on 1.00 machines. The tour took up 4 hours before we were back on the street; the salesperson, Suzette was very nice; the usual timeshare crap by everyone else--the price cut to a quarter of the original by the end if you bought today. The real outrage was using the voucher at Casino Royale. When we got there they gave us 5 $100 vouchers to play on a bank of old slots, all the same slot machine, that they told us you couldn't take any winnings out of unless you hit a jackpot. This was probably next to impossible; it was obvious as the wheels came up that they had all been doctored--you could see the tape splices on the reels. I have had more hits on ANY quarter machine at ANY hotel in Vegas than the two of us did on these frauds. Casino Royale should be ashamed of itself for partnering with such a scheme, and The Grandview for perpetrating such a scheme. And shame on me for falling for a tactic like this. Both place's dishonesty, however, says a lot about them.

Reviews.Title: “Great rest away from madness”
Reviews.Author: Raidergurl1787
Reviews.Content: Had really great time at Grandview from the January 12 thru 16. Had completely clean rooms, great parking, and staff. I had nothing major to complain about but maybe just advising future guests with children that the two bedroom suites are actually two identical suites next door to each other, so was very happy not traveling with my little ones because kind of scary with them in their own area and kitchen. It has one common entry door, but still two separate suites which you can leave door open too if you want, but once again, with really little children not great. Other than that, it was a superb place, loved every minute of it, fully stocked kitchen area, and had great little store with different foods to buy. One major plus is that Southpoint is right next door, so highly recommend it for slight gambling or family time. The Strip is probably 15 minutes away, but even quicker if you jump on fwy. Got plenty of restaurants and places to visit nearby. But overall absolutely has the greatest staff at Grandview. Everyone had smiles and were more than welcome to answer any and all questions!

Reviews.Title: “Resort is good, next to South Point Casino is great!”
Reviews.Author: CanadianTravellerX2
Reviews.Content: If you will not have a car with you in Las Vegas, getting around is a bit of an issue from this resort. It is about 8 miles from Mandalay Bay, the most southern hotel on the strip. We managed by using the RTC public transit system, but it often took 45-60mins to get to the strip. When you arrive at the airport locate Ritz Shuttle service, you can pay $14 pp for round trip airport transportation to the Grandview. Cab ride would cost $25-30 each way. We looked into the resort shuttle, it has 3 stops on the strip and a schedule of times. Cost is $8 per person each way, kind of expensive and it took about 30 mins to get to the strip and an hour to get back with all the stops. We ended up using the local bus system, across the street at South Point is a bus stop for the 117 which goes to South transfer Terminal and you can catch the express to the Strip. Remember the 117 will be in bay 9 and the strip bus is in bay 14. All day pass is $7 per person, or a 3-day pass is $20. The South Point offers great affordable dining options! The also have an amazing spa, be sure to check it out. Happy hour drinks are $2! Pool was open, very nice, hot tub too. Depending on the building you are in, it's a bit of a walk to the pool. We had groceries delivered to our room by Vons, they were in our room when we arrived! At check in you will get a list of free activities, we took at free craps lesson at South Point. DO NOT get tempted by the timeshare presentation, they will book you at check in and we got suckered, it was horrible! They dangle offers for show tickets, not worth it. We ended up taking 4 $25 gift certificates for South Point, still not worth wasting a morning. The room was good, adequate kitchen, washer/dryer were handy. The sharred entrance for two rooms (unless you have a 2 bedroom) was annoying, we could hear the couple on the other side coming and going. Walls are thin, bed isn't vet comfortable, furniture isn't all that comfortable. Bathroom was spacious with two sinks. Overall, if you are okay with the travel time needed to get to the strip this resort will suit your needs.

Reviews.Title: “great location, super condo.”
Reviews.Author: sandbanks06
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Grandview for nearly four weeks, over christmas and New Year,It was a super apartment. full modern kitchen, really comfy king bed, jacuzi bath in dressing area. really spacious lounge, Two flat screen TVs one in bedroom one in lounge.Staff very friendly and helpfull. great pool area and hot tub. The southpoint Casino is just next door, so really close to restraunts buffett, bars, cinema etc. About 6 miles from strip so nice and peacfull ,but you will need a car to get around.definately go back.

Reviews.Title: “Thin Walls and floors and Loud Neighbors Tub”
Reviews.Author: OwnerofGV
Reviews.Content: I am an owner of the Grandview and for the most part I enjoy my stay when my wife and I are there. This visit was during the 2010 Christmas/New Years Holiday. We were there for 16 days so I think I stayed long enough to relay this observation to everyone. We could hear our next door neighbors alarm clock, conversations, coughs and sneezes. We had to call security to have them turn the alarm clock off since the neighbors were not in the room. Every morning and evening we knew when the neighbors above us were running the water for the tub because it is soooo loud. We also could hear when housekeeping was vacuuming the floors. Lastly, we also could hear when our neighbors above were sliding a chair across the floor and when they dropped something on the floor. Other than this, the resort is a nice quiet place with pretty good furniture, comfortable beds and a nice home style full kitchen. The staff is fairly accommodating, nice and helpful. It's a nice place because it directly across the street from South Point and they have free transportation to and from the Walmart Grocery Store, The Mall and the Freemont Experience but not the strip. If the travel was free to and from the strip and the airport I would give the resort a higher rating.

Reviews.Title: “Great Timeshare Condo Off the Strip but Conveniently Located”
Reviews.Author: Chimpt
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Grandview in between Christmas and New Years. As this was our second time at the resort, check-in was fast. because we didn't require the introduction to the resort (ends with an offer of discount show tickets in exchange for a timeshare presentation). We found the folks to be very cordial with no pressure to attend the presentation. As others have mentioned, the rooms are large, well equipped and clean. It is right across the street from the South Point casino which is a great facility. We ate breakfast at the Coronado Cafe at the casino most days (best coffee ever and quite reasonably priced compared to similar casino restaurants on the strip). We also ate Italian at Don Vitos (excellent) and Mexican at Baja Miguel's (good and very reasonably priced) at South Point. Although the resort has scheduled shuttle service to the strip, outlet mall, grocery store and Fremont Street, we rented a car to have the freedom to move around as we pleased. Las Vegas is a very easy city to navigate around and Grandview is conveniently located to the I15 interstate which bisects the city from south to north. From the Grandview to the strip hotels is just a few minutes using the interstate. Even if you travel up Las Vegas Boulevard to the strip its only about 15 minutes to the south end. All the strip casinos have large, free self parking garages that are easy to get in and out of. With a car, we were able to tour Red Rock Canyon (must do) and tour around Lake Las Vegas and Lake Mead. There was ample free parking at the resort. One of the benefits of staying off the strip is that prices at restaurants and stores are less expensive than on the strip. South Point Casino has a little store with a great selection of wines and liquors at very good prices (even cheaper than the grocery store). We were able to drive about 10 minutes to get to the Trip Advisor #1 rated restaurant "Off the Strip - Just Real Food". If you have a car it really is worth the short trip from the Grandview and also very reasonably priced. Overall we enjoyed our stay at the Grandview. We didn't take advantage of the recreational facilities or tours but we found it to be a great spot to stay off the strip expecially if you have a vehicle. The only negative was that while we were there a cold weather system blew in from the northwest. We were on the top floor and there was allot of wind noise and a bit of a cold draft via our bedroom window that made things a little uncomfortable. But other than that we would certainly recommend it as an off-strip base.

Reviews.Title: “If you want a hotel off the strip this is the place to be!”
Reviews.Author: KBHarri
Reviews.Content: We decided to try something non-traditional for the holidays by traveling to Las Vegas. We are a family of 4 which includes a 20 year old daughter home on a college break and a 17 year old son. A friend recommended Grandview and the rates were excellent so we bit. We were glad that we did!. The resort is a RCL timeshare property that rents. Our accomodations were outstanding! The one bedroom suite was quite large and comfortably accomodated my family with the addition of a rollaway bed. The rooms were clean and well appointed. There was a jacuzzi in the bedroom. The grounds were perfect and we were even able to enjoy the hot tube and one of the heated pools on Christmas Day! We would, without question, stay at the Grandview again. We were never bother with a sales pitch, The hotel offers a shuttle to the strip but renting a car was the perfect addition which alllowed us to travel at our leisure.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Change From Crowds”
Reviews.Author: flyingpineapples
Reviews.Content: Appreciated the quiet, spacious, clean rooms, free parking, close proximity to car rental return and Outlet Center. Also nice to be 15 minutes from the strip yet away from heavy traffic. Also liked being minutes from South Pointe Resort, Whole Foods and In and Out Burger. Was a bit put off by the enormous size of the resort with the impersonal lobbiless entry into the Daisy Building. We were able to see NYE fireworks in the comfort and safety of our hotel room.

Reviews.Title: “What a rip off, stay away from them”
Reviews.Author: jetrookie
Reviews.Content: in the middle of nowhere, wher you would not want to have yor home. Looks like a low class Apartment building. Thet also try to get you for their timeshare which is worthless.

Reviews.Title: “great choice”
Reviews.Author: paixful
Reviews.Content: a litte off the strip but close enough to get anywhere in vegas quickly, this was a great option for those who don't want the strip environment. family activities and tours are options every day. the rooms are huge and beautiful. only downside is no free internet. we stayed through a timeshare company.

Reviews.Title: “Great Option”
Reviews.Author: prospecters
Reviews.Content: We recently spent a week at the Grandview. We are RCI owners and this was our first RCI stay and we were a little nervous about the quality etc of the hotel. However we couldn't have been happier staying there. The one bedroom was clean, pleasant, comfortable and well equipped. This was the first time we stayed off the central strip and we actually preferred this better. We were close to good restaurants, groceries stores and general shopping so we made our own breafast and some meals which was very economical. Most large Strip resorts offer free valet parking so we just took advantage of that went we went there. With a car we went farther a field to Lake Mead (rented a boat and had a great experience) and visited other off strip restaurants such as Famous Daves (well known Bar B Que restaurant). You don't have to do the RCI sale pitch thing. Southpointe is next door with casino, restaurants, bars and cinemas. Parking is easy and there is a little store on site for buying some grocery items. If you don't have a car there is a shuttle that take guests shopping. Oh yes and you are close to the Outlet Shopping Center. Overall a great option if you want to spend less and not be right in the Central Strip area. We'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay away from the crazy strip”
Reviews.Author: GuayaquilWriter
Reviews.Content: We have a time share at Grandview and i used an extra vacation for a business/pleasure trip. The rooms are great, pools are grand and it is placed right next to the Southpoint casino. Everything about the room was great, clean, well maintained. i did have a problem with the flat screen TV. Evidently some transponder was going out and maintenance eventually replaced the whole TV. handled but a little slow. The biggest point about the Grandview is it is several miles from everything else. you have to drive a car because the shuttle that once operated is no more. in a way that is good because you almost never have any problems with loud music like you get at several strip resorts, and it is plain nice to have a place to decompress at times when Vegas gets too much. However it is well away from everything so plan to do some driving to get around.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable, clean accommodations south of the Strip”
Reviews.Author: mderaba
Reviews.Content: My husband and I exchanged our timeshare week to stay here for about a week. We had a great time exploring Vegas and having this nice, roomy condo to come back to everyday. We rented a car for the week from Advantage, which was about half the price of the other rental places. So we were able to drive back and forth, and the GPS in the car really came in handy, too. We even drove to the Hoover Dam (45 minute drive) for the short tour of about two hours, and then drove across the new bridge there that connects Arizona and Nevada. Then we took the scenic route along Lake Mead up to the Valley of Fire--spectacular! Amazing sights and rock formations, and the lake and desert views on the way were really something. It is so unlike our native Pennsylvania. I highly recommend this trip if you have a car; it makes a nice day trip. Anyway, back to Grandview. The week we were there it was a little cool, so even though the pools were open, we only used the outdoor hot tubs, but that was fun. The pool area is beautiful, with two levels and a rock waterfall in between, with lots of lounge chairs, music piped in and room to spread out. The condos were very nice. We actually got a two bedroom, which was two separate condos with a common foyer entry, so we had two kitchens, two baths, two living rooms, etc., in addition to the two bedrooms! More than we needed for sure! But the extra bathroom came in handy when we were both getting dressed to go out to dinner, etc. The furnishings were of very good quality, as were the appliances, although our one freezer just wouldn't produce much ice. Not a big deal. There were TVs in both the bedrooms and the living room, with DVD player, too. We did not partake of any of the activities, but they had a calendar of events every day with some interesting tours available. If we didn't have our own car we probably would have used the shuttle. We did go over to South Point Casino, which was nice but not quite up to the luxurious casino hotels on the Strip. All in all, I would definitely recommend the Grandview. We are long time timeshare owners, and so we politely declined the initial "breakfast" meeting invitation offered right at check-in, which was fast and efficient, and we were never bothered the rest of the week. I find after reading all the reviews on TA that most of the dissatisfied people who write have gotten sucked into the timeshare presentation, and then find they can't say no, and so get stuck taking a two or three hour tour. Been there, done that! I am of the thinking that my vacation time is just too precious to waste listening to a commissioned sales person's spiel about timeshare ownership. Obviously, as owners of two weeks at other resorts, we did at one time many years ago succumb to the timeshare presentation and actually bought, and we've never regretted it for a minute! That's how we exchange to nice resorts like the Grandview!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for Families”
Reviews.Author: jyd85
Reviews.Content: My wife and I choose this hotel because of the Reviews. We booked a 2 unit apartment in the Daisy because it is the newest building and it's located by the parking garage. The rooms were clean, spacious, and the sleep quality was perfect. The bedrooms are also equipped with a jacuzzi and a flat screen TV. The kitchen saved us more money than I expected. We prepared and ate breakfast in the unit every morning and several times we prepared lunch. The bathrooms are huge and have twin sinks and a separate shower. The distance from the hotel to strip is short and we often used I-15 to Spring Mountain Road (less than 10 minutes) unless it was during rush hour. The South-Point Resort is next door and has everything, including a movie theatre, bowling ally, Spa and several affordable restaurants. We vacation often and my Family thought this was our best experience out of the last 20 trips. I would definitely recommend the Grandview for Families.

Reviews.Title: “LOVE this place!”
Reviews.Author: Neutrogena06
Reviews.Content: My husband and have stayed here 4 times, this last trip was for a week. What a great value!!! We love the location - next to South Point. We are able to go to the strip or any of the attractions and come "home" at night. This also keeps the cost down so we can do more. The rooms have a FULL kitchen, huge jacuzzi tub, washer/dryer, and a dinning area. It's like having your own condo. We have never been pressured to attend their timeshare presentation, a simple "No thank you", did it. If you stay here, check out Stieners Pub down the street. Great food, great prices. We also enjoy Miguels located in South Point every time we go.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: pamnjoe2009
Reviews.Content: Grandview at Las Vegas is great facility for romantic getaway or family vacations. The Grandview at Las Vegas provides clean luxury accomodations within minutes of the Las Vegas Strip. Located on Las Vegas facility this hotel is a timeshare facility that offers full kitchens, separate bedrooms and living hour. The Grandview is a non-gaming facility but is located next door to a gaming casino and minutes from the hustle and bustle of the strip. They have a shuttle that takes guest to the local shopping malls and grocery stores. Staff is friendly. Check in process is timely no matter what time you arrive. I have stayed at this facility on two separate occassions for 7 plus days. Each year, I extend my stay. Me and my spouse have decided that the Grandview is our destination from here on out for our annual Vegas Trip. I highly recommend this facility for couples, friends, extended families traveling together. Pools and hot tubs are great. Gym located on grounds. Grilling area. No buffets or dining area.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Grandview”
Reviews.Author: McMaurer
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned home from a 3 night stay at the Grandview at Las Vegas. We had a great time and the resort was perfect for us. It was very quiet and the room was great with a large bathroom, bedroom, living room and kitchen. We did not really interact with anyone at the resort since we were pretty busy touring the strip and relaxing but check-in and check-out was quick and easy. The resort shuttle was fantastic. It is a $8.00 charge per person per day and the drop off is at the Excalibur, Aria or Treasure Island so that was very convenient depending on what part of the strip we were heading to. The pool was just right although we didn't use it much since it was a little chilly while we were there. Being right next to South Point Hotel and Casino is a plus especially if you are staying longer since it has the movie theater and bowling. It was nice to be off the craziness of the strip to relax but close enough to take the shuttle in. We had a great time and would recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for a family to stay”
Reviews.Author: Sometimestraveler83
Reviews.Content: The Grandview is a great place to stay if you are going to be in Vegas for more than a couple of nights. It is located about ten minutes south of the strip and is a straight shot down Las Vegas Blvd. We stayed for five nights and it was like renting a little apartment in Vegas. We traveled with three children, ages 15, 3, and 1. We stocked up the kitchen with items for breakfast and lunch and only ate out at dinner, saving a ton of money. The kitchen had everything we needed to cook and feel at home. I can not even begin to express the wonderful feelings having a washer/dryer in the unit, especially with two small children. My husband and I took the bedroom with our little one in her pack and play, my older two slept on the fold out couch in the living room. During the day we went out and did family activities and at night my husband and I took the shuttle to the strip. I felt very safe having my oldest watch the younger children while my husband and I went out, I would not have felt nearly as comfortable in one of the big hotels on the strip. The shuttle was 8.00 per person for the night, but well worth it to have a safe ride back to the resort and a taxi is much more expensive. The last shuttle returning to the resort was at the Excalibur at 1am, so not too early at all. They did have someone come tiddy up during the middle of the stay, but this is not a hotel so do not expect maid service daily. We really did treat this as our own little apartment and it did feel very much like home. The local stores such as Walmart and various grocery stores are less than five minutes away, and you can save a ton of money by stocking up the kitchen and also purchasing anything you may have forgotten (like sunscreen) from Walmart versus over priced gas stations or the 7-11. We stayed in the Daisy tower, which is the newest, and it was beautiful. The decor is very upscale and comfortable. The DVD player in the room was great for keeping the children occupied. The pool was also very fun and a lovely place to lay around for an afternoon or two. My husband and I did go on the "tour" for tickets to the Tournament of Kings and also $50.00 in chips at the Excalibur. We are timeshare owners at another resort, so we know what to expect and are pretty much professionals and saying no. As long as you have thick skin and understand they are just doing their job, its worth the 90mins. They will promise you the world, but we all know about ocean front property in Arizona ;) Overall it was a great stay. It can not be compared to the larger hotels on the strip because it is a completely different experience. If you are going to be in Vegas for a few days or a week this is a great place to go and feel at home.

Reviews.Title: “They have thin walls.”
Reviews.Author: DazeofOurLives
Reviews.Content: The apartments are OK, not too old, and eveything seems well maintained. The staff are nice and there's shuttle services to lots of places, and there's lots of restaurants next door at the Southpoint casino.
