The movie theatres at Southpoint provide half price tickets for the first matinee session each day - which is great. The slightly odd part is that the walls between apartments are extremely thin. When I'm in bed I can hear the occupants of the next apartment snoring. At first I found this to be a little off putting and rather intrusive, but I've been here several days now, and I hate to admit that I now seem to have been conditioned to the thin walls and the snoring. I find the gentle repetitive snoring noises from next door kind of lull me to sleep. I also find myself getting anxious if there is a break in the snoring - for some reason I can't get back to sleep until it resumes. I guess it would be better if the walls weren't so thin. I mean really, that's just way too thin. Therefore I'm going to have to give a lower overall rating for this property.

Reviews.Title: “Great place if you do not want to stay on the strip”
Reviews.Author: freezing_need_sun
Reviews.Content: We booked room/flight online through expedia. Checked in to Grandview with no problems and we weren't approached about a timeshare presentation even once during our stay. The room was great - It is so nice to stay in a suite with a full fridge and nice big bathroom wtih two sinks. We were in the Iris Building, which was close to South Point, literally a 2 minute walk. King size bed was super comfortable, on the soft side which we like. Pillows were nice and fluffy, sheets were clean. Never used the pools, so cannot comment on them. Buildings were well maintained and clean. We were offered a cleaning after our fourth night, but refused as we didnt require it. We used the washing machine and dryer quite a few times and they worked great - so nice to have clean clothes on holidays! I paid for the wi-fi for three days (24.95) and it worked without issues. Also used the business center to print off boarding passes for our flight home. The only negative we had was location - it took 20 minutes to drive from the strip to Grandview, so as long as you know that before booking and are fine with it, you will love this place. We like to stay off-strip, but not quite that far.

Reviews.Title: “Large place, great room and laundry too”
Reviews.Author: serenasun32
Reviews.Content: This was a great stop with South pointe casino next door (we didn't get to use it) and a large suite. TV in both rooms, washer and dryer, kitchen area. Would be great for a family although we didn't hear any while we were there. Mostly older people around the pool and that was great. One jacuzzi seemed to have stopped working, but other one was great. Room cleanliness could have been better. Our clean out of the shower feet soon got dirty on their floors, but sheets were fantastic on the bed,and otherwise was great. Quiet and away from the strip, but only 7 miles away to drive. Great place.to stay and they did bother us almost daily to check it out and do the time share tour. Spouse was there on business and we had already toured the place years ago and weren't interested. Great place to stay if you're there to relax if you can get over the garish room colors. I guess some might think opulence, I see garish. But we were in Primrose, not sure about others. If you don't stay in the room much it won't matter. Great wooden shades to block out the sun. Be careful in parking lots.

Reviews.Title: “Great for those who aren't looking to stay on the strip...”
Reviews.Author: guenie27
Reviews.Content: This was my second time staying at the Grandview - we stayed 7 months earlier with friends and enjoyed it enough to book it again. This is a timeshare resort primarily and we definitely saw a different in the level of service we got between our first time (when we stayed as a guest of an owner) and the second time (when we booked it ourself online). If you want the Strip experience, this probably isn't going to be your cup of tea however they do offer shuttles to and from the strip all day long. We loved it because at night it was very quiet and away from the insanity of the Strip. The South Pointe Casino is right next door so you can gamble as well as visit the movie theater or bowling alley they have there along with their restaurants. The kitchens are well equipped and there are barbeques behind the buildings so it helped us save on money for food during out trip. The pool and hot tubs are open until midnight which is one of the best things because the hotels on the Strip all close their pools very early. The resort runs many tours and events for guests, some of them are free and some have a fee. All in all, this resort is great for families and people not looking for the crazy nightlife of the Strip. It's very clean, the staff is helpful but definitely nicer to you if you're an owner. One minus is that they really don't have enough parking!

Reviews.Title: “Second time stay”
Reviews.Author: 100upset100
Reviews.Content: Bottom line we bought a time share early last year and it is a complete load of garbage.. we are told of all of the bells and whistles, they show you the best of the best and yes they are incredible sales people.. Thank god we HAD to convert our weeks into points for 2011 as I not wish to stay there ever again. They treat you like royalty while they are trying to make the sale and once you buy - well you are nothing and of no importance. They become cold and calculating..... Everyone works hard for their money and just want something special when they do get to leave their workworld...

Reviews.Title: “A bit out of the way”
Reviews.Author: stabard
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week in a one bedroom in the Sage building. The room was very clean. There was no daily maid service ( which was fine by us ) but they did alledgedly "tidy" mid stay. If they had not left a note saying so I would not have noticed! The only bad side was the whirlbath in the upstairs apartment was extremely noisy!! As was the fridge in ours! The hotel is surrounded by vacant lots and carparks. Check in was OK and we were only asked to take the presentation when picking up our car pass. We declined. The resort is way out of the Vegas action and I would say you def need a car if staying here. South Pointe Casino is across the road and we ate there one morning. The food was OK. As we do not gamble I cannot comment on the casino. The pool was small but was OK for us as the resort was not that busy.

Reviews.Title: “Not customer /owner friendly,”
Reviews.Author: knightes
Reviews.Content: We walked into the lobby to request a cab and were told to go to the casino next door! We reserved shuttle space to go shopping and discovered that it was going to the carbuncle on the backside of humanity -WalMart! We refused and walked to a nearby independent that could use the business We bought a timeshare here2 years ago. This trip we were told that we HAD to convert to point's for an additional cost RIP OFF!!!!! Then they charged us for breakfast consisting of donuts and a beverage. We were given coupons for gambling and food. The gambling coupons? Well-somehow we "lost " $50 that somebody used despite being password protected and requiring our member card The VIP desk was helpful when trying to sell something but not when we needed them We love the city but may not return to this location They rooms, however,were clean and comfortable with all the amenities we needed On returning home I intend to share my thoughts with corporate.

Reviews.Title: “Not Your Typical Stay in Las Vegas - And Still Good”
Reviews.Author: GottaRun
Reviews.Content: Appealing, clean room with kitchen, dining table, living area, huge bathroom, whirlpool tub, washer and dryer. The pools were well-maintained and landscaped. Felt more like an apartment complex than a hotel. We heard about the shuttles going to and from the upper strip and downtown, but we were glad we had our own car to get around. The walk to South Point was very easy and we enjoyed their casino and several of their restaurants. Parking was free and easy to navigate, just be careful if you get in late you may have to park further away or on the street. Since we had a car, we drove to Red Rock Canyon for a hike (beautiful! and watch for the wild burrows along the way) and CasaBlanca Resort in Mesquite, NV, for a 60-minute massage, wrap, salt scrub and scalp message all for $150 (well worth the scenic drive!)

Reviews.Title: “Not functional for long medical stays, or anything other than a few nights.”
Reviews.Author: brcscorpio78
Reviews.Content: I came to Las Vegas for medical reasons. The hotel that we had been at before had free internet service (that I found out about later in the week after my 4-month old daughter’s heart surgery). For the entire week, we had been able to post and respond to family on various popular web sites, but had only been able to stay for a single week. We had a choice to where we could transfer to, and had chosen The Grandview at Las Vegas. Part of the reason we had chosen them was so that we could maintain our communications with friends and family members on the status of our precious little girl, as we were going to have to remain in Las Vegas for another two-weeks (medical check-ups and such). After trying out the internet connection on our first day after settling in, we found out that we had to pay $49.99 per week. This was something that The Grandview at Las Vegas had not mentioned when applying for the brochure advertisements. For those of you that work online, or have important things to check out: please make sure to include (with the cost of a new smart-phone, internet service data plan, and just your valuable time that you could have spent trying to get information) the cost of The Grandview at Las Vegas’ immense internet coverage to your staying experience. Everyone has been nice, but they also feel a little TOO busy to deal with your individual customer needs. Unfortunately, they are willing to bilk you for every other service they can provide. Even though, they have a free internet lounge; it is only provided for a certain amount of hours, AND if provided to your room, would come at an outrageous charge, and even a disadvantageous time to use. They are providing a service that almost all of the other "high class" resorts (even "any class" of hotel stay) would charge.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: acwong
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a week long trip in Vegas. I had to attend a conference at Mandalay Bay and instead of paying the outrageous prices for a hotel room we decided to stay at the Grandview Resort. Luckily it is only 6 miles from Mandalay Bay which is essentially the southern part of the strip. This means that if you want to venture into the heart of the strip it is a little further. I've heard that the resort provides a shuttle that you can purchase for the day but since we rented a car for the week on priceline for under $200 we never used it. We stayed in the Daisy building which was extrememly nice. Modern decor, granite countertops, flatscreen televisions in both the bedroom and the living room, and a large bathroom with both a shower and jetted tub. It is a small walk to the pool but we didn't mind it, and I'll tell you why. Parking can be a nightmare here. They do have a parking garage but it is at the end of the resort..........and right next to the Daisy building! Being Vegas we would never come home before 11pm and there is not nearly enough parking spaces for the number of rooms they have, hence the need for a parking garage. So we figured it was the lesser of two evils to be closer to the parking garage than the pool. We would rather have a short walk when we come home after a late night than a short walk to the pool. But alas, only our opinion. The room itself was very clean and they provided you with many items I wish we knew so that we didn't pick them up at the store. We stopped at the grocery store before checking in. They give you several coffee filters, a package of coffee, dishwasher soap, and one load of laundry detergent. They don't give nearly enough shampoo and conditioner so I would pack more of that as well as body soap. For the ladies, they do have a hairdryer so you can leave yours at home. The full kitchen has all the silverware, pots and pans, and cooking utensils that you need including a microwave and full fridge, as well as a dishwasher. Not too much more I can mention about the kitchen. The king bed in the bedroom is extremely comfortable, and I looked forward to falling asleep between the sheets every evening knowing that I will be getting a good night's rest. The pull-out bed in the living room couch does have a thin pad and so not as comfortable for those sleeping there. Checking in was fairly simple but beware if you don't want to take a tour. After hearing some of the other reviews here we decided not to take the tour and save ourselves from a possible headache. After you check in they direct you to the place to get your parking pass. This is also the place they try to get you free or discounted show tickets in exchange for a resort tour. If you don't want it then just politely refuse and ask for your parking pass. They will try to pressure you a little but if you stand firm then they will just give you your pass and walk away. This is also the place we got a coupon book for the Southpoint Casino next door and VIP passes for nightclubs. Make sure to pick up some of those because they're free! We saw two shows there, Matsuri at the Imperial Palace and Blue Man Group at the Venetian. Matsuri is what I would call a stripped down Cirque du Soleil show. All the performers are Asian and seating is done by tables. Our family got a front row table and had an amazing view! It's basically a show of dancing, feats of strength, agility, and balance. Not as big a production as some of the other shows in Vegas but a good one none the less. My 7 year old nephew was even called up to help perform a trick. I'm sure it's just a gimmick to get you to buy a photo or two (which we did!) but he did have a good time and you can't put a price on that. All this for only $45 bucks a ticket, but we did find a discount online. The second show we saw was the Blue Man Group. To tell you the truth, I wasn't as impressed by this show. I may have had higher expectations but it basically boils down to 3 bald men painted blue making some music with PVC pipes and their band as well as making a mess with paint. Don't get me wrong, it was enjoyable to watch but I did get bored more than a few times. I just don't think it was worth the $80 bucks we shelled out for each ticket, and this was discounted online! All in all it was a great place to stay and we really didn't mind being a little further from the strip. I'm sure there are some people who would love to stay in the strip, and we would too, but I just couldn't justify spending all that money for one of the strip resorts. I'd rather save that for a good meal, shows, or GAMBLING! They do have a free business center where you can look up stuff to do and print boarding passes but you only get 20 minutes so beware of your time. We almost got timed out buying our show tickets. If you want wireless you have to pay for it but if you have a smartphone look to see if you can tether it to your laptop. Luckily we could with our phone and could play on the internet in our room. Vegas is a fun place to be and there are MANY things to do there and great food to eat. We do plan on coming back many more times and hope to exchange here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not plush, but roomy, clean, convenient and economical!”
Reviews.Author: ljjl19
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for an economical choice, with lots of room, full kitchen with laundry in room, four swimming pools and a 3-minute walk to South Point Casino, this is the place! Grandview is in the process of being renovated (nine buildings in all, renovating one building at a time). The Grandview is located on Las Vegas Blvd., approx. 6 miles south of the main strip area. There is shuttle service available for a fee, however, if you plan on travelling up and down the strip and you are more than 2 persons, it's probably worth renting a car.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: riviera450
Reviews.Content: we have stayed in many hotels in vegas over the 8 times we have visited there and i can say without doubt this is the best by far the staff were very helpfull the room was exceptional we had a 1 bed with full kitchen everything you would need was there and in immaculate condition in fact it was the cleanest place we have stayed in we were in the iris building overlooking the strip and southpoint casino we are going to stay there again and would highly reccomend this property the staff were wonderful and very friendly and no pressure from the timeshare people we were asked if we would like a tour on arrival we declined as we already own a timeshare with RCI and we were not approached again there are free courtesy busses available we had a car so didnt use them but we spoke to people that had and they were all pleased with the service provided again we would highly reccomend this place as the place to stay in vegas

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful condo unit away from the Strip”
Reviews.Author: scarlett329
Reviews.Content: Let me first say that this is not a hotel. It is a condo resort for timeshare owners. And as such you are always passing groups of 2-5 people being shown around by sales people showing them around the resort. If you don't mind walking around them while they are giving their schpeel on the sidewalk then you will be okay. That being said it is a far better value for the money than just a hotel room since it has a full kitchen, lounge area and a separate bedroom and bathroom. Others have posted pictures and our unit was almost exactly the same so I won't go on about that. It was all very very nice. FYI, We stayed in the Sage Building which is closest to the registration office, the pool the deli and fitness room if anyone cares about that. What I do want to mention is a couple things that might be of interest. First of all in OUR case a 2 Bedroom unit consisted of (2) 1 bedroom units that adjoined. That was fine for our party of 5 ladies since we then had 2 kitchens, to living rooms, 2 bathrooms etc.. Identical units. One room from the hallway opened up to a small foyer that had 1 door to the left and 1 door for the unit on the right. Like I said it was fine for us...BUT for those traveling with small children and thinking that the children will be in an adjoing room to the parents this might be an issue if they reserved a 2 bedroom unit. There is only 1 bedroom per unit and a sleeper sofa in the living room. So just wanted to point that out for anyone looking to stay here and save you any inconvience. Secondly this is a condo resort so there is no onsight restaurant only a deli. The South Point casino is within walking distance and has everything you could want, restaurants, bowling, bingo, casino, spa and 16 screen theater but...it is the only game in town within WALKING distance. We spent a lot of time there. Plenty of penny slots and great ice cream! :) Aproximately 1 mile down Silverado there is a Walmart grocery store and many places to eat. The Del Taco on the corner of Silverado Blvd. and Las Blvd. had $.39 cent tacos! We found that to be so funny because for $3.90 we got 10 tacos! and they were good. Another tip is that on Las Vegas Blvd. going towards the strip on the right is the Las Vegas Blvd. Outlet Mall. Now you may tend to not notice it because they are doing construction on the outside and all you see is a lot of scaffolding and the mall is indoors. It's worth it to go in there. There are a lot of stores inside and I would imagine in the summer it would be great to get out of the heat while shopping as opposed to some of the outlet Mall elsewhere. Also, NOT inside the Outlet Mall but rather outside of it in another little plaza is a Disney Outlet store. I found some great souvenier bargins in there if you're interested. So in short my review of the Grandview is very positive. It IS about 8 miles from the strip so you will need a car and I would recommend to family and friends to stay here!:)

Reviews.Title: “Great resort”
Reviews.Author: Gizzie
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Grandview the first week of October. It's a little further from the strip than I anticipated, but we had a car, so wasn't a problem. We loved being off the strip, yet having South Pointe right beside us. Best of both worlds really, I could take the car and shop (location is close to the outlet mall), while my husband went next door to gamble. Or if we wanted to gamble and drink, just had to walk across the street. South Pointe is a really nice casino - lots of great places to eat, movie theatre, etc. When checking in, we were assigned the Jasmine building, but upon looking at the suite, asked to be moved - wanted to be closer to the main pool and South Pointe. We were then moved to the Sage building, and although older, we really liked the location. We found the staff very friendly and helpful, and we were not approached with the time share spiel at all. There were alot of timeshare people touring though. Room was very nice, large and clean, we didn't hear any outside noise, other than when the cleaning staff was next door. Bed was comfy and the bathtub was huge! The pool area was very nice, we spent almost every night for an hour or so outside, swimming or in the hot tub. (yes, only the 'top' pool is heated - not sure why they all aren't?) The trees were all nicely lit up, made for a nice atmosphere. The weekend was much busier than during the week, but we never had problems finding parking spaces. We have previously stayed at the Jockey Club on our trips to Vegas, but enjoyed the 'resort' atmosphere and location here better. Would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay”
Reviews.Author: cardyfamily
Reviews.Content: It was our silver wedding, so we stayed here for 2 weeks, we came with my parents so we needed a car to get around which my dad drove. The casino next door called south point is excellent, food and service there is great, we stayed at the grand view in a two bedroom appartment in the iris building on the 10th floor with a lovely view of the strip when its all lite up. We also did the bus trips which the resort put on to different places at night, we did fremont street, circus circus, rio, it was great as we didnt have to fight with the traffic.We also went to a old cowboy town near the red rock cannnion with cowboy stunts,hangings ect, really good place to vist during the day.Over all a brilliant holiday. and thats why we have already booked for next year...... BRILLIANT PLACE TO STAY FOR PIECE AND QUIET.........

Reviews.Title: “Great off the strip place to stay”
Reviews.Author: kannika092
Reviews.Content: We spent 7 days at the Grandview. Had a 2 bedroom, which was perfect way to share a vacation with friends. As we each had our own "condo" we could have as much privacy as we chose. The condo itself was very nice, clean and upscale. We were not "harrassed" by anyone to buy. We simply said we were not interested. Anyone who goes on a sales tour for the gifts needs to know that it is generally a long day and not worth what they are giving you unless you are really interested in buying. The only problem was the bus to the strip. It wasnt clear before we got there that there is an $8./per person/per trip charge. You need to know that to plan accordingly. Would go back to the Grandview again.

Reviews.Title: “home away from home”
Reviews.Author: StacysOhio
Reviews.Content: The reviews are right concerning renting a car during your stay but the Grandview was a home away from home for us. It is very comfortable and clean. Everyone we came in contact there was very nice. We wanted away from the main strip during our down time and was able to do that in our apartment like atmosphere. Bought the groceries we needed for the week, and packed lunches for the hikes in the dessert. If you don't want in the middle of 24 hour action then this is definitely the place to stay. We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Las Vegas is the place to be”
Reviews.Author: sarsar29
Reviews.Content: The check in was a little problem but was quickly sorted as we were tired after a 10 hour flight! Very busy hotel but wat i liked was how nice everyone was at the hotel from staff to all the guests. Hotel room was very good with everything you needed. My only drawback of the hotel was the swimming pool which should be bigger for the size of each tower block. The hotel is about 7 miles from the strip but runs a shuttle every hour from grandview costing 8 dollars a day to use as many times as you wish for that day. Overall i really enjoyed my stay and is already planning a trip back

Reviews.Title: “Good 3.5 star resort - On the lower end of a RCI Gold Crown resort”
Reviews.Author: Raptor12345
Reviews.Content: This is a good resort but i shall rate this at a 3.5 star level and not at 4 or a 5 star. I think this is on the lower end of a RCI Gold Crown Category. Following are the reason why: (1) The refrigerator was not making ice..the maintenance crew had to replace the ice making machine..but it took him 2-3 iterations to fix it. (2) The sofa bed had a crooked leg. This made the torso higher than the head when one sleeps (3) We stayed for 1 week but the cleaning crew was only complimentary for 1 day per week and that too Tidy cleaning...we had to ask for new towels and linens from the cleaning lady...this is not expected from a Gold Crown..even Motel 6 provides everyday cleaning and new towels everyday. The resort personnel were very helpful, nice and prompt in responding to any request. However, the key is that there should not be a scenario to even make those basic requests. (4) The pools are very good. But it will be nice if there were some resort hosted activities at the pool. eg: Water volleyball, some fun kids games, etc. (5) The kitchen was well equipped. But the utensils were not non-stick. If you are fond of cooking, then this could be a pain. (6) The pool had non-stop supply of towels. So that was a very good feature. (7) We had a jacuzzi in our room. So this was good. (8) No free internet. (9) Good rate for the amenities provided. So I shall definitely rate it as a hidden gem. The items mentioned above are minor but when a resort is rated as a Gold Crown, these are minor details which needs to be taken into account. I will again stay at this resort. However, just the mind frame will be a bit different.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely coming back!”
Reviews.Author: xcalgal
Reviews.Content: Myself and two girlfriends stayed @ the Grandview over the extended Labor Day weekend and absolutely loved it! We were in the "Daisy Building" , 7th Floor. We had the 2 bedroom room, which is actually two, 1-bedroom condo's that open to one another. Each unit is 800 s/f and beautifully decorated and spacious. We were a bit nervous that the resort is too far down the strip, but after our stay here, I wouldn't have it any other way, for any stay longer than a couple days. Two -Three days in a Vegas hotel is fine, but for long stays, having your own condo/kitchen cannot be beat. The resort offers a shuttle for $8 a day and runs from 8am -1:30am. If you are late nighters like we were, a taxi ride will cost you about $25 each way to downtown-Fremont Street. A little less to the center city strip area. Not a bad deal at all! The pool area is very nice and has music playing all day. There is a non-alcohol, deli/restaurant poolside that will also will deliver to your room. Virgin Pina Coloda's are a must! :) The South Point Casino is right across the street and offers great gambling at half of what the strip's minimum table bets are. The Oyster bar restaurant is amazing and offers 1 1/2 pounds of Alaskan King Crab legs for $16.99! They also have the largest shrimp you have ever seen...from Thailand! We ate there 3 of 5 nights! If you go see a show, go see "Terry Fator". I had never heard of him and was a bit apprehensive, but he put on one of the best show's I have ever seen in Vegas...and I have been going to LV since for over 2o years! He won America's got talent some years back. Totally amazing...I guarantee you will love it! Have absolutely no complaints about this resort at all and will be using my RCI points to come back again and again!

Reviews.Title: “HORRIBLE!!!!! SCAM!!!!”
Reviews.Author: mrsskurvy
Reviews.Content: 4 hours for timeshare...only to be told I was a horrible mother when I refused to buy from these sketchy people! They only sell by weeks instead of points. Cost is 40k, their is WAY too much people traffic in and out of this building and they have constant timeshare meetings so it's like farming cattle 24/7 in the building! Noisy, freezing, WAY too much air freshner, toilets do not flush, pushy sales people! They try to sell you the Vegas time share, but want you to stay else where due to a HUGE waiting list to actually stay in Vegas! They only show you ONE room and refuse to show you anyother room even when you tell them that, the only way you'll buy is if you can see a different room, one that's not the demo room! We were told there were no restraunts on site. No spas, none near by. This place was in the middle of NOWHERE!!! Your in Vegas, stay on the strip!!!

Reviews.Title: “Why pay double to stay on the strip when you can get a quality hotel just down the road!!?”
Reviews.Author: Hyperboy78
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a joining room in the newer block of the Grandview and the room was superb! the decoration and modern self catering equipment was more than capable of looking after a large family (massive fridge, oven etc..) there was a large bathroom with 2 sinks and a large shower cubicle, then between the bedroom and the bathroom there was a good sized jaccuzzi jet bath which the kids had great fun in! A large 42" (good quality, Sharp Aquos) LCDTV was in the main lounge and a slightly smaller one for the bedroom with adequate channels of mostly american TV. The pool was a short walk across the road to the slightly older block and was great fun for the kids with 2 hottubs and 2 large pools (one on a raised level) As we were self catering we didn't have much exposure to any of the hotels services or facilities so I can't really comment on staff or food etc..

Reviews.Title: “I will return to the Grandview”
Reviews.Author: BigWash
Reviews.Content: When I was researching places to stay in Las Vegas, the Grandview received solid reviews. Let me tell you... You can't go wrong with this hotel. The location is close to the strip. But, you don't have to worry about the constant hustling of personnel trying to get you to buy a time share. The rooms were beautiful. We were in the Daisy building and had a view of the Vegas strip in the far distance. The room was quiet and we were on the top floor. So as far as a view was concerned, you could not get any better. The hotel personnel were very attentive to our needs. My family loved the facility and I would highly recommend it for anyone that would like to have a nice relaxing vacation in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Scam, Scam, Scam!!! Avoid at all Cost!!!”
Reviews.Author: angelface1710
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were approached at the Luxor and invited to "review" a new casino that was being built (it was a timeshare presentation). We were asked for a $50 deposit and told that we would receive free tickets to sharkreef and $125 in playing money for attending a brief presentation. On the day of pickup at the Luxor, we were asked to fill out a questionnaire asking how much we make yearly. Thats when things started to get shifty. Darrin was our sales rep and he seemed very friendly and nice maybe a little crude and uneducated but we went along with the presentation. My husband kept constantly asking for the price but Darrin kept ignoring the question or saying that he would talk about it later. The Grandview is located in the middle of NOWHERE. Being 7 miles from the main attraction, WHICH IS THE STRIP, you might as well be in Alaska. There are no restaurants or spas on the property. It was surounded by empty lots. It looked dangerous and abandoned. I dont know how this is considered a gold crown resort. The 2 bed unit that he showed us seemed nicely decorated with vibrant colors. The initial price that he offered us for the 2 bedroom unit was 40 K. THIS IS WHERE THE RED FLAGS START...... 1. There was no information about the property provided to us even when we specifically asked for it. NO PAMPHLETS, BROCHURES or DOCUMENTATION of any kind 2. All of the books about the different destinations that we could trade for remained with Darrin along with everything else, EVEN THE BLUE BOOKLET IN WHICH HE WROTE DOWN ALL THE DIFFERENT PRICES THAT WERE OFFERED TO US. 3. The prices dropped from 41k at the beginning to 5k at the end. How can they drop the prices like that if they ARE SURE that the strip is going to be extended and the property is going to be worth so much money????? THEY DONT and ITS NOT 4.Supervisor showed us his name on his "business" card and quickly put it back in his pocket. Even though my husband requested it. 5. All of the agents were showing the same unit, even though they have so many units available to sell the more than 300 people that were there. MAYBE THE OTHER UNITS ARE NOT AS NICE........ We we actually interested in buying but knew that we would have to go home and think about it, so we asked DARRIN and LAMONT (supervisor) for their cards and contact info so that we could get back to them. THEY REFUSED.\ When we asked Darrin for any kind of information or brochures about the property he said that it would be provided to us by the agent that was giving us our gifts. These never came. The individual with our gifts seemed "shiftier" than everyone else. his office didnt even seem permanent. Like it could disappear withing a matter of minutes. No pictures or personal items, not even a filling cabinet. Only a computer and a desk.

Reviews.Title: “Grandview was absolutely wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: dzeedar
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Grandview on a recent girls trip to Las Vegas with co-workers. It was a great experience! We had 2 suites next to each other which was very convenient. I was impressed with the size and amenities in the suites as well as the cleanliness. The pool next to our tower was closed for a couple days due to the weather, but when it was open it had a very relaxing atmosphere. The grills and seating outside were cool, although we didn't have time to utilize them. The coffee/snack shop was located next to our tower which I thought was awesome, considering I needed that coffee to get me going after a couple long nights =) Overall the quality of the rooms was great, at a bargain price that you won't find anywhere else in Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Great resort and easy accessibility to attractions”
Reviews.Author: larkenRidgefield_CT
Reviews.Content: We recently spent a delightful week at the Grandview in Las Vegas. The resort is large but extremely well maintained. We had a one bedroom in the Primrose building and it was a bit tired as far as decor but clean and pest free. The pools were well maintained and had more than enough chairs. The desk was open 24 hours and very helpful. We were able to get directions, restaurant recs and more whenever needed. There was an internet center with a good number of computers and while the server was slow, it was free. A bus, for a small fee, left regularly for the strip and stopped at several casinos to discharge and pick up but driving to the strip was easy and casino parking is free. there were several activities per day, an activity center, workout center and deli on site. I loved being just off the strip and next door was the huge South Point Casino with eateries, coffee shops, movie theatres etc. The resort was right around the corner to the major highways and we traveled to Red Rock Canyon, the Hoover Dam and Death Valley seamlessly! I highly rec this resort of couples, children and disabled individuals. It can accommodate everyone and service was great!

Reviews.Title: “Loved Grandview!!”
Reviews.Author: traveltime00
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at Grandview. I was very hesitant due to some of the negative reviews I read. Our unit was wonderful, the staff very friendly and helpful. We were only asked to attend a timeshare presentation during check-in and received a voice message one other day and that was it. Our unit was quiet. You can hear running water from the other units just as you would living in an apartment. Only major problem we had was on the last day trying to park. You do need a car to sightsee and go to the Strip. Southpoint Casino was next door which had decent food. They have other activities (bowling, theatre, etc) but we did not use. We would definitely stay at Grandview again.

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: rabrown420
Reviews.Content: I traveled to the grandview for my 30th birthday to celebrate with friends and family. I booked 3 total units, 2 of which were for 2 weeks and it was one of the worst expireiences i have ever had. I wanted to stay off the strip for some peace and relaxation but i had barley any relaxation. There were a number fo times that my key was deactivated mysteriously and there were cockroaches in the room, understandably its the desert and that is part of vegas in the summer but when you know they are there maybe you can try to treat for them so its not so gross to have them in your unit! the property is so large its hard to find parking along wiht the issues that my guests had in order to not have there keys deactivated and told it was something i did....not the answer they should have given when i checked in and told the woman at the desk to make sure there would be no issues for them. I will say i will never stay at this property nor will i ever buy into it! Next time i go to Vegtas i will stay in the worldmark units, it was my first pick for this vacation but they were booked for the dates I needed

Reviews.Title: “Location only negative”
Reviews.Author: islelvr
Reviews.Content: Great resort and time share, just wish it was closer to The Strip. You must have a car at this location to enjoy the area. I had a 2 bedroom, sleeps 8, which was two separate units with a common entrance. Each unit was a 1 bedroom with sleep sofa in the living room. The resort is continuing to grow but I didn't notice noise from any construction in the back area of the resort. The pools looked great, I didn't use because was on the go most of the time. Next door is the South Point hotel, casino and spa which was having a celebration the weekend we arrived for their expansion. Grandview has some coupons for the casino that have discounts on play, spa, etc. Free wine bottle with dinner at buffet was one we enjoyed! Food at the buffet was very good and ate there 2 nights. Also went to The M casino and hotel which is a few miles away and it was top notch. The Strip is over 7 miles away. Liberace Museum is a blast for boomers. Hoover Dam is also worth the time, just avoid in summer. Was 122 the day we went which all but melted us! If you do decide to visit Las Vegas in the summer, carry water with you anytime you will be outside, even walking The Strip.

Reviews.Title: “Nice apts but noisy and not as clean as it could be; far from strip”
Reviews.Author: MeTravelBug
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 5 nights. Bug issues in the middle of the night; called front desk and engineer was there within 15 minutes. He was very very nice and called exterminators to come in the next day. Other staff ranged from nice to unfriendly. Room was not as clean as it could have been, and midweek "tidy up" left a lot to be desired - they didn't even pick up trash that had fallen to the floor or address a stain on the floor that had been there since we checked in. Rooms are very nice however; large apartments that are accurate to pictures, spa-bathtub a special treat. But you can hear everything from above and around you, because of the tile floors. Chairs being moved above sound like elephants; loud gushing noise from water; can hear people talking through walls as if they are in the same room, etc. Bring earplugs! Gym was crowded and small. Pool area okay; smaller than I thought it would be. As other reviewers have mentioned, this place is far from the strip. Rental car highly recommended. But all in all, I would recommend, as long as you know before you go!

Reviews.Title: “great time, beautifual location”
Reviews.Author: traveljunkie0808
Reviews.Content: Just got back from LV and stay at the Grandview. These condo's were amazing. Very spacious, updated, clean, and included all amenities. The pools were sooooo nice. I believe they are salt water which was really great. Plenty of seating and tables. We had lunch there every day. Also they have an activity center with great activities for adults and kids. The casino next door is really convenient and the amenities there are really nice. The gambling wasn't so bad either - but the slots are tight. Some reviews have complained about thin walls, I didn't really notice this. Also some reviews complain about the time share push - I didn't experience this either – but I heard you get free show tickets for hearing the 90 min presentation, so that’s not bad. I towed a boat and jet skis and had no trouble with parking. Another plus was the staff very helpful and the crowd at the hotel was very nice. Very family orientated. Overall I would highly recommend staying at this resort.

Reviews.Title: “Nice suite off the main strip, good restaurants local”
Reviews.Author: JAOntario
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Grandview for 1 week through a friend's RCI Timeshare rate. The suite was very spacious and clean. We really liked the suite setup, it is great if you go with another couple/family, you each have a suite with a common entrance so you are close to each other but still have your privacy. I think you do need a car to be able to come and go as you please as I'm not sure how far the city bus goes and the resort trips are limited. The only negative thing is the Timeshare speech/tour, but compared to other reviews, I think we had it pretty easy since ours lasted about 2 hours. They were rude and dropped you like a hot potato when you declined all of their wonderful "deals". We stuck to our guns and didn't join the timeshare and as promised we did get $100 worth of certificates of our choice. In the future we would simply decline, our time is more valuable than free things. A couple of restaurants to try out in the area - The Bootlegger Bistro, just up the road (they gave us a coupon at registration and we got a free bottle of wine) and Roma Grill on Eastern Ave. - not too far away if you have a car, homemade Italian food that melts in your mouth along with great priced martinis. Laura at the tour desk was very helpful and efficently arranged a day trip to the Grand Canyon for us. Long day but worth every minute and dollar! Also, I have read other reviews stating parking was a challenge but we didn't have any problems in this regard.

Reviews.Title: “Run!”
Reviews.Author: RachD0620
Reviews.Content: I know this is long, but it is worth reading so that you don’t waste your time or money. Grandview gave me the worst experience of my life while I was on vacation. My husband, a couple friends, and I were staying at the Luxor and they conned us into going to a timeshare presentation for some show tickets and gaming money. I must say that the show and gaming money was NOT worth the aggrevation. First, the presentor tells you that this is a no pressure sales pitch which couldn’t be farther from the truth. He refused to tell us how much the units cost until he finished his sales pitch and showed us a unit. The units are nice but it is not worth it. He tried to tell us that if we don’t want the unit after we buy that we can just sell it and get all of our money back. I told him that he can’t guarantee that since he can’t control the market. He got upset and started to get snippy. He said that he knows I’m more intelligent than that and tried to show me some graph that he was drawing to show how the housing market never goes all the way down. (Yeah, right). Once he finally told us the price, $19,990, we told him that we were not ready to make this decision on the spot. Their finance guy came over trying to get us to buy. He asked what our jobs were and my husband told him he was in the military. So the finance guy said that he could offer us a military rate that would drop it to $13,000. He told us our payments would only be $323 with their financing which is based off of 17%!! We still did not want to buy so he offered to reduce the price again and give us 5 weeks a year. The new price was $9,990. We told him no because we refused to pay that much interest, wanted to talk to our bank, and were not prepared to make this decision. The sales associate then informed us that if we didn’t buy that day we would miss out and would never get this rate again. (So much for no pressure, huh?) He then turned 180 degrees and became very rude once he realized that there was NO way we were going to buy that day. We were escorted out to this other guy to take a short survey. He then said that he could reduce the price to a little over $5,000. We still said no. After all this, we were put in this room to wait for our names to be called so we could collect our tickets that were promised to us. We were told this whole thing would only take 2 hours. We were going on the 4th hour. We look around and there are a lot of people just standing around and all we want to do is leave. My husband got up to ask someone when we would be getting out of here. To my amazement, the guy started shouting at my husband saying that they are doing the best they can and to go sit down. It was VERY unprofessional. When we finally got out of there and loaded up onto the shuttle, we were not the only ones that felt frustrated and pressured. Everyone else on the shuttle had the same complaints. Also, to my surprise, apparently everyone got the “military discount.” There was no such thing as a military discount. It was more of a “oh, no! You didn’t buy on the first price discount.” Also, on a side note, they were not upfront about all the costs. They said that there is a yearly “maintenance fee” of $677. What they don’t tell you is that this price can go up over time. Also, you are not guaranteed a week when you want to transfer to a different resort. Plus, you have to pay to switch weeks and resorts. On top of that, you are still making your monthly payment for a property you can only visit once a year….this is a waste of money! They will throw a whole bunch of numbers at you and scribble all over this packet to try to confuse you. Stay alert and think about this…it is not worth it.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT PLACE”
Reviews.Author: Stonehenge645
Reviews.Content: We ask for a room in there newest building and it was great. A little far for the strip but the exit to I-15 is right by the resort.

Reviews.Title: “Wow”
Reviews.Author: enigma300
Reviews.Content: Wow pretty much sums up this place. Once of the best hotels I've ever stayed at. Perfect for families and friends- I HIGHLY recommend this hotel/resort. Only drawback is you will need a car to head to the strip- its about 15 mins drive to the strip. On the other hand - it is nice to get away from the hustle and bustle life on the strip too.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: GBumatay
Reviews.Content: I was expecting the typical timeshare resort - dated decor, the smell of old carpet, the smell of wet paint, plain furniture, cheap looking exterior (and interior), etc. To my surprise, the Grandview exceeded all my expectations. It began with excellent customer service and interaction from the front desk, followed by a nicely decorated interior, and then a new and well decorated room. There was a "clean" smell when I first walked in rather than the usual wet paint in the hallways that I've experienced from the other RCI resorts. Furniture were actually modern and well designed. The room felt like a 4 star hotel. The kitchen was quite inviting and well equipped, the laundry closet was immaculate, bathrooms were very clean, everything else was in great shape. All I can say is that I'm very impressed and plan to visit here again.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Resort!!”
Reviews.Author: peaceforcbt55
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a week at the Grandview and it was awesome! Check-in and check-out was quick. The business center has several computers so the wait was very minimal. The rooms are large and having the jaquzzi tub was a plus. When we needed extra towels, housekeeping was prompt in responding. I had read that parking was a problem; however, we never experienced lack of parking spaces. We stayed at the Daisy tower which is close to the garage. Having the Southpoint hotel and casino is a big plus. They have late night breakfast which is very inexpensive. You can get a full breakfast for $2.95. Although, the resort is a few miles from the heart of the strip, we found that the drive was short if you take the freeway. As for the time share, presentation, it was the same as other presentations. Just say no and they will not hassle you! We chose tickets for the Lion King for our gift; however when we went to redeem them we discovered the Grandview had distributed more vouchers than they had purchased tickets for. This was easily corrected. They simply gave us tickets to Criss Angel Mindfreak. I personally did not like the show but my daughter loved it. If you select this resort, you will not be sorry that you did. Everyone was friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet accommodations, away from the Strip, management looking to please!”
Reviews.Author: 50joanie
Reviews.Content: Our extended family just returned from a week at the Grandview at Las Vegas, and we had a wonderful time. We had a 2 BR unit, so we had plenty of room. We stayed in the Iris Building, which we liked because it had its own pool, and there were very few people ever in the pool. We checked out the main pool at the Sage building, and found it to be crowded, and lots of timeshare tours walking thru quite often. We did attend the time share presentation in order to get some gambling/meal coupons for Southpoint Casino, which is right across a street with no traffic, a short walk. The entire time spent was about 3 hours. The presentation may only take 90 minutes, but by the time you check out with the other management, it totals about 3 hours, so if you don't want to spend 3 hours, better skip it. We drove to Hoover Dam, stopped at the Hacienda Casino one day, and my mom, 85, hit a jackpot for $1250. She was quite happy. We drove to the strip often, mostly taking I-15, which made it a breeze to get to any casino you wanted. Yes, we rented a car. Don't know how much you would enjoy staying at the Grandview without a car. We visited several casinos, they are each beautifully decorated, so even if you don't gamble, check out the Venetian, Caesar's Palace, and the Paris, our favorites. We had the buffet on Monday night at the Silverton Casino, off of I-15, and if you are over 55, it is only $5. Because it was Memorial Day, everyone was only $5. The Management at the Grandview went out of their way to please. There were always several people at the front desk for assistance. We did not request a handicapped unit, but Joe, the manager, sent us to look at a couple of them, and offered to move us, if we needed to change. We stayed with our original unit, as we liked the Iris Building. Joe, also loaned us a small step stool for the week, so that my mom could get in and out of the minivan that we had rented. Joe made sure that his staff provided excellent customer service. We saw Cher, she is great, as you would expect. Also went to see Barry Manilow on the last night we were there, as we took a red eye back to the East, leaving on Saturday night. That worked out beautifully. Our rental was from Sunday to Sunday. By leaving on Saturday night, we spend the whole day at the pool, went to the show at night, and then off to the airport, and slept on the plane home. Think about that for your next trip. Great meals were at the Mon Ami Gabi at the Paris, the Silverton Buffet on Mondays, the M seafood buffet (close to the Grandview), and an especially great restaurant is the Casa Di Amore. They provide a complimentary limo service, which picked us up at the Grandview. Food was delicious, wait staff was excellent, and they had live music--a fellow singing and playing keyboard, and an 89 year old violinist who played extraordinarily. They took requests, and you could sit and listen to them all night. A very special place.

Reviews.Title: “Vacation from hell, but the Grandview was awesome!”
Reviews.Author: symbolicangel
Reviews.Content: My husband and I drove to Vegas from Oregon with my mom and our six month old daughter. This was our first experience staying off of the strip and at a timeshare. The room was great, very spacious, modern, clean, and fully stocked with anything you could want or need. The jacuzzi tub was amazing, I used it everyday. Beds were comfortable, even the sofa bed wasn't bad, so my mom said. Staff were all extremely helpful and kind, so kind in fact that when our leisurely vacation turned into a hellish nightmare (our car broke down) one of the women who worked there came with my husband to pick me and my mom up from where we were stranded and even loaned us her car so we could try to get ours taken care of. It was a disastrous week, as the car broke down again and we had to shovel out some big bucks to get it fixed, but staying at the Grandview was the highlight of our vacation. The Southpointe is right next door, which is really convenient. My husband and I prefer to stay on the strip if it's just the two of us, but this place was ideal when you have kids with you. The baby loved her first swim in the pool. The walls were not paper thin, though I did request the Daisy building, which I highly recommend. All things considered, it was a nice vacation, and definitely the nicest hotel I've ever stayed in. They have a deli/store next to the pool, which came in handy when our car was broke down. My mom and I had lunch there was day, and you can also order in. All in all, a really great place to stay, and the staff go out of their way to help you out.

Reviews.Title: “No need to look anywhere else”
Reviews.Author: lola1964
Reviews.Content: I LOVE this hotel! I will stay here and only here every time we visit Las Vegas! Very clean, very quiet, very roomy and the beds are huge and oh so comfortable. We have stayed at this hotel 3 times since October, 2009 If you are tired of small hotel rooms or having to walk through noisy, crowded casinos to get to your room, this is the place to stay. The "Southpoint Casino" is just across the parking lot and there is everything at the South point! The Silverado Steak house is the BEST!!! 5 stars. We can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful resort/too far from the strip.”
Reviews.Author: Smilez77
Reviews.Content: The resort is great but the location is not that great depending on if your a party person or not. I spent more money catching the cabs at southpoint to the strip and to the Walmart for groceries. You will definitely need a rental car. I didn't have any problems with staff trying to sell me a timeshare.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay with family”
Reviews.Author: SheilaH3
Reviews.Content: This place is so awesome to stay out with your family! Great staff! Great Service! Great Directions to getting around Vegas...Best thing is it's not to far from the strip but by the mountains!

Reviews.Title: “Great time and accommodation”
Reviews.Author: red86zed
Reviews.Content: Read many reviews before leaving and was wary to say the least. Had read about paper thin walls, no parking spots and roaches in the beds. Saw no roaches. Apart from hearing water running from shower in unit above had no issues with noise except early morning truck deliveries and their back up alarms at South Point across the street at 6am. Room was clean and comfortable for whole family, we had 2 units so this was great. Full size fridge was used constantly. Room was great, buildings clean, pools were great. Area is about 10 minute drive south of strip, we had a car all week so this was no issue for us, actually it was nice to be able to get away each night from the crowds. Kids can't wait to go back. Parking lots were in deed full but always found a spot and the lots are lit so never felt threatened. Will definitely try to go back. Timeshare sales presentation got us tickets to Touney of Kings and Shark Reef, worth it, great for the kids. Price went from 40 K to 4 within 40 minutes, no sale but will trade again to go there.

Reviews.Title: “This is why I keep coming back here”
Reviews.Author: AreWeThereYet89
Reviews.Content: Sure, it's not ON the actual strip (even though it is on the same street as the strip, aka 'Las Vegas BLVD", but even that has its benefits. It's quieter, and you can relax by the pool a lot more. There's more room, since it's a suite, not just a hotel room. here's the breakdown... There are 10 buildings in the complex, some are older than others. We were in the Primrose building. The decor theme is "desert sunset". Some people think the decor looks dated, I just think that it looks too matchy-matchy and hotel-ish. I wouldn't decorate my house like that, but when I'm on vacation I don't really care if the curtains are my favorite colour or not. Suite A and B are exactly the same. Each have a full kitchen (stove and oven, fridge, toaster, coffee-maker, all the pots, pans, plates, glasses that you'll need), a pull-out couch that turns into a queen bed in the living room (where you'll also find a TV and DVD player), and a bedroom with a king bed and a jet tub. The washroom has a large shower stall and two sinks. There are also washer and dryer sets in each suite, in a closet by the dining room (which seats 4). You have plenty of towels, and we got small toiletries when we checked in. This reminds me- after check-in, when we went to get our parking pass, we were asked if we wanted to attend a "presentation" and get cash or show tickets in exchange. We knew they would try to sell us timeshare, but we wanted to see Ka (excellent show, and by attending the presentation we got tickets), and so we went. It took just over an hour. We had breakfast while we were told the details (we weren't interested), and when they figured out that we weren't going to buy anything they just walked off. I thought it was a bit rude of them, but it's not like I wanted to make the experience longer. Of course, you have the option of declining the presentation completely. We knew what we were getting ourselves into, and it was worth it for us. Internet is available in the rooms, but it's $50 for the week. I didn't want internet anyways, I like to be detached from technology when I'm on vacation. However, if you need to check emails from time to time, keep in mind that there is an internet lounge in the lobby (free), and if you go to IHOP (it's open 24/7) they also have free WiFi. We liked to go there for breakfast or late night dining, and would check whatever we needed on our iPods while we were there. I recommend a car to fully enjoy the area. There is a shuttle that can take you places, but it's $16 per person per day, so when you do the math, it might end up cheaper and more convenient (the shuttle stops running around midnight). Cabs are very expensive around that area, so I'd try to stay away from them as much as I could. There is also a casino called South Point across the street. We went there because they have many restaurants (some open even in the middle of the night), and we got a coupon book from Grandview for $20 free slot play, free wine with dinner, etc. On nights where you don't feel like going all the way to the strip, South Point is a good place to kill some time. We didn't have any issues with the staff, they were all efficient and helpful. Overall, it was a good vacation and I am going to keep going to the Grandview every time I go to Vegas. Oh... I forgot to mention that they're planning on building 8 more buildings, so if you decide to go, double-check to make sure construction won't be an issue (noise and all that stuff). Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Janay
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Grandview for one month. We were in the Lily building. I have never seen such a clean place! Everything from the grounds to the pool area to the condos were spotless. The staff was very accomodating. I had trouble with our coffee pot, called down, and within minutes someone was at our door with a new one. There is a shuttle service to various places, however, a car is your best bet. The Silverton casino (on the shuttle list) has a HUGE Bass Pro shop, which you could spend hours in! it has something for women, men, and children. It has displays of life-size animals in their habitat! This is right in the casino. The casino has an awesome buffet on Mondays for $5 !!! Only on Mondays......long line, but really, really worth it!!! We loved our stay at Grandview and are going back again next spring!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Place to Stay off the Strip”
Reviews.Author: wepaktogo
Reviews.Content: We exchanged our timeshare week for 2 weeks in April/May 2010 at the Grandview through RCI and this is the second time we have stayed there in two years. If you want a place to relax and not be bothered by mega crowds on the Strip, the Grandview is definitely the place to stay. It's clean, very comfortable, within 15 minute drive of the Strip and within steps to a lovely Casino across the road (South Pointe) and 10 minutes from the Airport. We had a two bedroom unit (2 one-bedroom units next to each other with a common vestibule) which worked out perfectly. All units are fully equipped - we especially loved the washer and dryer. Would recommend the Daisy building as it's one of the newest and very nice. Lots of parking spaces available including covered parking. As for the people who complain about the timeshare sellers - just say NO thank you and walk away. If they follow up with phone calls, just say NO thank you and put the phone down! We only had one complaint - one evening there was a knock on our inner door. A young couple and a baby were in our vestibule looking for some friends. They had only knocked on the door because they could hear voices inside. I asked them how they had got into our vestibule as the key card to our suite is only supposed to open the main door and our inner door. Apparently the check in clerk had coded their key card to our rooms. I immediately 'phoned down to reception to complain and asked for an explanation, bearing in mind that the couple could easily have opened our door and walked straight into our unit. The clerk at first insisted that the person must have been maid service or a maintenance person. I told him that I knew the difference between a young couple with baby and maid service/maintenance. No explanation was offered and the clerk could not have been more bored or uncaring. On checking out, my husband again mentioned the "unexpected visitors" to our suite and asked to speak to the person in charge of the front desk. This lady (sorry, have forgotten your name) apologized and said she couldn't understand how this error had occured. My husband told her that when I had 'phoned the front desk no-one had cared and no apology had been received from anyone! Apparently the front desk should have immediately implemented a "key check", but again we were never told of the outcome and heard nothing further. Very upsetting and scary to think that strangers have been given access to your suite and no one could have cared less. Definitely NOT good security. Apart from that scary episode we had an enjoyable time and will probably stay at Grandview again, but will definitely be buying one of those travel door locks for future visits!!

Reviews.Title: “Great timeshare, crappy location”
Reviews.Author: Aaron_kristen
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here now 3 times. We really like the resort/hotel/timeshare itself. The rooms are decent, the pool/gym are adequate. However it is a ways south on the strip. If you have a car, no issues, if you don't, kinda sucks. Good or bad depending on how you look at it with being away from the center of the strip action. We like it, are a mid 30's, and love it as a home base. Can come home after a day of siteseeing/shopping whatever and then go over to the South Point next door to get our gamble or booze on. positive experience again overall. One garbage move though is that no wireless internet in rooms. That and the public computers don't allow pdf files to be viewed. So when i wanted to print my airplane tickets and six flags passes, i had to take my laptop down to the room, unplug the internet from the desktop, plug it into mine, etc etc. pain in the butt. other than that, good times

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: cityblue1966
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a week at the Grandview in Sept 2009, it is by far the best resort we've stayed in ever. We stayed in the new building on the 7th floor, the unit was very nice- comfy sofa & bed, large shower, good flat screen TV's in the lounge and bedroom, fully stocked kitchen utensils. The location is 10mins away from the main area of hotels on the strip which we really liked as the strip can be a bit chaotic and quite intense so we really liked the peace and quiet! The only downside is that there is no restaurant on site, the large Southpoint hotel next door has loads of food outlets if you didn't want to drive out to somewhere. we didn't use the pool but we did go for a walkround and it seemed a bit small but it was very quiet with one a couple of people in and plenty of sunloungers. We were there for a week and didn't get bothered once about the timeshare sales tour which was good.

Reviews.Title: “Another Great Experience!”
Reviews.Author: RedWing11
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a week at the Grandview last year - loved it and went back for a week this year. PEOPLE, PEOPLE - if you don't want to do the timeshare speal - DON'T! We didn't do it last year - or this year - simply say NO. We own a timeshare at a different location (we traded - RCI) so we were not going to buy another - and we were not bothered either year. Our room was as nice as last year - stayed in Iris Bldg. last year and Lilly Bldg this year. We love South Pointe Casino next door - and you can actually WIN there as compared to the Strip! They have everything there - even a bowling alley - and movie theaters - tequilla nights were a blast - for $2, and $.75 hot dogs. My husband says the waitress's are the hottest ones in Vegas! We own another timeshare in Vegas but continue to use this one everytime! The only thing I would say is that they could upgrade to flat screen TVs and free WiFi would be nice.

Reviews.Title: “Worst experience ever”
Reviews.Author: kmckenz
Reviews.Content: This place is physically very nice. It's really cheap for what you get, but the reception staff are clearly the bottom of the barrel. WIth so many awesome people doing awesome in similar positions on the Strip, I guess it makes sense that someone has to accept a lower level of emplyee. Having said that, I was astounded with how un-helpful these people were. From the scowling lady who checked us in, to the security staff, to the harassing phone calls we received every morning to come to a sales pitch meeting. I have stayed at the South Point Hotel across the street and would recommend it highly to anyone consedering The Grandview. It is a shame that such a beautiful property can be ruined by incompetent staff. I will never stay here again. EVER!!

Reviews.Title: “Suckered into timeshare presentation - here's what they do”
Reviews.Author: robbme
Reviews.Content: Be aware of the assembly line production that they have for luring people into the timeshare. There were at least 4 counters located within the Venetian, where they ask you f you're married and want tickets to certain shows for low to no cost as long as you go to a no pressure presentation of the Grandview. We thought that since the average cost of Blue Man Group tickets were about $140, it would be worth our time to spend 2 hours to listen to what they had to say. We even had to put down a $40 deposit with the promise of getting $20 back plus the tickets. We drove there, and I'm glad we did. We found that there was little to no parking, with no clear building descriptions laid out for people driving in for the presentation on their own, so we found a parking place and walked - all over, until we found where we were to be. After being introduced to our personal attendant, we were whisked over to a room with others and closed in while we viewed a video and listened to the benefits of owning a timeshare. Then we toured the newest building and amenities and told of the casino industry's plans to expand the strip out to this area within the next few years. We then were brought up to the 2nd floor of the original meet 'n greet building, to have a sandwich and get the first timeshare offer - I think it was about $41k. All this time, we were in awe at the amounts of people hoarding in for these presentations We explained our financial situation and was told that even those with terrible credit have qualified for their services. We kindly declined the offer and told them we have a timeshare already with another company and she wanted to know everything and then compared it to their plan. We told her again that we couldn't do anything and she dropped the price. Then she brought a nicely dressed facts and figures guy over who tried to convince us of the benefits and we again declined. He then tried to divide the timeshare into one room instead of two and do it for half price. Our same argument applied and he tried to lower the amount and timeshare offers again. By this time, my hubby was getting annoyed at the continuous offers and told them "no means no." They then said thank you and told us they would let us out. As we went through to another room, the attendant then "recognized" someone that she worked with and introduced us. The new guy then proceeded to ask us closing exit interview questions, but then asked us if we could afford "this?" Upon our next no, he then offered us another deal to purchase into foreclosure units at bargain basement prices. Again, we said no. Then he moved us into another room, where we waited our turn to be allowed to leave. Finally, they called our name, verified our tickets and gave us $20 of our $40 back - 4 1/2 hours later! We were thinking about the rooms and offers they made to us and were considering how we might be able to do it for the future. Later that night, we attended the Blue Man Group at the Venetian (awesome show.) And, while waiting for it to start, we had a conversation with the couple next to us. They went for the same presentation the day before. We compared notes and found that they received better incentives for seeing the presentation than we did - and their tickets were even free! They too had the same experiences and ended up finding the Jockey Club next to City Center. The plans were apparently, better and the got a much better timeshare deal for their money. The rooms may not be as nicely updated as the Grandview, but they are right there, in the middle of the action and have more points and offers for much less money. Now, we have more to think about. Please be aware of how long this presentation is and how much your time is worth - is it worth it for he tickets they offer?

Reviews.Title: “For Us, This Way The Way To Go!”
Reviews.Author: MexicaliRose_1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Grandview in mid-March 2010. I think if you are going to stay in Las Vegas for a week, this timeshare resort is perfect! You were out of the hustle and bustle of the major hotel area, but also right next to South Point if you wanted to go to a casino. If you are horse people, it’s good to know that South Point has an equine arena, with various events going on. For me, that was definitely a plus! During our stay, they had a Quarter Horse Competition. They were going to have Bull Riding competition there later in the month also. Our building (Daisy) was recently renovated, and was designated as a “smoking” building; a good idea to keep the smoking units together. The living quarters were quite large, very clean, and well equipped with everything you would need for a 7 night stay. We stocked the full size refrigerator with snacks, and usually made a hot breakfast each day. It was great to lounge around the “apartment” during the morning, and not have to feel pressed to get dressed to go out for breakfast. The unit was large enough so we weren't in each other's space, like we would in a hotel room. We had a great view of the Strip, which really didn’t seem like 7 miles away, but was. Yes, I think you would need a car, but they offer shuttle services to the Strip and Supermarket. Parking was never an issue for us, and we usually returned to the resort well after midnight. One negative point, the units are a little loud. The floors are tiled, and when the people above you move their chairs in the dining room, the sound reverberates throughout the whole unit. I tried very hard not to drag the chairs, so not to disturb the people below me. Also the Jacuzzi was very loud when filling up. One morning the people above me filled up theirs, and I thought it was my BF filling up ours! Oh yes, and don't work the appliances if you are trying to sleep...both the dishwasher and washing machine were pretty noisy too! Check in and check out was a breeze, although 10:00 am check out is a little early, and they threaten to charge you over $100.00 for a late check out. But there is a lot of cleaning involved with the units, so I can understand the policy. We were asked to attend the presentation during check in, with the incentive of getting free show tickets, but we declined. We were called once again in our room, declined once more, and were never approached again. All in all, we really enjoyed our stay at Grandview. It was like our little oasis in the middle of the desert.

Reviews.Title: “Excellente!”
Reviews.Author: teanuh
Reviews.Content: My husband and I purchased our timeshare in 2008 @ The Grandview. We never used it until this year. Being that this was our first time using it we wanted to stay at our home site since everyone raved about it. Our check in process was fast and easy, being that we are owners we were guided by the courteous staff to go to the VIP line. It took less than 5 minutes to check in. We were given a one bedroom suite on the 16th floor in the new Daisy Bldg. When we entered we were in AWE at how beautiful everything was. The bathroom was beautiful, mosiac tile in the shower a full size jetted hot tub and a sit area in front of the mirror. Every kitchen had all matching Whirlpool appliances, and granite counter tops. The kitchen had every utensil, plate, pot, pan and down to a ice cream scooper is available to you. It was like being at home. We did our laundry and even cleaned our bathrooms ourselves because we felt so comfortable. Staff as other visitors were courteous and smiling. The only thing that my husband and I didn't like was paying for the internet service. We couldn't understand why you can stay at the Hilton, Wyndam, or Hyatt and get free Wi Fi but have to pay here. But I would still recommend this timeshare/hotel to a friend regardless of what the other reviews have had to say. Be sure to have a rental car, this timeshare is about 15 minutes away from the strip. Southpoint Casino is right next door with the Outlet down the street about 5 minutes away. I have not added the pictures to my computer I wish I would have I would've posted them. Trust me you would enjoy your time here. It's cheaper being an owner than paying on a daily.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful suites, inviting pools with gambling and good food right across the street”
Reviews.Author: zeewanderer
Reviews.Content: My husband, myself and 5 teenagers stayed at the Grand View for seven days in April 2010. The rooms were beautiful and very nicely decorated in rich colors. Each room has a nice double jacuzzi tub plus the other usual furnishings. We attended a fairly painless time share presentation that didn't eat up too much of our time. We got $175 in $25 certificates to use for food or bowling at the South Point Resort directly across the street. South Point has maybe 6 restaurants and most of them have pretty tasty food. We had prime rib and General Tsao's Chicken at the Cafe, both dishes were very good. Our favorite was the lunch special at the Mexican restaurant: $8.99 each for a Margarita, soup, beans, rice, and two entrees. We even splurged on a shrimp stuffed avocado. Everything was delicious and it only cost us a little more than our $25 coupon. We also tried the Italian restaurant; the crusty rolls were fabulous but the entrees were bland. The Grand View is in a great location; close enough to the Strip, Walmart, Sam's Club and many, many other shopping and grocery stores. I'd visit the Grand View again. Highlight of the trip: Red Rock Canyon visitor center and scenic drive. The visitor center was remodeled in 2009. It is a beautiful facility incorporating fanciful contemporary art into the informational displays. The drive is 13 miles but we spent 3 hours climbing the rocks before the first mile marker. Next time I'll set aside an entire day for rock climbing. Great time for parents and teenagers.

Reviews.Title: “Had a nice week there!”
Reviews.Author: kim33wi
Reviews.Content: Yes it was down from the main strip but other than that it was ok. The casino next door has bowling and a movie theater that my son enjoyed. If you don't have tickets before you go. I would recommend that you check out the reduce price ticket places that they have around. I went to see Mac king that my son really liked. (19 each), Nathan Burton (24each) and also saw KÀ Cirque du Soleil (which was about 150 for each). MY son said that he would like to see Mac King again. It’s a really good show for kids. The room was really comfortable and we didn’t hear any of the other people staying there. Check out was the fastest ever. If you check out stuff ahead you can save money and enjoyed the area. Spring break many of the good shows were selling out fast but if you go when there it’s not very busy. You can wait and get cheaper price tickets on cirque du soliel shows and also dining.

Reviews.Title: “I'm getting to be a regular here. Great value.”
Reviews.Author: buy4roger
Reviews.Content: This is one of the best managed timeshares I've been to. Some of the timeshare trades I've done with RCI over the years has made me regret I ever got involved with timeshares. But this property always restores my faith in the system. It's hard to maintain properties that are family-friendly. They usually get pretty beat up. But this place is swarming with friendly staff working to keep the place neat and tidy. Even the original rooms are beautifully maintained and current. Yes, it's a few miles south of the strip.
